security engineer.skills: Information Systems Security Engineer
security engineer.jobDescription:
Solidus is searching for an Information Systems Security Engineer to provide Cybersecurity engineering support to the Airspace Mission Planning Division, Hanscom AFB MA. The Information Systems Security Engineer's principal responsibility is successful Security Certification & Accreditation (C&A) of Mission Planning software applications, within planned cost and schedule.  These Mission Planning software applications are in use today by Air Force and Navy aviation mission planners, and operate on various DoD networks, closed networks and stand-alone systems.    Location can be at facilities at Lexington MA, or Eglin AFB, FL.

Responsibilities:
- Researching, developing, implementing, testing, and reviewing hardware/software information security requirements (IAW DoD/NIST RMF) to protect information and prevent unauthorized access. In this role, the ISSE will direct the contracting team on security measures, explain potential threats, implement security measures and monitor applications in order to meet or exceed all DoD/NIST RMF requirements, resulting in faster and more accurate software releases.
- Support the government program office's Information Assurance team with Authorization to Operate (ATO) and Authority to Connect (ATC) certifications, required for software releases.
- Hardening of Operating Systems, applications, and network infrastructure using Department of Defense Security Requirement Guides (SRGs), Security Technical Implementation Guides (STIGs), Defense Security Service Office of the Designated Approving Authority (DSS ODAA) Baseline Technical Security Configurations, and Information Assurance Vulnerability Alerts (IAVA)
- Developing and maintaining system-specific Security Controls Test Matrix (SCTM), Risk Assessment Report, Plan of Action and Milestones (POA&M), System Security Plans (SSP), Application Security and Development Checklists, and other artifacts supporting software certification and accreditation in accordance with RMF and JSIG.
- Running vulnerability scans for applications using various tools such as HP Fortify; working with software engineers to analyze the report; and running vulnerability scans for operating systems and network infrastructure using Nessus and/or ACAS.
- Working closely with software engineers supporting and troubleshooting the deployment of our software on government-provided infrastructure.
- Working closely with the Chief Engineer to establish a system security engineering (SSE) process to plan, organize and manage efforts to achieve maximum system security and survivability.
- Understanding components of, and support the development of, Security Assessment Reports.
- Working with self-signed certificates and DoD PKI.
- Working with Windows OS, SELinux, puppet, iptables, and cryptographic modules.
- Contribute to Program Protection planning, Anti-tamper planning and identification of Critical Program Information (CPI).

Requirements:
- Active Secret Clearance and the ability to obtain a Top Secret Clearance
- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Security, Electrical Engineering or a related scientific /technical discipline 
- 8+ years of Security Engineering or related experience.  
- Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) designation.
- Understanding of DoD 8510, NIST 800.53 Risk Management Framework, and CNSSI 1253
- Ability to manage and provide cybersecurity products to multiple project teams executing concurrently, in accordance with each project's schedule.  

Additionally Desired:
- Advanced degree preferred
- Experience in leading C&A processes in accordance with DoD policy, standards & guidelines. 
- Experience with the enterprise Mission Assurance Support Service (eMASS).
- Technical knowledge of computer networking and computer security protocols, and prior hands-on implementation of network and software security controls.


Applicants selected must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. U.S. Citizenship may be required. Solidus is an Equal Opportunity Employer and participates in E-Verify. NOTICE OF AFFIRMATIVE ACTION PLAN FOR INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES, DISABLED VETERANS AND OTHER PROTECTED VETERANS. It is the policy of this Company to seek and employ qualified individuals at all locations and facilities, and to provide equal employment opportunities for all applicants and employees in recruiting, hiring, placement, training, compensation, insurance, benefits, promotion, transfer, and termination. To achieve this, we are dedicated to taking affirmative action to employ and advance in employment qualified individuals with disabilities, disabled veterans, and other protected veterans. The objective in adopting the Affirmative Action Programs is to place qualified individuals with disabilities, disabled veterans and other protected veterans in all job classifications. These Affirmative Action Programs are available for inspection by any applicant or employee by contacting the Company's EEO Coordinator, in the Human Resources office, Monday through Friday, 8am to 5pm

security engineer.jobDescription:
Overview:
 Working closely with the Global Technology Operations team to ensure the security and availability of applications and data assets across DHI’s infrastructure 


Responsibilities:

Technical leadership of security owned projects and involvement in projects requiring security expertise. 
Designing and implementing security tools and process around AWS and on-prem environments.  Includes all areas of security from cloud, end-point, web, physical, network, data, etc.
Lead major security incidents to identify the full impact, root cause and preventative measures to be put in place.
Working with vendors of the many security tools in place during implementation and maintaining them going forward.  Identifying new vendors and products we want to evaluate as alternatives to existing solutions or to fill an existing gap.
Manage the identification and resolution of risks across all of DHI’s operations.  Work with development and engineering teams to help them understand existing risks and identify/prevent new risks from being introduced. 
Maintain awareness of the current threat landscape and emerging technologies and approaches which could improve the security posture for DHI’s operations.
Provide compliance and audit requests relating to security. 

Essential Skills/Experience:

Undergraduate degree in an IT/security related discipline or equivalent experience, with a minimum of 5 years hands-on experience in a production environment.
Experience or solid understanding of cloud architecture and security principles, primarily around AWS.
Solid understand of web application architecture and concepts including the OWASP Top 10.
Experience with multi-factor authentication and SSO tools such as Duo, Okta, etc.
Experience with vulnerability scanning solutions such as Nessus, Qualys, etc.
Experience with web application security assessment tools such as ZAP Proxy, Burp Suite, w3af, et.
Experience with log management and SIEM-like solutions such as Splunk with ESS.
Hands-on experience securing Windows and/or Linux systems in production environments.
An understanding of database technologies including traditional RDBMS as well as NoSQL databases and object stores running in AWS.
Strong interpersonal and collaboration skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Security qualification(s) such as CISSP, SANS GIAC/GSEC, CEH.

Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/D/V


Background Checks Required

security engineer.jobDescription:
We are currently seeking a Security Engineer to join GuideStone s Information Technology team. This position will help define and implement GuideStone s networking and security strategy using industry best practices within a variety of cloud and networking platforms. The individual in this role will work closely with our Infrastructure and Development teams to provide a highly available, secure networking and cloud infrastructure for GuideStone s external customers and internal employees.

What you will do:
Design and implement physical and cloud based network and security solutions.
Develop DevSecOps processes and automation to support a growing DevOps infrastructure
Create pro-active CyberSecurity assessment, defense and response solutions.
Deploy and manage a diverse array of cloud and networking technologies.

Opportunities include:
Work closely with Infrastructure and Development (DevOps) teams to deploy critical business solutions.
Mentor IT staff and business partners on Cloud and CyberSecurity best practices.
Help shape GuideStone s technology path with an emphasis on Cloud IaaS and PaaS solutions.

What you will need:
Bachelor s degree in Information Systems or Computer Science (preferred)
Cisco or Juniper networking certification (preferred)
SANS GIAC security focused certification (preferred)
Microsoft Systems / Cloud Platform certification (preferred)
Applied Windows Server 2008-2016 experience
Applied networking experience with switching, routing, wireless, firewalls and load balancers
pplied experience with cloud technologies and security with an emphasis on DevSecOps and continuous deployment
Applied experience with pro-active CyberSecurity methodologies

security engineer.jobDescription:
What you'll be doing… 



As a Senior Software Engineer on the Product Security team you will be a key contributor to enhancing the security of Tableau products. This is an excellent role for people who want to both create and consult.  


Some of the things you'll be doing include…
Design and implement security related features 
Help find security issues in feature requirements, technical designs, and implementations 
Automate security testing (fuzzing, etc.) 
Invest in growing your application security knowledge and expertise 
Share your knowledge and insights with your co-workers 

Who you are…  

Creative. 
 You approach problems from multiple angles 
Curious.  
You dig into new topics and apply the insights to your projects 
Highly Technical. 
 You have C++ and/or Java experience and understand how things work 
Great Communicator.  
It isn’t enough to understand, you enjoy explaining so others can also understand 
Relentlessly High Standards. 
 You take quality very seriously, and lead by example in building automation and writing tests for your own code. You understand what it takes to write software that is widely adopted by passionate users. You love writing things that "just work" - things that are robust, scalable, and that perform well 
A True Team Player. 
 You enjoy collaborating, learning from, and teaching others so we can all become better 
You are a Recruiter!  
Tableau hires company builders and, in this role, you will be asked to be on the constant lookout for the best talent to bring onboard to help us continue to build one of the best companies in the world! 



Tableau Software is a company on a mission. We help people see and understand their data. After a highly successful IPO in 2013, Tableau has become a market-defining company in the business intelligence industry. Our culture is casual and high-energy. We are passionate about our product and our mission and we are loyal to each other and our company. We value work/life balance, efficiency, simplicity, freakishly friendly customer service, and making a difference in the world!  


Tableau Software is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

security engineer.jobDescription:
CenturyLink (NYSE: CTL)  is a global communications and IT services company focused on connecting its customers to the power of the digital world. CenturyLink offers network and data systems management, big data analytics, managed security services, hosting, cloud, and IT consulting services. The company provides broadband, voice, video, advanced data and managed network services over a robust 265,000-route-mile U.S. fiber network and a 360,000-route-mile international transport network. Visit  CenturyLink  for more information. 



- 

Job Summary 


The Lead Information Security Engineer is a member of the Information Security Governance and Risk team that is responsible for delivering security requirements and coordinating information security risk assessments to ensure compliance with corporate policy, standards, procedures and industry best practices. The engineer will work with project managers and developers to assess the security risks associated with new applications and products; provide security requirements; coordinate vulnerability assessments; and present an overall risk assessment for the project. The engineer supports the International Business Risk Program by establishing/improving processes to conduct risk assessments on proposed international activities; eliciting business requirements from multiple business stakeholders; converting business requirements to technical requirements and coordinating with project teams; and facilitating meetings with the International Business Risk Review Council (IBRRC), if necessary.  

Job Description 
Assess potential risks with new products and services and provide security requirements and recommendations for risk mitigation. 
Architect new information security systems and controls to mitigate emerging threats and risks across the company. 
Consult as security subject matter expert with network architects, engineers, and others on security solutions. 
Ensure reports and findings are delivered in a timely and appropriate manner to management, operations and executive leadership. 
Recommend new security policy, standards, best practices, and system configuration standards. Consult with internal clients on security topics and policy interpretation. 
Analyze requests for exceptions to the Information Security Policy, identify risk mitigation steps that should be taken, and make recommendations to the business for accepting the risks associated with exceptions. 
Test potential security solutions to validate features and functions, partnering with other organizations in the resolution of interoperability issues to obtain successful integration of security solutions across all platforms.  
Understand new laws and regulations and provide consultation, recommendations, and implementation advice to the organization. Make necessary adjustments to the Information Security Policy. 
Coordinate activities across multiple departments and business units. 

Qualifications 
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field, or 8+ years of equivalent experience. 
Experience in performing security risk assessments and application, system and network security. 
Experience with technologies, tools and process controls to minimize risk and data exposure. 
Experience in network and/or firewall engineering, administration, design and implementation including experience in applying methodologies and principles for all levels of security. 
Must possess, or be willing to pursue, current applicable professional/technical certifications, such as CISSP, GPEN, GWAPT, GISEC, CISM or CISA. 
Strong oral and written communication skills and comfort with presenting technical issues to all levels of management, as well as non-technical staff. 
Must possess broad technical knowledge of current and emerging technologies used both within the corporate infrastructure and in delivering customer facing services. 

Education 
Alternate Location: 
 US-Colorado-Denver; US-Kansas-Gardner; US-Louisiana-Monroe

security engineer.jobDescription:
The Senior Security Engineer works in Information Security organization as a member of the Security Operations and Engineering team. The Senior Security Engineer uses technical knowledge on a number of security technologies to Identify, Detect, Protect and Respond to security threats from various security platforms and technologies. The Senior Security Engineer serves as a Tier2 / Tier 3 escalation point for critical and complex client issues, performs configuration and testing of products, assists with developing and documenting work processes and trains other members of the team. 
 
Responsibilities: 

 
Responsible for initial triage of incoming support requests and issues. Will also handle the advanced issues and alerts escalated to them by IT and business customers and other Security Engineers.  
Analyze and respond to security threats from various security platforms and technologies.
Support, troubleshoot, configure, manage, and upgrade FW, NIDPS, UTM, VPN, WAF and a wide variety of other security products.
Perform network troubleshooting to isolate and diagnose common network problems, using strong TCP/IP networking skills.
Respond to inbound requests via phone and other electronic means for technical assistance with managed devices.
Respond in a timely manner (within documented SLA) to configuration, maintenance, incident management, and other requests.
Document actions in ticketing system to effectively communicate information internally and to customers.
Respond to needs and questions of customers concerning their access to network resources through their managed device.
Adhere to established Security policies, procedures, and practices.
Research and resolve problems independently and understand escalation procedures.
Responsible for major Security platform changes including upgrades.
Create custom documentation for internal and external needs.
Responsible for mentoring and training of Security Engineers.
Attend vendor-specific meetings and conferences for business and professional development.
Responsible for testing and configuring new products and technologies.
Assist with designing and documenting work processes within Information Security.
Perform other duties as assigned.

 
QUALIFICATIONS 

 
Education and Experience

 
Bachelor Degree in Information Technology, Information Security/Assurance, Engineering or related field of study preferred; at least four years of related experience and/or training (in addition to experience requirements below); or equivalent combination of education and experience preferred.
Minimum of six years’ experience in a position requiring IT technical problems solving skills.
Minimum 3 years of experience in Information Security or Networking required.
Minimum 3 years of experience with preferably more than one of the following technologies; Cisco ASA, Juniper (SRX, ScreenOS, SSL-VPN, IDP), Check Point, Firepower, Tipping Point, Fortinet, Palo Alto Networks, Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services.
Minimum 2.5 years of experience with one or more of the following management platforms required; Cisco Security Manager, Juniper NSM, Junos Space, Check Point Provider-1/MultiDomain Management, Palo Alto Networks Panorama, Blue Coat Director, Fortinet FortiManager.
Minimum 1 year of full time experience with one or more of the following security products: AirWatch,  Qualys, ISS, Encase, or other key security technologies.
Security+, BCCPP, JNCIS-SEC, JNCIS-FWV, JNCIS-SA, ACE, CNSE, SFCP, SFCSE, SFCTSE preferred.
Security+, GSEC, GCIA, GCIH or other security specific vendor/product certifications also preferred.
CISSP training strongly preferred.
Strong interest in technology and a desire to learn and grow in applicable technologies field is required. Skills and knowledge must be kept current, including ongoing active pursuit of certifications.
Practical expertise with TCP/IP networking required.
Significant experience with Linux, Windows and Network Operating Systems required.
Strong working knowledge of Routing and Access Control Devices required.
Requires taking responsibility for IT and business customer satisfaction and overall success of Information Security.
Ability to interface with a variety of IT and business customers in a polite, positive, and professional manner.
Technical knowledge on many security technologies required.
Solid understanding of information security and networking required.
Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills required.
A passion for information security and data security required.
Detail oriented with strong organization skills required.
Customer service focus required with strong interpersonal skills including excellent written/verbal communication skills.
Will be required to be on-call after hours and weekends on a rotating basis.
May be required to work occasional off-shift hours to cover customer maintenance and on-site activities

 Key Technology Requirements 

 
Azure Active Directory (AAD), Azure MFA and SSO Apps, AD synchronization (AAD Connect) 
Azure Information Protection (AIP)
Azure File Services
Azure Site Recovery (ASR), Microsoft Azure Backup Server (MABS)
Intune
Microsoft Cloud App Security
Office 365
Rights Management Services (RMS)
Azure Multi-factor authentication server

 
Additional expertise is a plus

 
Amazon Web Services
SharePoint 2013/2016/Online
SQL 2012/2014/2016

Job Summary 


The Senior Information Security Engineer is a member of the Information Security Governance/IBRR team that is responsible for Global Data Protection and conducting International Business Risk Reviews (IBRR) to address security risks with new work moving to international locations, and to work with IT to assess applications and verify Clean Room controls. The engineer will follow established processes to conduct risk assessments on proposed international activities and facilitate meetings with the International Business Risk Review Council (IBRRC), if necessary. 

Job Description 
Respond to, remediate and document information security incidents not limited to SIEM Alerts, Tickets, Emails, or Phone Calls. 
Review data that is processed within the SIEM to find and resolve suspicious events. 
Verify incident source alert notifications are authentic and trusted. 
Identify and resolve incidents that are not defined by (or deviates from) an existing incident response guide. 
Assist with significant incidents as needed or assigned. 
Provide feedback for development and consistency of automated threat detection mechanisms. 
Create and maintain incident response guides. 
Security projects dedicated to improving Corporate Security or CenturyLink's security posture. 
Support and enhance CenturyLink's abilities to detect and respond to security incidents including internal events, targeted attacks and all other cyber incidents. 
Ensure Corporate Security owned Infrastructure, Event Feeds, Event Processing, and Asset Intelligence are available and operating effectively. 
Support the business units within CenturyLink by acting as liaison between them and Corporate Security. 
Automate detections of "Indicators of Compromise" provided by Corporate Security in order to detect intrusions, and significantly lower time to response. 
Facilitate the coordinated response to the intrusion, to minimize the impact of the threat returning the integrity of CenturyLink assets and network as quickly as possible. 
Understand the initial threat vector, and the creation of protection mechanisms to prevent threats from occurring in the future. 
Recommend security best practices and system configuration standards. 
Facilitate and lead incident response calls and provide documentation to senior management.

Ensure communication continuity between all shifts

Undergraduate degree in computer science, engineering, or related field, or equivalent experience.

Strong work ethic, demonstrated self-starter, ability to work in a fast paced, team oriented environment with excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Lead Application Security Engineer 
USA-IL-Greater Chicago-Chicago  |  Information Technology 

 Dynamics of the Role  
The Application Security Engineer delivers application security services across the global enterprise, working closely with development and technology teams to ensure robust application security controls are deployed throughout our diverse and growing application portfolio. This position requires high-level analytical and problem solving skills to identify vulnerabilities and drive their remediation.  Engineers will promote security best practices, operate SAST, DAST and other security tools while providing subject matter expertise throughout the application development lifecycle into ongoing production operations.     
  
This position requires the ability to exercise sound judgment and work with minimal supervision. Engineers must effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment and be able to articulate security requirements to multiple management levels as it relates to both business and technical roles. Ability to conduct research into security issues and products as required.  The ideal candidate is capable of designing and operating controls that enhance security and foster compliance with policies, standards and procedures.  Candidates must be flexible handling different or unfamiliar technologies, and be able to drive process and technology change.   


 How You'll Contribute:   

Perform the activities necessary to ensure effective delivery of application security services across the enterprise 
Provide expert level security consultation to project teams, application owners, and general technology teams on relevant security controls and secure SDLC  process requirements 
Champion security standards across the enterprise: educating teams on security policies, standards and controls 
Participate in security architecture reviews and exception approval processes 
Oversee required security education initiatives and foster a security-conscious culture within appdev teams 
Monitor the ever evolving threat landscape to ensure application security policies, coding standards and required security controls appropriately mitigate threats 
Perform security’s role in change management, including environment promotion approvals 
Create meaningful metrics to demonstrate the effectiveness of security controls and security team operations 
Assist development and QA teams to perform static and dynamic testing.  Analyze and provide remediation guidance for identified vulnerabilities; validate and verify remediation implementation 
Provide security reviews and guidance for projects driven by groups both outside and within Information Security, including 3rd party security risk management teams 
Participate and lead Information Security projects to expand AppSec service capabilities and in support of other InfoSec initiatives 
Operation of a designated set of software tools and the security functionality of these tools 
Performs other related duties as assigned 


 What You'll Bring:  
The duties and responsibilities described above are the essential functions of the job.  The qualifications below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or abilities required.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 

Experience with most or all of the following:  HTML/CSS, HTTPS, Python, Java/Javascript, .NET, C++/C#, Ruby 
Experience with Javascript frameworks such as Angular, Node, Express 
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field 
3+ years experience in web application development or application security 
2+ years information security experience 
Strong understanding of UNIX and Windows operating systems and webhosting platforms 
Understanding of network protocols coupled with experience in one or more of the following:  web proxies, web application firewalls, vulnerability assessment tools such as Veracode, HP WebInspect and BlackDuck. 
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment 
High level of analytical and problem-solving abilities 
Experience working in complex environments and diverse technologies 
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment 
Positive attitude with strong oral and written communication skills 
Excellent attention to detail 
Self-starter able to work under minimal supervision 
CISSP or equivalent security related industry certifications 
Familiarity or experience with CI/CD systems

  Dynamics of the Role 
The Senior Security Engineer is a hands-on highly technical role involving design, engineering, deployment and support of complex security products to ensure that our applications and infrastructure are implemented and secured to the highest standards thus maintaining and enhancing customer trust.   
 
The Team’s Focus 
TransUnion Interactive creates web-based financial products that help consumers manage their credit, identity and money.  

Our product suite includes TransUnion Credit Monitoring and ID Theft Protection—products that help our customers monitor critical changes in their credit by assisting them with debt analysis, identity theft protection features, and money management tools. Ours is an entrepreneurial environment – with a big company behind us. We’ve had continued year- to-year growth and a history of successful product launches.   
 
How You’ll Contribute: 
  
 Investigate security technologies for potential deployment in TransUnion environments  
 Perform security testing and vulnerability assessments to identify strengths and weaknesses in our multiple environments, also assess the effectiveness of existing security controls, and recommend remedial action  
 Provide key insight in the development of security architecture, security policies, operating procedures and standards  
 Following the guidance of the Information Assurance Team, develop strategies and plans to comply with industry security requirements and address identified risks  
 Work with other product teams to identify security requirements, using methods that may include risk and business impact assessments  
 Be directly involved with incident management and response activities. If required, assist in triage, response and mitigation, post mortem analyses, and forensic analyses  
 Gather, analyze and evaluate the current and future threat landscape, and assist in providing leadership with a realistic overview of risks and threats in the enterprise environment  
 Engage in key decisions involving risk, incident response, and security process improvements in critical financial infrastructure that require unwavering integrity and moral character

Work collaboratively with other team members and with external information security vendors to identify advanced threats and prevent compromise 
Strong verbal and written communication skills 
Team Player

USA-IL-Greater Chicago-Chicago  |  Information Technology 

 Dynamics of the Role  
A Lead Information Security Engineer serves as the key thought leader and process owner for ongoing security projects, tools and capabilities. This position designs and provides expert level guidance across the enterprise for all information security technologies with focus on Identity & Access Management, assuring compliance with TransUnion policies, standards and procedures. The position also serves as an internal information security expert to TransUnion; advising the organization with current information about information security technologies. 
  
 How You'll Contribute:  

Establish and maintain Privileged Access Management (PAM) Security Strategy including provisioning, workflows, access management, attestations and user repositories 
Design, configure and maintain BeyondTrust’s Password Safe and Powerbroker agents for Linux and Windows tools 
Integrating BeyondTrust’s PAM solution with ServiceNow, Exchange, Puppet/SCCM/DSC (for agent deployment and configuration), and Splunk 
Design assistance and operational oversight of corporate Active Directories 
Serve as the subject matter expert in *nix authentication and authorization capabilities 
Support any custom scripts or code that support Privileged Access Management capability 
Provide expert level security consultation on internal projects focusing on business needs, security’s role in change management, and how data is transmitted internally and externally 
Evaluate and monitor project efforts, timelines, and task management.  Partner with internal business units to ensure projects remain on target, within budget, and are completed according to internal policies and security standards

Provide side by side coaching for less experienced architects and engineers. Manage all aspects of a security project including team members and other business unit partners. 
Delegate tasks to ensure areas of the project are carried through timely and effectively 
Performs other related duties as assigned

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field and 7+ years' of Information Security experience with a minimum of 3 years focus in Privileged Access Management. 
Must have a strong background in Identity and Access Management technologies, including: 
Provisioning and password safe tools such as Beyond Trust Password safe, Powerbroker for Windows and Linux. 
Privileged Access Management Processes including on-boarding, account management, password rotation, password safe policies, and PBUL/PBW policies 
Strong knowledge of Windows and Linux servers

Experience integrating multi-factor authentication (RSA) with BeyondTrust 
Experience using RDS to authenticate to Cisco and other networking devices

Familiarity with BeyondTrust’s ssh key management 
Active Directory and other LDAP directories 
Multi-factor authentication such as RSA SecurID 
PKI 
Web Authentication such as CA SiteMinder and Federation using SAML 
Understanding of RBAC 
Past experience in making decisions based on extensive experience and education of security procedures to develop security operation processes and procedures 
The ability to demonstrate a high level of analytical and problem-solving capability along with the ability to articulate the decision process to multiple management levels as it relates to both business and technical roles 
Utilize sound judgment, working with minimal supervision

Effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment

Job Description 
  The Information Security Engineer will be a part of Information Security Engineering and Architecture group and will manage/maintain and define road maps for rogue wireless detection technologies in CVS Health. Your responsibilities may include ownership of rogue wireless detection services, applications, systems, processes, or policies in whole or in partnership with other internal CVS Health groups.We're looking for a dynamic Info Security professional that has great writing and communications skills, integrity, takes initiative, and finds new ways to problem solve. You should also be highly motivated and possess the flexibility to work in a team environment as well as independently with minimal supervision.    
    

 A deep understanding of emerging security technologies, evolving threats, and the competitive landscape for security tools, infrastructure and handled services is important. Although not required, knowledge and/or experience with 802.1x/802.11 standards, network and wireless security, specifically WPA enterprise encryption Networking fundamentals including VLAN, subnets, protocols and related networking standards are highly preferred. Additionally, experience with secure networking protocols such as HTTP/S, TLS, SSH, SFTP is preferred.    
    

 Yourresponsibilities will include:  
 
You will conduct research on security technologies, drive proof of concepts, engage in strategy decisions.  
You will work with other Security Engineers, and other CVS teams to identify and report risk observations, and to re-mediate them according to the requirements of CVS Health policy.  
You will aide other application teams and IS functions including in the following areas: provide ad-hoc security advice and support technical risk assessments.  
You will assist Security Incident Response Teams in the investigation of incidents if needed. 


#DCE 

Required Qualifications 
5+ years of experience in IT security.  
2+ years security tools experience detecting rogue wireless/access points and various forms of wireless attacks.

  Industry recognized certifications such as CISSP or SANS GIAC are a plus.

  BS degree in Information Security, Computer Science and Engineering, Information Technology, or equivalent discipline or High School Diploma/GED accompanied by adequate years of meaningful work experience required.

Sr. IT Network Security Engineer-0061293_P0067726 


Description 
 TITLE: Sr. IT Network Security Engineer  
 LOCATION: Atlanta, GA  
 
 About NCR Corporation  
NCR Corporation (NYSE: NCR) is the global leader in consumer transaction technologies, turning everyday interactions with businesses into exceptional experiences. With its software, hardware, and portfolio of services, NCR enables nearly 700 million transactions daily across retail, financial, travel, hospitality, telecom and technology, and small business. NCR solutions run the everyday transactions that make your life easier. NCR is headquartered in Duluth, Georgia, with approximately 29,000 employees and does business in 180 countries. 
 
 POSITION SUMMARY & KEY AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY:  
NCR Network Security Engineering role provides design, installation, configuration, administration, security, operational integrity, and support of stand-alone and networked computer systems (i.e., physical voice, data, and video network infrastructure); including technical analysis, installation, maintenance, and modification of device/appliance operating system software. The individual in this position will focus on network security and connectivity between NCR and non-NCR devices (customers, partners, Internet.) This position will be responsible for inbound Internet gateway changes in support of secure access into NCR from a variety of devices – employee-owned, NCR-owned, and customer owned devices. Reverse proxy functional knowledge will be a key component of position’s responsibilities.  
The team into which the position reports is responsible for working with customers/partners to setup extranet VPNs, oversee intrusion prevention, Web filtering, SSL access, 2-factor remote access, reverse proxy, and other perimeter network security implementations. All security designs and updates require strict adherence to procedures that support Sarbanes-Oxley, SOC2, and ISO 27001 audit requirements, and in many cases, PCI requirements 
This position works directly with NCR Business Units and customers and partners. 
 
Maintain, configure, and troubleshoot network security platforms 
F5 Load balancing configuration 
SSL and IPSEC VPN configuration and setup 



Qualifications 
 BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:  
 
7+ years’ experience with recent versions of Checkpoint Firewall 
7+ years’ experience with Netscreen OS of Juniper VPN devices 
7+ years’ experience with F5 LTM configuration 
Data networking knowledge – must understand IP ‘subnetting’ and layer 3 routing 
Understand network security concepts (firewalls, encryption, IDS/IPS, web filtering, SSL, reverse proxy) 
Communication skills (verbal and written) – must be able to convey technical concepts to non-technical people.  

 
 
 PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:  
 
BS in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, MIS or related technical field 
Understanding of Web-based technologies, Web gateways, especially Reverse Proxy 
Knowledge of Virtual firewalls and other such forward-looking technologies  
Knowledge of McAfee security solutions (IPS, Web Gateway, ATD, etc.) 

 
 
  EEO Statement   
Integrated into our shared values is NCR's commitment to diversity. NCR is committed to being a globally inclusive company where all people are treated fairly, recognized for their individuality, promoted based on performance and encouraged to strive to reach their full potential. We believe in understanding and respecting differences among all people. This concept encompasses but is not limited to human differences with regard to race, ethnicity, religion, gender, culture and physical ability. Every individual at NCR has an ongoing responsibility to respect and support a globally diverse environment  . 
     
  Statement to Third Party Agencies   
To ALL recruitment agencies: NCR only accepts resumes from agencies on the NCR preferred supplier list. Please do not forward resumes to our applicant tracking system, NCR employees, or any NCR facility. NCR is not responsible for any   fees or  
 charges associated   with

Identity and Access Management Security Engineer
 
Description
If you want to achieve more in your mission of health care, you have to be really smart about the business of health care. Challenge yourself, your peers and our industry by shaping what health care looks like and doing your life's best work.(sm)
 
Position Summary
We are seeking a Identity and Access Management Security Engineer for our Richardson, TX location to be a part of the Identity and Access Management (IAM) team, this position requires knowledge on various IAM products such as CA Siteminder, LDAP Directory servers, CA Identity Manager, Secure Proxy Server. It also requires knowledge on SAML Federation products such as Ping Federate and Multi-factor authentication products CA RiskMinder and RSA Adaptive Authentication. The person is responsible for acting as the functional identity and access management subject matter expert (SME). The responsibilities include the following: 1) analyzing all aspects of the existing infrastructure and recommending modifications that will enhance system reliability, availability, serviceability and scalability; 2) following and enforcing high-availability and resiliency standards on existing infrastructure; 3) assisting in defining standards, guidelines, best practices, metrics and continuous validation of best practices; 4) planning and executing high-availability tests; 5) using troubleshooting skills to solve unique and complex problems related to infrastructure; 6) learning and deploying new security products as needed; 7) working in areas of operational support and implementations; 8) managing patching and upgrades of security infrastructure; 9) conducting application server tuning; 10) developing pioneering approaches to emerging identity and access management industry trends; 11) brain storm with the application teams regarding various authentication mechanisms to match the business requirements and architect/implement the solution; 12) address the security related vulnerabilities and suggest the fix; 13) in depth knowledge on the monitoring tools like Sitescope, CA Wily, Splunk and Application Performance Management; 14) Responsible for the SiteMinder Infrastructure and building new policy servers for the existing infrastructure to handle the increasing load; and 15) participate in the on-call rotation team and monitor the supported IAM products.
Qualifications

Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Engineering, Technology, Computer Science, or related field. 
5 years related progressive, post-baccalaureate experience. Will accept experience gained concurrently. 
Must have 12 months demonstrated ability with each of the following: (1) A subject matter expertise in the Identity and Access Management products including CA SiteMinder, LDAP, CA Identity Manager, Secure Proxy Server, SAML Federation products and multi factor authentication products; (2) Ability to brainstorm the various architectural single sign on solutions with the application team and handle the whole life cycle of application integration; (3) Monitoring and instrumentation of the SSO products using CA APM, Sitescope, Wily & Splunk Technologies; (4) Web server administration using CA Secure Proxy Servers , IIS, Apache, IBM HTTP WebServers on which CA webagent plugin will be integrated; and (5) Ability to solve unique and complex problems related to infrastructure, analyzing all aspects of the existing infrastructure and recommending modifications that will enhance system reliability, availability, serviceability and scalability. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.

Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)

 + Security monitoring integration with ACA Infrastructure Support System
 + Monitoring and advising and security patching requirements
 + Overall ownership and sign-off on security profile readiness for all SaaS, Business Systems, Operational Support Systems and Client Services Systems

 Other Duties and Responsibilities:  

 Effectively collaborate and communicate with Development, Infrastructure, DevOps and LoBs in cross-functional teams and relevant management to report out security operations status.

 The duties and responsibilities listed in this job description represent the major responsibilities of the position. Other duties and responsibilities may be assigned, as required.

 Possess one or more advanced professional security certifications related to chosen discipline (CISSP, CCSP)

 Demonstrated understanding of Information Security best practices

 At least 5+ years' experience implementing layered security practices for network, host, applications, data and access to IaaS, PaaS and SaaS services in a hybrid deployment environment

 Experience in developing and deploying security specific solutions including the automation of repeatable security tasks and controls

 Strong practical knowledge of web authentication / authorization standards

 Solid oral and written communication skills

 Solid collaboration skills

 Experience implementing and operating security technologies and processes in a hybrid cloud environment, such as AWS or Azure, customer premise

Qualifications

 * Have 2-3 years of cloud-based security run-time management experience
 * BS/BA degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related field
 * Experience with software-defined network, compute and storage platforms
 * Strong networking fundamentals - You understand TCP/IP, VLAN's, DNS, load balancing and software-defined layer 2/3 rule configurations
 * Experience with security vulnerability and penetration tools such as McAfee, Qualys, Proof Point
 * Implementation and management experience with hardware and software firewalls, AV, IDS/IPS platforms
 * Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines without compromising close attention to detail and accuracy
 * Assist in formulating and implementing procedures to improve IT service levels
 * Ability to multi-task and work in a deadline driven environment without sacrificing customer service
 * Excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills
 * Ability to maintain composure and multitask in a fast paced environment
 * Must be a self-motivator while actively participating in a team environment Strong written and oral communication skills, high level of professionalism and interpersonal skills, and excellent critical thinking, analytical, and problem solving skills
 * Excellent analytical and creative problem-solving skills and ability to follow through on requests and proactively communicate status
 * Experience in financial or lending industry preferred

 Work Environment and Physical Demands - This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.
 Position Type/Expected Hours of Work - This is a full-time position with a work schedule of Monday-Friday with some schedule variations of weekday, weekend, and sometimes monthly on-call duties as needed.

 Travel - This position will require up to 5% local travel.
 EEO Statement - ACA provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. ACA complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.

 Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

security engineer.skills: Analysis, Architecture, Consulting, Development, Firewall, Lifecycle, Management, Networking, PowerShell, Programming, Security, Testing, VPN
security engineer.jobDescription:
Job Title/Job Code:  Cloud Network & Security Engineer 
Location: 
 Hermitage preferred, but open to other locations 
Organization: 
 Technology & Infrastructure 
                                                                
Deloitte Services LP includes internal support areas such as Marketing and Communications, Human Resources/Talent, Information Technology, Facilities Management, and Financial Support Services. 
  
Job Overview:    
  
Deloitte’s Cloud Center of Excellence team build world class technology solutions in support of the business, member firms and our clients’ cloud network security strategies. As part of our team, you will have the opportunity to help drive industry leading best practices within the network security space and provide governance over firewall, load balancers and remote access infrastructure in a large scale environment.  Lead design and development of cutting edge infrastructure and automation while driving partnerships with our security, cloud engineering, and application development teams. Use your skills, experience and talents to be a part of groundbreaking thinking and visionary goals.  As a Cloud Network and Security Architect your role will include:  
  
  
Responsibilities: 
Help design and implement network security strategy including cloud enablement and establishing next generation firewall features and capabilities 
Understand and engineer cloud network architecture 
Provide analysis and recommendations for the continuous improvement of cloud network and security 
Maintain, deploy, upgrade and troubleshoot network security infrastructure solutions including firewalls, load balancers, client VPN and Intrusion Prevention Systems 
Collaborate with Security and Infrastructure teams to develop consistent technical solutions, implementation activities and support processes 
Participate in the design, lifecycle management, and total cost of ownership of security appliances, applications and infrastructure services 
Assist with on-call support as needed. 

Primary Qualifications: 
BA/BS or equivalent experience 
Minimum 5 years total work experience 
Has in-depth knowledge of networking and security engineering, as well as technical approaches in design, build, testing, debugging problems as required  
Maintains technical knowledge within areas of expertise 
Stays current with new and evolving technologies via formal training and self-directed education 

  
Preferred Requirements 
In-depth knowledge of network security and security operations, including Check Point firewalls, F5 load balancers, Unified Threat Management firewalls and IPS 
Experience with Microsoft PowerShell and automating security processes or configuration in a public cloud  
Experience or aptitude with software defined networking (SDN) 
Experience with automation through object-oriented programming and scripting 
Experience with deploying network virtual appliances in a public cloud space 
Microsoft Azure and Amazon AWS certifications 

Deloitte is one of the leading professional services organizations in the United States, specializing in audit, tax, consulting, and financial advisory services with clients in more than 20 industries. We provide powerful business solutions to some of the world's most well-known and respected companies, including more than 75 percent of the Fortune 100.  


At Deloitte, you can have a rewarding career on every level. In addition to challenging and meaningful work, you'll have the chance to give back to your community, make a positive impact on the environment, participate in a range of diversity and inclusion initiatives, and find the support, coaching, and training it takes to advance your career. Our commitment to individual choice lets you customize aspects of your career path, your educational opportunities and your benefits. And our culture of innovation means your ideas on how to improve our business and your clients' will be heard. 
About Deloitte

security engineer.jobDescription:
Job Title/Job Code:  Cloud Network & Security Engineer 
Location: 
 Hermitage preferred, but open to other locations 
Organization: 
 Technology & Infrastructure 
                                                                
Deloitte Services LP includes internal support areas such as Marketing and Communications, Human Resources/Talent, Information Technology, Facilities Management, and Financial Support Services. 
  
Job Overview:    
  
Deloitte’s Cloud Center of Excellence team build world class technology solutions in support of the business, member firms and our clients’ cloud network security strategies. As part of our team, you will have the opportunity to help drive industry leading best practices within the network security space and provide governance over firewall, load balancers and remote access infrastructure in a large scale environment.  Lead design and development of cutting edge infrastructure and automation while driving partnerships with our security, cloud engineering, and application development teams. Use your skills, experience and talents to be a part of groundbreaking thinking and visionary goals.  As a Cloud Network and Security Architect your role will include:  
  
  
Responsibilities: 
Help design and implement network security strategy including cloud enablement and establishing next generation firewall features and capabilities 
Understand and engineer cloud network architecture 
Provide analysis and recommendations for the continuous improvement of cloud network and security 
Maintain, deploy, upgrade and troubleshoot network security infrastructure solutions including firewalls, load balancers, client VPN and Intrusion Prevention Systems 
Collaborate with Security and Infrastructure teams to develop consistent technical solutions, implementation activities and support processes 
Participate in the design, lifecycle management, and total cost of ownership of security appliances, applications and infrastructure services 
Assist with on-call support as needed. 

Primary Qualifications: 
BA/BS or equivalent experience 
Minimum 5 years total work experience 
Has in-depth knowledge of networking and security engineering, as well as technical approaches in design, build, testing, debugging problems as required  
Maintains technical knowledge within areas of expertise 
Stays current with new and evolving technologies via formal training and self-directed education 

  
Preferred Requirements 
In-depth knowledge of network security and security operations, including Check Point firewalls, F5 load balancers, Unified Threat Management firewalls and IPS 
Experience with Microsoft PowerShell and automating security processes or configuration in a public cloud  
Experience or aptitude with software defined networking (SDN) 
Experience with automation through object-oriented programming and scripting 
Experience with deploying network virtual appliances in a public cloud space 
Microsoft Azure and Amazon AWS certifications

Senior Network Security Engineer (Bluecoat) 
USA-IL-Greater Chicago-Chicago  |  Information Technology 

 How You'll Contribute 
 
Primarily responsible for operational support of BlueCoat web proxies and secondary responsibility for other network security tools as required 
Oversee functionality of security systems to ensure security policies are being withheld including internet browsing restrictions and software downloads 
Responsible for implementation, maintenance and monitoring of security systems with emphasis on web proxies

Responsible for keeping as-build documentation up to date 
Execute enhancement efforts for one or more security product implementations 
Provide network and system troubleshooting expertise for rapid system recovery 
Partners with Security Architects to understand system requirements and functionality and implements changes to system against the requirements and functional design 
Provide on-call security support for the company on a rotational basis 
Performs other related duties as assigned 


 What You'll Bring: 
The duties and responsibilities described above are the essential functions of the job.  The qualifications below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or abilities required.  

Bachelor Degree in an Information Technology related field or equivalent experience 
CISSP or related certification preferred 
5-7 years of broad experience in Information Security, performing the setup and administration of web proxies, intrusion detection systems and firewalls 
3-5 years of network technology experience with devices such as switches (layer 2 and 3), and routers, CISCO in particular 
3-4 years of Bluecoat SG web proxy platform management and configuration 
3-4 year or hands on network security Infrastructure deployment experience 
Strong knowledge of TCP/IP and related protocols and packet analysis tools 
Intermediate automation and troubleshooting scripting skills a plus 
AWS Cloud experience a plus 
High level of analytical and problem-solving abilities

Strong organizational, oral communication and project management skills 
Excellent attention to detail 
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment 
Must be willing to be on call 24x7 on a rotational basis 




What We Offer 
This is an exciting time in TransUnion’s history. With investments in our people, technology and new business markets, we are redefining the role and purpose of a credit bureau. We are acquiring new businesses, launching new products, and expanding our services to businesses and consumers worldwide. 
  
The future has never looked brighter for our associates. We work hard to offer our team members meaningful work experiences to promote professional growth, and to provide an enjoyable place to work with competitive benefits, a healthy work/life balance, and a friendly, casual culture. 
  
Who We Are 
Information is a powerful thing. At TransUnion, we are dedicated to finding innovative ways information can be used to help people make better and smarter decisions. As a trusted provider of global information solutions, our mission is to help people around the world access the opportunities that lead to a higher quality of life, by helping organizations optimize their risk-based decisions and enabling consumers to understand and manage their personal information. Because when people have access to more complete and multidimensional information, they can make more informed decisions and achieve great things.

 The worldwide pioneer in the creation of interactive entertainment, Nintendo Co., Ltd., of Kyoto, Japan, manufactures and markets hardware and software for its Nintendo Switch   system and the Nintendo 3DS   family of portable systems. Since 1983, when it launched the Nintendo Entertainment System  , Nintendo has sold more than 4.4 billion video games and more than 700 million hardware units globally, including Nintendo Switch and the Nintendo 3DS family of systems, as well as the Game Boy  , Game Boy Advance, Nintendo DS   family of systems, Super NES  , Nintendo 64  , Nintendo GameCube  , Wii   and Wii U   systems. It has also created industry icons that have become well-known, household names, such as Mario, Donkey Kong, Metroid, Zelda and Pokemon.     A wholly owned subsidiary, Nintendo Technology Development, based in Redmond, Washington, creates future hardware/software technology and researches North American-based technologies.

security engineer.skills: Full Time
security engineer.jobDescription:
Lead Information Security Engineer 

The Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco is looking for a Lead Information Security Engineer to join our Security Architecture and Engineering team. The Federal Reserve has a global mission and offers leading edge work in a stable environment with competitive pay, superior benefits AND a true work life balance. If you desire to be part of a world-class team and to develop your skills and experience beyond anything available in the commercial sector, the Federal Reserve is the place for you.

As part of the 1st Line of Defense, you will help lead the security architecture and engineering activities including planning, design, development, implementation, and testing for all security controls deployed in the 12th District. 

You will oversee the deployment and troubleshooting of Network and Telecommunication equipment physically deployed within the 12th District. You will also coordinate and review security architecture and engineering results from IT teams, other Federal Reserve Districts, and external service providers for technologies located outside the 12th District.

You will partner with 12th District IT teams to conduct threat modeling, identify critical security controls, review existing security controls, and oversee testing and security assurance activities. You will own the security tools, architectural frameworks, automation and orchestration platforms used by the 12th District.

You will help supervise, mentor, and coach a growing team of security architects, security engineers, network engineers and telecom engineers. 

Key Responsibilities:

Interact with stakeholders across the District and Federal Reserve System to effectively shape and drive secure network strategy and capabilities including participation in strategic initiatives and workgroups
Work with business and IT teams to identify secure network solutions and risk mitigation options to reduce risk and exposure
Work as a lead member of the Infrastructure Planning and Network Support (IPNS) team, handle trouble tickets related activities including analysis, troubleshoot, and problem resolution to correct the most difficult WAN/LAN connectivity problems and network performance issues by working with National Information Technology (NIT) groups 
Direct second level support to NIT groups to implement upgrades, installation, and troubleshoot any national related issues
Lead the design and development of network operational reports and scorecards
Translate and communicate complex network information to facilitate staff and business understanding of risks
Support the development and maintenance of network policies, standards, controls, guidelines and operating procedures
Be responsible for the planning, development and delivery of initiatives that instill Bank-wide ownership and responsibility for network security and identify methods to improve internal coordination and communications to rapidly respond to network incidents
Develop and maintain standards and documentation for infrastructure production hardware, procedures, and system configuration
Maintain awareness of emerging technology and industry trends, especially as they may be applied to further Bank objectives
Consult business areas on related network risk assessments and identify any vulnerabilities
Manage, update and monitor physical site security best practice checklist
Provide review on network security related to cloud services
Provide mentoring, guidance and training for staff to develop knowledge of network technology, information security best practices as it relates to the infrastructure architecture 
Qualifications:
  
Bachelors degree in Computer Science, data/telecommunications, electrical engineering or related disciple, or equivalent work experience
Seven years of experience in network security, design and implementation
Knowledge of network architecture, VLANs, firewalls, routers, switches, bridges, hubs, load-balancers, wireless access points, web-application firewalls, and software-defined networks
Strong familiarity with network protocols, MAC address spoofing, DNS poisoning, DoS attacks, IP spoofing, SYN attacks, and Network Access Control (NAC)
Experience working with packet sniffing, ping sweeps, and port scans application/protocols
Working knowledge of application security, secure SDLC, Appsec testing
Working knowledge of data security concepts, principles and application
Hands-on working experience with technical architecture, infrastructure designs, servers, workstations, virtual machines, cloud-based environments and hardening procedures 
Highly proficient, concise and articulate verbal and written communication skills to a wide range of audiences including business executive, end-users, and technical partners
Effective customer service and interpersonal skills, including the ability to work in a team environment; motivate and work with others to accomplish tasks; and deal honestly and directly with others
Experience in administering and troubleshooting various hardware and configuration software, Cisco IOS routers/switches, wireless access points (APs), network interface adaptors, operating systems including Windows, UNIX , Mac and mobile devices in an enterprise environment
Experience in the hardening of routers and switches; ACLs, TTY access, port security on switch ports, spanning tree, CDP, VLAN pruning
Experience working with packet sniffing, ping sweeps, and port scans application/protocols
Experience in troubleshooting network related problems 
Working knowledge of data security concepts, principles and application
Working knowledge of the design and testing of structured cabling systems
Ability to independently manage overall team workload with little or no oversight
Strong critical thinking, analytic and problem-solving skills
Participate in on-call rotation, support during off-shift hours and occasional travel to branch locations

At the Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco, we offer a superior benefits package including: Medical, Dental, Vision, Pretax Flexible Spending Account, Backup Child Care Program, Pretax Day Care Flexible Spending Account, Vacation Days, Sick Days, Paid Holidays, Pet Insurance, Matching 401(k), and an unheard of Retirement/Pension.

At the Federal Reserve Bank (FRB) we believe in the diversity of our people, ideas, and experiences and are committed to building an inclusive culture that is representative of the communities we serve. The Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

security engineer.skills: Full Time
security engineer.jobDescription:
Changing the world is all in a day's work at Apple. If you love innovation, here's your chance to make a career of it. You'll work hard. But the job comes with more than a few perks.


Apple services are an essential part of the Apple experience that extends even beyond the owners of Apple devices. Our users rely on services such as iMessage, iTunes, the App Store, and iCloud to communicate, to access powerful applications and media content, and to create, store and protect their memories seamlessly across all their devices. While we strive to improve user experience by avoiding unnecessary friction, our Fraud Engineering team performs continuous analysis and designs and provides internal tools to help ensure that our users remain in control of their accounts, even when their credentials leave their control. We are looking for people who can envision themselves in the bad guys' seat, while feeling proud and rewarded whenever fraudsters are pushed out of business and Apple users are safe.

 The Fraud Engineering, Algorithms and Risk group is looking for an experienced security engineer to join a Red Team conducting analysis, reverse engineering, design and implementation of fraud prevention mechanisms and tools. The role will span the breadth of Apple devices and systems, and will be primarily back-end focused. The role requires candidates who have a strong background and interest in information, product and system security, mature SW Development sensibilities, and who can act pragmatically and work autonomously and in close collaboration with experts in diverse domains. The ideal candidate will have experience in breaking stuff - yet with methodology - and will relish the satisfaction of improving the lives of millions with every commit. He or she will have the opportunity to drive change at multiple levels of the organization and in procedures and protocols as well as technical implementation.


Key Qualifications:
 Experience with at least one major language suited to web services programming (e.g. Java, Python, Node.js)
 Knowledge of of security and cryptographic concepts (PKI)
 Knowledge in iOS application development (desired)
 Experience with protection of software IPs
 Experience in analysis of big data sets
 Ability to quickly pick up, understand, and communicate complex concepts
 Excellent communication skills and a strong desire to work with both technical and non-technical audiences


Description:
 As a Red team engineer in the Fraud Engineering, Algorithms and Risk group, youll have the opportunity to conduct analysis and reverse engineering of Apple services and contribute to building the methodology and tools that protect our customers. You will work with developers, data analysts and security engineers to ensure that new devices, software and features in our services, provide the safest experience to our customers.


Education:
 Master in Computer Science/Information Security or equivalent work experience.


 Apple is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities.

security engineer.skills: Full Time
security engineer.jobDescription:
Changing the world is all in a day's work at Apple. If you love innovation, here's your chance to make a career of it. You'll work hard. But the job comes with more than a few perks.


Apple's B2B/EDI team manages critical integrations with Apple's external partners such as manufacturers, logistics providers, banks, resellers and business customers. We are seeking a technically hands on and motivated individual who has experience in securing and automating large distributed multi-tier applications. We work closely with world class engineers in Apple's Information Security, Network and Systems Infrastructure teams. This is a unique position that allows you to design, implement and automate security best practices for the web, application and database layers and learn from your peers.


Key Qualifications:
 Hands on development experience with Webmethods Integration Server, Trading Networks.
 Hands on development experience with Webmethods modules for AS2 (HTTPS/SMIME), EDI, SAP and JDBC Adaptors.
 Solid programming experience in Java, J2EE, Webmethods flow services, SQL, Oracle PL/SQL, shell scripting.
 Administrative experience on Webmethods Integration Server, Trading Networks, MyWebmethods Server, Apache Kafka and Oracle LDAP server.
 Hands on experience with Oracle DB security and developing with Oracle DB.
 Good understanding of basic security concepts and protocols - authentication, authorization, signing, encryption, SSL/TLS, SSH/SFTP, PKI, X509 certificates and PGP.
 Good knowledge of information security best practices and regulatory requirements - SOX, PCI and PII.
 Basic administrative understanding of Linux operating system, file systems access control, sudo, user setup.
 Basic understanding Network security, firewalls, DNS, NAT and Load Balancing.
 Knowledge of commonly used web service protocols REST and SOAP and applying security standards for web services.


Description:
 The is a hands-on role for managing both day to day security tasks, debugging as well as
 developing long term solutions for strengthening the security of Apple's B2B/EDI platform.

 Apple's B2B/EDI platform is built on Webmethods Integration Server as the middleware and
 uses Oracle DB, SAN storage and load balanced servers to process a huge volume of business
 critical transactions including order, payments, shipments and invoices.

 The ideal candidate should have broad systems, operations and automation skills in managing security for business critical distributed applications spread across hundreds of servers.

 The candidate will work closely with Apple's Infosec, System Admins, Network Security, Database Admins and Auditors or security and compliance reviews and implementing security guidelines for the B2B platform.

 The candidate will also interface with Apple business and external B2B partners to review
 and implement Apple's information security policies.

 The role requires both designing and implementing the security architecture for the B2B/EDI platform.

 Modifying and replacing legacy Webmethods and Java code base, updating Webmethods server configuration for security hardening to prevent unauthorized access and protecting sensitive PCI and PII data are key requirements for the role.

 Technical expertise, strong communication skills and teamwork are essential requirements for this role as it involves working with both technical and non-technical groups within Apple.
 


Education:
 Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Engineering discipline with extensive programming experience.


 Apple is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities.

security engineer.jobDescription:
Hyundai AutoEver America (HAEA) is a subsidiary of Hyundai and Kia Motor companies specializing in IT services. HAEA (formerly HISNA) was formed 13 years ago and is committed to providing world-class technology services to its clients (of Hyundai and Kia Motor companies) throughout North America.
 We are looking for talented individuals to join our team.


 


Job Summary:


The Information Security Senior Associate will perform engineering and planning activities to support the implementation, deployment, operations, maintenance and continued improvements/upgrades of HAEA security technologies using defense-in-depth based on the ISO27002 and NIST Information Security frameworks. Ensure relevant information security controls are appropriately designed in the deployment and engineering of application and infrastructure projects, development practices, and testing methodologies in a complex distributed IT environment. This position will report to the Security Operations Manager.

 

Job Responsibilities:


Experience and knowledge of ISO27002 and NIST information security frameworks, technologies and processes, the Senior Associate’s primary responsibilities will include information security projects and improvement initiatives to ensure that these technologies follow a defense-in-depth methodology and adhere to the frameworks. This will include having experience in the following:

Familiar with secure coding practices including a thorough understanding of the OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities, techniques to discover these vulnerabilities and remediate them in a timely manner.


Investigate, evaluate, recommend, acquire, plan, design, build, and test new and emerging security technologies/processes, which include integration, configuration, creating and leading the implementation of these technologies as large scale projects.


Implement changes to our security technologies / infrastructure in accordance with standard change control policies / procedures.


Participate as a member of the Computer Security Incident Response Team.


Assist in periodic or ad-hoc production of security reports that provide relevant situational awareness to our senior stakeholders.


Assists in the coordination and completion of information security operations documentation.


Stay abreast of industry best practices in information security.


 


Requirements:


Minimum of 7 years of IT experience with at least 3 years of experience performing security operations, engineering/planning services


Bachelors’ Degree in MIS or Computer Science preferred


Knowledge of Web Application Security


Experience operating, implementing, maintaining and optimizing market leading network and information security system solutions and products.


Information security certifications such as CISSP, CISM, CISA and CEH are preferred.


Possess strong troubleshooting skills specific to information security with the ability to effectively work with cross functional teams as needed to resolve issues.


Must have strong problem solving and communication skills as well as a familiarity with the types of security process and technologies in use at Hyundai.

 



Hyundai AutoEver America (HAEA) offers an excellent comprehensive benefits package; including 401K, healthcare, long term and short term disability, educational reimbursement, discounts on Hyundai and Kia automobiles, flexible spending accounts and much more.

The Security engineer will be responsible for the management, monitoring and implementation of various security systems and controls including, security information and event management, intrusion detection and prevention, network access controls, network and host based intrusion detection, data loss prevention, end point security, to ensure the organization security is maintained and matured. The Security engineer will work in the enterprise security team on security initiatives across the Myriad family of companies that span worldwide operations.

Work closely with IT Administrators and development engineers to enhance the enterprise security posture across the organization.

Working on remediation with IT teams and MSSP.

Experience with SQL
