Description: 





THE COMPANY  



Are you interested in helping solve today's most critical housing challenges? In simplest terms, Fannie Mae serves the people who house America. We work at the heart of housing by providing reliable, affordable mortgage financing in all markets at all times, buying loans that banks and other lenders originate, so they can fund new loans. This gives more people the opportunity to buy, refinance, or rent homes and apartments. Creating these opportunities is what drives the people who work at Fannie Mae.  





For more information about Fannie Mae, visit http\://www.fanniemae.com/progress  





JOB INFORMATION  



This position will serve as a Principal SME and will be responsible for the engineering, implementation, maintenance, and administration of various security systems such as firewalls, SIEMs, Endpoint protection, and intrusion detection systems; this will include monitoring, configuration changes, managing log sources, and updates. The position will also be involved in enforcing the network security policies and complying with requirements of security audits and recommendations.  





KEY JOB FUNCTIONS  




Provide technical leadership to evaluate, recommend, design, and integrate new security technology and tools by conducting feasibility studies, proof of concepts, pilot projects, and other research and development initiatives.  





Serve as the principle IT engineer to provide engineering expertise and guidance for the design, development, and implementation of IT solutions that protect and monitors various IT infrastructures.   





Research and evaluate current and emerging security technologies to train and guide staff to better support organizational cyber security objectives in the constantly evolving information security environment.  





Assess and analyze organizational progress against existing security strategies as well as identify, implement and maintain new strategies that address the vision, mission and goals of senior leaders and the organization as a whole.   





Develop policy, programs and guidelines for the implementation of systems and procedures to sustain the security, integrity, and availability of the organization's data.  





Oversee controls and review of applications to ensure that system's controls, policies, and procedures are operating effectively relative to the predicted effectiveness of the controls as well as provide procedures and coverage during outages.   





Provide subject matter expertise, guidance, and accurate and thorough documentation of processes to ensure compliance in the development of cyber security policy and practices.  





Assess risk of exposure of proprietary data through weaknesses in platforms, access procedures, and forms of access to the organization's systems and the data contained in them.  





Apply knowledge of latest cyber security industry trends, technology tools and practices, and security threats to define cyber security processes and standards.   





Confer and collaborate with internal and external auditors to ensure that appropriate controls are installed, operating properly, and being monitored and reported.   





May plan and/or participate in tests of the core infrastructure, simulated attacks and the contingency environment for critical business applications to ensure business continuity in the event of a computer security incident.   





Ensure the proper deployment and management of solutions that support information security including virus detection, malware detection, intrusion detection and prevention systems, firewalls, data partitioning and masking, and other security solutions.   





Conduct self-assessments of security processes, security tools, networks, and systems to provide technical solutions to complex security problems.  





Track security solutions and identify trends or exposures by aggregating metrics of operation that could be addressed by additional training, technical measures, or use of application tools to enhance security.  

Qualification: 




EDUCATION  




Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, MIS or related field of study; or any equivalent combination of relevant work experience and training  





SPECIALIZED KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS  




10 - 15 years of experience in the Information Security industry, preferably with a concentrated focus on Firewall Management, Endpoint protection, Data Loss Prevention, or Security Event Monitoring.   





Experience with tools and appliances such as Nessus, IPS/IDS, Kali Linux, Checkpoint, Cisco ASA, WAF, NAC, Endpoint protection and SIEMs.   





Experience using network security troubleshooting, logging, and traffic analysis tools, such as ArcSight, Splunk, Niara, and Wireshark.   





Excellent analytical skills, organizational, time management and problem solving skills are essential.   





Verbal communication skills required for this position requires some interaction with requestors (usually application and technical project teams) and the network and firewall outsourcers technical staff.   





Experience working with all phases of firewall and network operations, firewall change requests, firewall configuration, network services, and network security   





Experience within multiple of the following areas required\: computer networking, cloud and virtual machine environments, PKI, security engineering and architecture, programming, vulnerability assessments, or operating systems.  





One or more cyber security certifications such as the CISSP, GSEC, CCNA Security or a similar certification.   





Administration expertise with correlation and analysis of security and event log data, IDS/IPS, vulnerability scanners, endpoint protection, SSL Decryption, Data Loss Prevention, penetration testing and protocol collection and analysis tools.  





Security focused on AWS, Windows, and Unix systems, network devices, proxy servers web server, virtualization, firewall, and DNS.  





Experience with programming and scripting languages and text manipulation tools.  





Strong troubleshooting skills in complex communication and network environments.  





Working knowledge of NIST Cyber Security Framework and applicable standards.  





Demonstrate intimate knowledge of MicroFocus ArcSight solution and must be able to collaborate with various Subject Matter Experts regarding the collection of log sources into ArcSight.  





Able to work closely with the Senior Enterprise Architects, Security Engineers and Threat Detection and Response team in Information Security.  





EMPLOYMENT   



As a condition of employment with Fannie Mae, any successful job applicant will be required to pass a pre-employment drug screen and to successfully complete a background investigation.   





Fannie Mae is an Equal Opportunity Employer.    

Department:  Administration

Req ID: 
 39284 

Areas of Interest:  
Information Security  

BOK Financial (BOKF), 
 Headquartered in Tulsa, Oklahoma, BOK Financial Corporation (NASDAQ: BOKF) is a top 25 U.S.-based financial services holding company with operations in ten states – Oklahoma, Texas, Arkansas, Arizona, Colorado, Kansas/Missouri, New Mexico, Nebraska and Wisconsin. The company began more than 100 years ago in Tulsa and has successfully diversified into a variety of industries, businesses and geographies.                   . 


The  Senior Information Security Engineer   is responsible for supporting the architecture, implementation, and ongoing maintenance of the information security program and ensuring the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of corporate assets. Works with functional areas to define, document, and implement security strategies, architectures, and procedures. Assess and verify systems are protected from threats, while enabling the organization to work effectively and productively. 

PRINCIPLE DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: 
Design, configure, deploy, and manage security infrastructure including: VPN, firewall, application firewall, IPS and IDS systems, vulnerability assessment systems, multi-factor / strong authentication technologies, RADIUS/TACACS+ servers, proxy servers, URL filtering, and logging servers. 
Work with senior management, systems operations staff, software development staff, support staff, 3rd parties and end-users to ensure rapid resolution of security issues. 
Manage security initiatives from design to implementation. 
Defines and implements technical security risk assessment program. Provide guidance of security risk assessments of third party relationships and associated corrective actions. 
Identify vulnerabilities and reduce risk by analyzing processes, network designs, and software designs. 
Assists in the information security awareness, training, educational activities, the preventive monitoring of potential information security threats, investigation of information security breaches and drives appropriate response to the breach. 
Responsible for maintenance, monitoring, capacity planning, and 7x24 support of security systems and security related issues. 
Assists in the information security incident response process and provide guidance. 
Defines and implements technical security risk assessment program and implement remediation plans. Provide guidance of security risk assessments. Collaborate with personnel across to ensure appropriate risk levels are identified. 
Perform security assessments. 
Utilize industry best practices, ISO standards, and regulatory requirements to design security controls and processes. 
Provide support for information security incidents. Assist with the investigation of security breaches, policy violations, and security incidents. 



-  

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS and ABILITIES: 


-
Requires BS in Computer Science or 6-8 years of technical security related experience and extensive background in supporting information security systems 
Understanding of network protocols and experience in more than one of the following: Web Proxies, Firewalls, Intrusion Detection tools, File integrity monitoring tools, Vulnerability assessment tools, Security Information and Event Management, Secure Email Gateways, Application Firewalls, Data Loss Prevention 
Verbal and written communications and presentation skills. Must have the ability to communicate with internal/external customers, vendors, management in both formal and informal situations 
Administrative and security expertise with all versions of Windows and Windows Server and Unix variants 
System administration experience in a production environment 
Experience in assessing designs related to networks, operating systems, and applications 
Experience with assessing risk related to networks, operating systems, and applications 
GIAC or CISSP certification is preferred 



This level of knowledge is normally acquired through completion of a Bachelors Degree in computer science or related degree and 8-10 years experience technical security related and extensive background in supporting information security systems or 10-12 years equivalent work related experience.

Job Description: 




 
 The Metropolitan Washington Airports Authority    
  Your Journey Begins With Us!        
  Join our Team!     

 Position Title    

 Security Engineer (IT)    

 Announcement No.    

 MWAA-17-12108    

 Salary Range    

 H22, $96,963 - $140,597  

 Position Type    

       FT Term, Not to Exceed 4 years and 5 months    

 Location    

 Crystal City, VA    

 Opening Date    

 12/15/2017    

 Closing Date    

 Open Until Filled     

  
 
  This announcement amends salary from $94,598 - $137,168     

   ABOUT US: 
   
    
Have you ever wondered who runs Reagan National Airport? Or Dulles International Airport? Or the Dulles Toll Road? We do! We’re the Metropolitan Washington Airports Authority and we’re looking for talented, enthusiastic people to help us continue our tradition of outstanding service to travelers in the Washington Metropolitan area. In 2016 alone, we served more than 44 million air passengers. We offer an array of benefits programs, including vacation, retirement, and health benefits. Whether you are traveling the world or plotting your career path, your journey begins with us.      
    
Our Core Values are:  MUTUAL RESPECT…INTEGRITY…PRIDE…COLLABORATION    
    
To review our benefits information please    click here   .   
    
  JOB SUMMARY:     
    
 ·            Security Engineer IT   
 ·            This is a non-career term job.   
 ·           Works under the general supervision of the Chief Information Security Officer.   
 ·            Serves in the Information Security Department of the Office of Technology at the Headquarters Office.   
    
The Security Engineer (IT) monitors, tests, and reports on the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information assets in compliance with Airports Authority information security policies and other security and compliance standards.       
    
To review the description of duties, please    click here    .      
    
Please note:  You should review this job description, in particular the knowledge, skills and abilities (KSAs) requirements listed. Please reply to KSAs one (1) through (6) only.    In the application process, you will be asked to relate your experience, training and education to the KSAs in a narrative format.   The rest of the KSAs will be assessed during the application process.   
    
We would suggest that you prepare your responses off line and paste them into the assessment questionnaire. If the required information is provided in your resume, please direct the reviewer to the specific section of the document where this information can be found.    
    
  MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:     
To be rated qualified for this job, an applicant must meet all of the MQs listed below at the time of vacancy announcement closure.      
 1.          A Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Security, Information Assurance, or related field  , or an equivalent combination of education, experience and training that totals four years.   
    
   Please note:       A fully equivalent combination of education and training beyond what is needed to satisfy the education requirement may be used to substitute for up to two of the five years of experience. For example, a Master’s Degree     may be substitute for     two years of experience.    
    
 2.           Five years    of progressively responsible experience in Information Security including implementing, upgrading, and maintaining security tools and configuring or reviewing firewalls and conducting security assessments.   Three of the five years   of experience   must  
 include implementing intrusion prevention/ detection systems (IPS/IDS), web security tools, e-mail security tools, firewalls, and two-factor authentication devices.   
    
 3.          Must be able to work varied schedule of days and outside normal business hours for scheduled and emergency maintenance and/or upgrades, as well as standard on-call rotation.   
    
  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:     
A Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Security, or Information Assurance, or related field.   
Hands-on experience implementing and supporting at least three of the following: Cisco security devices and products, SIEMs, enterprise Endpoint security products, network and web application scanners, and Web and E-mail Security solutions.   
Experience participating in PCI-DSS and Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act or other industry regulation audits.      

  CERTIFICATIONS AND LICENSES REQUIRED 

        
 1.          Certification as a Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) or Systems Security Certified Practitioner (SSCP) from the International Information Systems Security Certification Consortium (ICS2) or ability to obtain CISSP or SSCP certification within one year from the date of hire, promotion, or placement.       
    
  HOW YOU WILL BE EVALUATED:     
Once the application process is completed, a review of your resume and supporting documentation will be done to determine if you meet the minimum qualification requirements. There is an Assessment questionnaire(s) that you must complete. Your resume and supporting documentation will then be compared to your responses to the assessment questionnaire(s).    If a determination is made that your application does not support your responses, which you provided in the assessment questionnaire, your application will not receive further consideration for this announcement.   
  OTHER INFORMATION:     
      
A background security investigation will be required for all new hires.

Cyber Security Engineer (Job Number:433936) 

Description: 



Job Description 

The successful candidate will be a member of the security engineering section providing technical solutions to USCENTCOM in support of mission critical DoD systems. 

The Cybersecurity Engineer will lead and/or assist with cybersecurity engineering tasks and projects in coordination with government and contract leadership. 

Duties and Responsibilities 
- Support cybersecurity projects, implementations, and plans within and across organizational boundaries as necessary. Perform technical planning, system integration, verification and validation, cost and risk, supportability, and effectiveness analyses for total systems. 
- Support process, analysis, coordination, security certification test, security documentation, as well as investigations, software research, hardware introduction and release, emerging technology research inspections and periodic audits. 
- Assist in the implementation of the required government policies, make recommendations on process tailoring, and participate in and documents process activities. 
- Analyzes user requirements, procedures, and problems to automate or improve existing systems and review computer system capabilities, workflow, and scheduling limitations. 
- Formulates and designs specifications; developing, modifying, and/or maintaining complex systems and subsystems; defining work problems, designing security technology solutions, and developing procedures to resolve problems; analyzing methods of approach; reviewing task proposal requirements, gathering information, analyzing data, preparing synopsis, comparing alternatives, preparing specifications, resolving processing problems, and coordinating work with others; and preparing recommendations for improvement for management consideration. 
- Support the formal Security Test and Evaluation (ST&E) process through pre-test preparations, test participation, analysis of results and preparation of required reports. 

DISL 

Qualifications: 
Qualifications 

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE 
- Bachelor-s degree from an accredited university in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field is preferred. 
- 9 years of progressively increasing responsibilities in the cybersecurity engineering field 
- Must meet DoD 8570.01-M minimum of IAT Level III Certification (i.e. CISSP) 
- Experience managing software development within a CMMI Level 3 (or higher) environment, or equivalent experience working in a managed configuration environment required 

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS 
- Be experienced with security engineering as well as subject matter expert in the DoD/DISA Information Assurance (IA) requirements and have expert knowledge of policies and processes, the DOD Risk Management Framework (RMF), NIST SP 800-53 and CNSSI 1253 security controls, the DoD network environment, industry computer/security standards/best practices, and DoD CND initiatives. 
- Have experience in providing specialized technical subject matter expertise in the planning, and orchestration of the defense-in- depth security engineering, relevant technology and process development, implementation such as security testing, certification and accreditation, intrusion detection policy development, security baseline management as well as IA focused software development in a mixed Windows/Linux environment. 
- Have working knowledge of enclave protection technologies to include Firewalls, Network IDS/IPS systems, Host Based IDS/IPS and Security Incident and Event Management (ArcSight SIEM). Must have solid working experience in designing secure network architectures, virtualization technologies, MySQL/MSSQL database platforms, identity and access management principles, application security, encryption technologies, DNS, web applications, ADFS, Nessus. 
- Have a proven record of successfully supporting projects and priorities in coordination with the customer within contractual boundaries. 
- Have experience leading and working successfully in a multidisciplinary team environment. 
- Must be able to multitask and work in a highly dynamic environment. 
- Have exceptional communication and documentation skills in articulating technical issues to highly technical and non-technical audiences to clarify technical tasks as well as senior management to aid decision-making. 
- Characteristics necessary for success include: inter- and intra-team coordination and communication skills; analytical, presentation, and problem solving skills; operating independently with minimal supervision or feedback; and conceiving new and innovative ideas and solutions, predicting potential outcomes, and determining which course of action to follow. 
- Based on the knowledge gained from the security engineering activities, support the ISSO and the DoD Assessment and Authorization (A&A) process: Support the development of various artifacts required such as security categorization, notification of change, revisions to System Security Plan, and the Plan of Action and Milestones (POA&M) 

DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS 
- Experience with the HQ USCENTCOM/Service Components cybersecurity environment, organization, policies, and programs. 
- Experience with Assured Compliance Assessment Solution (ACAS/NESSUS), DISA Security Content Automation Protocol (SCAP), Host Based Security System (HBSS); Continuous Monitoring and Risk Scoring (CMRS) cybersecurity applications and tools 
- Experience with implementing capabilities within VMware virtual environments 
- Experience with implementing IPS/IDS capabilities with McAfee NSP 
- Experience with implementing McAfee threat intelligence sharing and ATD sandbox malware analysis 
- Experience with Microsoft Visio diagram development for systems data flow representation 
- Working knowledge of enclave protection capabilities to include AD, DNS, SCCM/SCOM, and backup/recovery (EMC) 
- Working knowledge of network infrastructure technologies/practices to include Cisco IOS, VLAN segmentation, Network Access Control (802.1x), and wireless detection tools 
- Working knowledge of protection of data in transit and data at rest to include Suite B and IPsec encryption 
- Cross Domain data access and transfer technologies and related DISN Connection Approval Process 
- ITILv3 Foundations Certification or higher 
- Project management experience (PMP is a plus). 

CLEARANCE REQUIREMENT 
- Currently possess a Top Secret clearance and SCI eligible 

SAIC Overview:SAIC is a premier technology integrator providing full life cycle services and solutions in the technical, engineering, intelligence, and enterprise information technology markets. SAIC is Redefining Ingenuity through its deep customer and domain knowledge to enable the delivery of systems engineering and integration offerings for large, complex projects. SAIC has approximately 15,000 employees are driven by integrity and mission focus to serve customers in the U.S. federal government. Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, SAIC has annual revenues of approximately $4.5 billion. For more information, visit saic.com.

Job Description: 


CSRA, a Federal marketplace leader in next-generation IT solutions and professional services, is seeking highly qualified and motivated IT professionals like you who are eager to contribute to our critical Homeland Security missions. For the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), Office of Biometric Identity Management (OBIM, formerly US-VISIT), CSRA performs operations and maintenance (O&M) of the Automated Biometric Identification System-s (IDENT) production and non-production environments and associated business systems. In support of this effort, CSRA provides Task Order Management, Datacenter Operations, Disaster Recovery/Continuity of Operations, System Management and Monitoring, Service Request Management, Technology Analysis, and Non-production Support (to include Program Support Systems and Transition). CSRA is excited to offer you a unique opportunity to join a best performing O&M team supporting one our nation-s most critical homeland missions - the storage and processing of biometric and associated biographic information for national security, law enforcement, immigration and border management, intelligence, background investigations, and associated testing, training, management reporting, planning and analysis 


We are seeking a Senior Information Assurance / IT Security Engineer who 


designs and implements information assurance and security engineering systems with requirements of business continuity, operations security, cryptography, forensics, regulatory compliance, internal counter-espionage (insider threat detection and mitigation), physical security analysis (including facilities analysis, and security management). Assesses and mitigates system security threats and risks throughout the program life cycle. Validates system security requirements definition and analysis. Establishes system security designs. Implements security designs in hardware, software, data, and procedures. Verifies security requirements; performs system certification and accreditation planning and testing and liaison activities. Supports secure systems operations and maintenance. - Very experienced with Active Directory environments - Create, modify and manage user/computer accounts, policies, security groups, sites, and services. - Create, modify and manage objects within Active Directory. - Create, configure, and troubleshoot GPO-s, as well as link any group and OU to GPO-s - Perform AD server administration for multiple systems in a multi-domain environment. - Ensure all servers are security and patch compliant; analyze monthly mass vulnerability patching of large network. - Work directly with other engineering team in resolving performance and other configuration related issues. - Work directly with the SOC group directly to investigate, isolate, and resolve security incidents and issues. 


BS or equivalent + 14 yrs related experience, or MS + 12 yrs related experience - Strong experience with Active Directory/Domain Services - Ability to create, modify and manage objects within Active Directory. - Knowledgeable with networking, VLAN/IP Addressing/Protocols - Experience with Power Shell or other Windows compatible scripting languages. Experience conducting security audits and review based on Security Hardening Guides & Policies Preferred: - Experience withArcsight - third party auditing system - Experience with Quest Authentication Services - Experience with CA PAM - privileged account management - Experience with HPE ArcSight auditing appliance/function a plus

Job Title: 
     
   Security Engineer 
 
  
 Company Description 
   : 
 
  
Limelight Networks, Inc. (Nasdaq: LLNW) is the content delivery partner for thousands of entertainment, technology, enterprise and government entities around the globe  . Limelight’s mission is to securely manage and globally deliver digital content, building customer satisfaction through exceptional reliability and performance. 
  
 Job Purpose: 
 
   
 
The IT Security Engineer is responsible for developing   and execut  ing   security controls, defenses and countermeasures to intercept and prevent internal or external attacks or attempts to infiltrate company email, data, e-commerce and web-based systems.    This individual m  aintains hardware, software and network fir  ewalls and encryption protocols and a  dministers security policies to control physical and virtual access to systems.                                                 
  
 Essential Functions: 
 
Monitor organization’s networks for security breaches and investigate a violation when one occurs  . 
Install and use software, such as firewalls and data encryption programs, to protect sensitive information  . 
Prepare reports that document security breaches and the extent of the damage caused by the breaches  . 
Conduct penetration testing  . 
Research the latest information technology (IT) security trends  . 
Help plan and carry out an organization’s way of handling security  . 
Develop security standards and best practices for their organization  . 
Recommend security enhancements to management or senior IT staff  . 

   
 
 Qualifications 
  :     
     
 
  
Experience and Education (minimums) 
  
5 years + experience in information technology security or similar field  . 
Working experience with intrusion detection systems  . 
Very strong UNIX skills and experience  . 
Experience with software and security architectures  . 
Experience with security practices of Intranet and Extranet  . 

  
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities 
  
Organized, responsive and highly thorough problem solver  . 
Solid knowledge of information security principles and practices  . 
Understanding of advanced security protocols and standards  . 
Hands on approach to the evaluation and development of approach to security risks and vulnerabilities  . 
Proactively assesses potential items of risk and opportunities of vulnerability in the network  . 
Technical Knowledge: UNIX, Linux, Various IDS and ESM, SSL, VPN,   IPSec  , TCP/IP, DNS and web security architecture,   mySQL  ,   Nmap  . 

  
  
This job description is not an all-inclusive summary of duties or responsibilities. Job duties or responsibilities may change with or without advance notice.

R0018279  


Booz Allen Hamilton has been at the forefront of strategy and technology for more than 100 years Today, the firm provides management and technology consulting and engineering services to leading Fortune 500 corporations, governments, and not-for-profits across the globe. Booz Allen partners with public and private sector clients to solve their most difficult challenges through a combination of consulting, analytics, mission operations, technology, systems delivery, cybersecurity, engineering and innovation expertise.  


Information Systems Security Engineer, Senior  

Key Role:  


Provide Cybersecurity engineering and support to security controls assessors and validators on assessment and authorization efforts for systems that are considered major upgrades or use complex or leading-edge technology, participating in and providing subject matter expertise for laboratory and operational security assessments. Participate in Information Assurance (IA) discovery briefs with the client's Delegated Authorizing Official. Review security controls selections, tailoring, implementation, and testing, analyze scan results from network- and host-based security scanning tools, and recommend mitigations for security control deficiencies. Perform security assessments, design reviews, and provide IA guidance for new technologies, including Cloud implementations, cross-domain solutions, Big Data and relational databases, and Web services. Develop, design, integrate, test, document, deploy, operate, and maintain automated tools for security testing, including Host Based Security System  


 (HBSS) and Assured Compliance Assessment Solution (ACAS). Support the architectural design, integration, installation, configuration, testing, documentation, administration, and operations and maintenance (O&M) of systems and capabilities to support scanning, monitoring, and reporting of compliance testing and Intelligence Community Vulnerability Alerts and Bulletins (ICVA/ICVB). Develop security documentation that is compliant with Intelligence Community Directive (ICD) 503, 500-series Intelligence Community Standards (ICSs), and related National Institutes of Standards and Technology (NIST) 800-series Special Publications (SPs).  

Basic Qualifications:  


-Experience with DoD Information Assurance (IA) Certification and Accreditation Process (DIACAP), DoD Risk Management Framework (RMF), ICD 503, and NIST RMF  


 -Experience with the intelligence community (IC), DoD, Navy Intelligence (NAVINTEL) IA, Fleet Cyber Command, and DoD Intelligence Information System (DoDIIS) tools, systems, reporting mechanisms, and requirements for Assessment and Authorization (A&A)  


 -Experience with implementing and executing security engineering practices in the system or software development life cycle (SDLC) process and designing, developing, and using host-based and network-based scanning tools  


 -Experience in the installation, configuration, testing, deployment, and O&M of enterprise-wide network-based scanning tools, including Retina and ACAS in support of compliance testing and continuous monitoring  


 -Experience in UNIX/Linux, including Solaris or Red Hat Enterprise Linux or Microsoft Windows operating systems, including Server 2012R2, Server 2016, Windows 7, Windows 10, and DoD Secure Host Baselines  


 -Knowledge of the DoD, IC, and national-level system security initiatives and secure information, Local Area Network/Wide Area Network, Cloud technologies, cross-domain solutions, and technologies  


 -Knowledge of developing security controls, testing methodologies, and test procedures for systems, Cloud-based architectures, and cross-domain solutions  


 -TS/SCI clearance  


 -BA or BS degree in Computer Science (CS), Electrical Engineering (EE), Information Technology (IT), or Information Assurance (IA)  


 -Certified Information System Security Professional (CISSP) Certification  

Additional Qualifications:  


-2 years of experience with project management preferred  


 -Experience with Security Content Automation Protocol (SCAP) based tools and specifications  


 -Experience in system or software design, development, integration, testing, system administration, and O&M  


 -Experience in Java, C, or C++ software development  


 -Ability to display proactive, results-oriented, interpersonal, and customer relations and team-building expertise  


 -Possession of excellent oral and written communications skills  


 -MS degree in Computer Science (CS), Electrical Engineering (EE), Information Technology (IT), Information Assurance (IA), or related field  


 -CISSP-Information System Security Engineering Professional (CISSP-ISSEP) Certification  

Clearance:  


Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance is required.  


 Integrating a full range of consulting capabilities, Booz Allen is the one firm that helps clients solve their toughest problems by their side to help them achieve their missions. Booz Allen is committed to delivering results that endure.  


 We are proud of our diverse environment, EOE, M/F/Disability/Vet.

security engineer.skills: Security, Cisco, Firewall
security engineer.jobDescription:
Cloud Network Security Engineer

Boston, MA


This is a high impact position, helping to drive operational and technical excellence across a suite of Cloud initiatives.

The Cloud Network Security Engineer will be an in-house subject matter expert who is responsible for the improvement of information and network security across the organization by understanding the threats they face and sets direction via policy and technology mechanisms. You will work closely and collaboratively with other members of the team, including systems and network personnel.

Our Cloud Services is the fastest growing division and is treated as a startup. Being inside a decades old, highly successful company allows us the freedom of a startup without worrying about funding or support.

Responsibilities

Design, configure, test, deploy, and support network security systems
Work collaboratively with other team members on customer solutions
Manage security related controls/policies
Review network security events and take appropriate action based on MSB security policy
Manage operational and technical aspects of cloud partner vendor relationships in a technology-diverse environment
Proactively identify, communicate, and mitigate risks associated with ongoing operations and new / planned releases
Assist with preventative maintenance and help to drive service improvements through feedback / recommendations to 
Participate in on-call rotation for 24x7 coverage of production infrastructure; respond as needed to actionable alerts
Participate in on-call rotation and performs other duties as assigned


Basic Qualifications

Minimum 5 years of progressively responsible IT experience with at least 3 years of security/infrastructure protection experience
Hands on experience with networking and security systems and software i.e. virtual/physical Routers, Switches, Firewalls, SIEMs, DDoS, VMware NSX
CCNP level of networking knowledge –LAN, WAN, Firewall, Wireless
BGP and OSPF routing protocols
Experience with Windows and Linux operating systems
Hands on experience with endpoint security technologies i.e. encryption, antivirus, DLP, HIPs, and malware
Experience with Security Program/Roadmap design, and creation of security policies, standards, guidelines, etc.
Ability to troubleshoot complex networks and design network security solutions



TCM is an EEO/Vets/Disabled Employer.

security engineer.skills: Aerospace, Ethernet, Linux, Management, Networking, Risk Management, Security, TCP/IP, Unix, Windows
security engineer.jobDescription:
At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems in air and space that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our work preserves freedom and democracy, and advances human discovery and our understanding of the universe. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have a lot of fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work - and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.  


 Northrop Grumman Aerospace Systems has an opening for a Cyber Security Engineer 2 to join our team of qualified, diverse individuals. This position will be located in Melbourne, FL.  

 The selected candidate will develop and implement cyber security plans and procedures to support various aircraft, space and ground systems. 

Qualifications 
 Basic Qualifications:  
 Bachelor's Degree in a Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) discipline from an accredited university and 2+ years of Cyber Security OR Master's Degree in a Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM)  
 Knowledge of basic systems engineering principles and concepts.  
 Experience in documenting the security posture of a system and reporting on security controls assigned to the system.  
 Experience validating security assessments and reviews.  
 2+ years of direct experience with DoD C&A activities, security processes, and documentation/reporting using RMF, DIACAP, NIST, CNSSI, or NISPOM guidance as required  
 2+ years experience submitting ongoing authorization inputs and artifacts to support authorizing authority's ongoing assessment and authorization decisions.  
 Must possess familiarity/knowledge of both Windows and UNIX/Linux based platforms.  
 Must possess certification as required by DoD Directive 8570 +) for an IASAE Level II Position  
 2+ years of experience using and working with fundamental information technology principles, concepts and techniques to including software languages, design concepts, test methods, and integration practices.  
 Ability to obtain a DOD Secret clearance and maintain it throughout employment.  

 Preferred Qualifications:  

 - Experience with the Risk Management Framework (NIST SP 800-53) and Committee for National Security Systems Instruction (CNSSI 1253).  

 - Experience with the application of the RMF to the DoD (DoDi 8500.01 Cybersecurity).  

 - Experience with the application of NIST 800-171 (Controlled Unclassified Information).  

 - Ability to understand and apply company methodologies, standard, and policies  

 - Knowledge of fundamental information technology principles, concepts and techniques to including software languages, design concepts, test methods, and integration practices  

 - Experience transitioning from DIACAP to RMF  

 - Experience using Xacta and eMass  

 - Experience in documenting the security posture of a system and reporting on security controls assigned to the system  

 - Experience validating security assessments and reviews  

 - Experience submitting ongoing authorization inputs and artifacts to support certifying authority's ongoing authorization decisions to operate and test decisions  

 - Experience performing moderately complex security information technology tasks independently  

 - Familiarity with Windows and UNIX or Linux based platforms  

 - Familiarity with TCP/IP and Ethernet networking  

 - Familiarity with information technology principles, concepts and techniques to including software languages, design concepts, test methods, and integration practices  

 - Active DoD Secret clearance or DoD Top Secret clearance  


Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit www.northropgrumman.com/EEO . U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

security engineer.skills: Agile, Analysis, Architecture, Cisco, CMS, Development, Linux, Management, Micro, Networking, Security, SSL, System Architecture, VMware, Windows
security engineer.jobDescription:
Founded in 2001, Blue Canopy is an award-winning provider of business solutions in the public and commercial sectors. We're focused on delivering outcomes that matter by combining the best use of technology, process improvement, and the system of governance. Our Mission is to serve our clients and help them achieve success by combing governance, industry experience, and information technology excellence. 

 At Blue Canopy, innovation, collaboration, and teamwork are the driving force behind our success. We are committed to hiring, retaining, and developing best-in-class professionals because we recognize that our team is what differentiates us in the marketplace as an industry-leader. We are driven by excellence, committed to integrity, and inspired to achieve limitless possibilities. 


 Blue Canopy is currently seeking a Full-Time Security Engineer to provide onsite support in Woodlawn MD or Northern VA. We are building our team of skilled engineers and administrators who are interested in taking their career to the next level in cyber-security by working with a wide set of cyber tools including: McAfee, Splunk, Archer, Trend Micro, Bit9, Blue Coat, Invincea, Tripwire, VMware, DLP technologies and more. We are seeking those with the passion to not only implement, but also challenge them to learn both existing and new leading security solutions in an environment where results matter. 



 The Role:   

 * Support of RSA SSL Interceptors. 

 * Responsible for maintaining Security Appliances 

 * Transitioning the team from sequential development to an Agile methodology 

 * Tool Integration Requirements Analysis 

 * Cyber Threat Intelligence situational awareness 

 * Identifying Capabilities and Recommends Solutions 

 * Authored security documentation for Compliance and operational needs. 

 * DHS/CMS Einstein appliance POC and data feed management 



 What You Need to Bring to the Table:   

 * Experience with support of SOCs and\or data center server-based products 

 * Familiarity with modern Windows Operating systems, VMware Hypervisor 5.x or later and VDI, and Linux based Operating systems 

 * Trend Micro Administration 

 + Trend Micro Certified Professional, or 

 + Trend Micro Certified Expert 

 * Networking configuration and terms, Cisco and/or Juniper network technologies 

 * Experience in the development of: 

 + Installation/Deployment Procedures 

 + Documenting Requirements 

 + Test Plans 

 + System architecture documentation 

 + Visio architecture diagrams 



 Desired Qualifications:   

 * 3-5+ yrs. experience performing some or all of the following duties: 

 + Engineer, install, configure and or administer SIEM products 

 + Engineer, install, configure Trend Micro solutions 

 + Engineer, install, configure and/or administer Microsoft Suite of Server based Products 

 + Engineer, install, configure and or administer Cisco or Juniper network equipment 

 + Provide support for integration new server services 



 Bonus Qualifications:   

 * Familiarity with Splunk 

 * Proven teamwork skills 

 * Ability to take responsibility and initiative 

 * A strong desire to learn new methodologies and tools. 



 Clearance Required:   Public Trust (clearable to as high as Top Secret) 


 As a full-time employee of Blue Canopy, you are eligible for an attractive benefits package, which includes medical, dental, life insurance, and short-term and long-term disability insurance. Our benefits also include paid holidays, Paid-Time-Off (PTO), a company-sponsored 401(k) plan, tuition reimbursement plan, and flexible spending accounts to allow you to pay for Health, Dependent care and Commuter costs with pre-tax income. 


 Blue Canopy, LLC is EOE/AA/M/F/Vet/Disability

security engineer.skills: Network Security, CCNP, ITIL, Cisco, DHS CDM
security engineer.jobDescription:
Candidates must be Clearable


 


Position Description:


The Network Security Engineer will be responsible for securing a robust Cisco enterprise wide network infrastructure as well as working on enterprise type surge projects.

 


Responsibilities:                     

Responsible for installing, securing, configuring and maintaining network infrastructure in support of business processing requirements.
Responsible for implementing the DHS CDM toolset.
Responsible for auditing, system control management and securing enterprise wide networking/system infrastructure.   
Responsible for supporting complex project efforts involving the security of the networking/system infrastructure.
Schedules system/hardware security audits and implements/establishes IT security policies and procedures.
Monitors and tunes the enterprise environment to achieve optimum security levels. 
Implement system security enhancements that will improve the security and protection of the environment.
Ensures site connectivity and recoverability by implementing a fault tolerant networking backbone. 
Establishes networking environment by designing system configuration; directing system installation; defining, documenting, and enforcing system standards.
Conducts routine network hardware and software audits to ensure compliance with established standards, policies, and configuration guidelines.

 


Position Requirements/Qualifications:


The Network Engineer shall meet one or more of the following requirements. Client does not expect a single individual to be knowledgeable in all areas:

 


Education and Certifications

BS/BA in related field preferred
CCNP-Security level certification or equivalent preferred
ITIL v3 Foundations Certification preferred

 


Knowledge and Experience

A minimum of five years of experience in Federal contracting is required. 
Experience with the DHS Continuous Diagnostics and Monitoring (CDM) Suite for Small Agencies is strongly preferred. 
One must understand complex enterprise IT environments and have exceptional written and oral communication, interpersonal, problem-solving, analytical, and organizational skills.

security engineer.skills: Arbor, CCNA, CCNP, CISSP, Firewall, IBM, Management, MCP, MCSE, Security, Testing, Windows
security engineer.jobDescription:
Senior Cloud Security Engineer 


Job Description 


CoStar: 


CoStar provides industry professionals and consumers of commercial real estate and apartments with critical knowledge to explore and complete transactions by offering the most comprehensive, timely and standardized information on commercial real estate and apartments and the right innovative tools to utilize that information. 


Opportunity: 


Identify and implement security improvements across public clouds utilized in the delivery of CoStar-s customer facing products as well as internal productivity applications. Implement secure practices, defense in-depth and monitoring and event response tool sets to handle growing threats in the cloud. Work closely with DevOps, DBAs, Systems, and Network engineers to refine security practices. 


Relevant experience areas (deep expertise required in at least 3): 

* Engineering cloud security in AWS, Azure, or Googlecloud IaaS and PaaS offerings 

* Cloud security automation tools - Security Monnkey, Cloudwatch, CloudCheckr, Evident.io, Cloud Conformity, or similar tools 

* Web Application Firewall such as Akamai Kona, AWS WAF, Arbor, Prolexic, or similar tools 

* Building a cloud SIEM - Cloudtrail, Cloudwatch, and other packaged SIEMs such as IBM Qradar, LogRythm, Splunk, ELK, ArcSight 

* Cloud access security broker (CASB) or similar experience securing SaaS offerings such as O365, GoogleApps, and other cloud vendors. 

* Previous participation in bug-hunting, pen tests, vulnerability assessments 

* Designing cloud-native privileged account management solutions in the cloud for key management, service account and secrets management, rotation and event response. Experience with tools such as Vault (HashiCorp), Cloud KMS, or similar tool set. 


Required Qualifications: 

* Bachelors in Computer Science or related Field 


Optional, but very relevant Certifications: 

* AWS CSA, SANS/GIAC, CISSP, CISA, CISM, CEH, CCNA, CCNP, MCSE, MCP, MCTS, Security+, MCITP 


Operational Responsibilities: 

* Position requires participation in a 24x7 on-call rotation and off hour's maintenance windows 


CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

security engineer.skills: Analysis, Architecture, Cisco, Customer Service, Development, Management, Networking, Protocols, Security, System Architecture
security engineer.jobDescription:
Overview

 By Light is seeking a Network Security Engineer to join our Joint Regional Security Stacks (JRSS) program team. This is an exciting key position to a major Department of Defense initiative. The right candidate should possess a strong security background and be current on the latest security products to help drive solutions and management architectures.

 By Light is an IT products and services firm specializing in software development, satellite/terrestrial communications, cyber security, and network engineering/design. Headquartered in Arlington, VA, we provide support worldwide to DOD, Federal Civilian, and Health IT customers.

Responsibilities

 * The candidate will help drive solutions and management architectures of the Computer Network Defense (CND) portion of JRSS
 * Will work in the JRSS lab to provide feedback on current solutions, keep current on vendor products and help drive future architectures
 * Document and brief system architecture and changes to various government officials
 * Constantly looking for ways to make improvements

Required Experience/Qualifications

 * Degree in Computer Science/Engineering or 2 to 5 years equivalent work experience
 * Must have minimum of active DOD Secret clearance
 * Hands-on experience in configuration of any of the firewalls and/or Intrusion Detection systems (IDS) such as Palo Alto, Cisco FirePower, Cisco StealthWatch, Tipping Point, Inquest or OPSWAT
 * Working knowledge of security threat vectors, networking, network security, and application security
 * In-depth knowledge of common network protocols and security vulnerabilities is required
 * Solid organizational skills, ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced dynamic environment
 * Good problem-solving skills, ability to develop effective long-term solutions to complex problems
 * Able to effectively prioritize tasks
 * Strong customer service orientation
 * Comfortable working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment

Preferred Experience/Qualifications

 * Strong networking knowledge and packet analysis is a plus

 An Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities
 #CJ

Description: 
THE COMPANY 


Are you interested in helping solve today's most critical housing challenges? In simplest terms, Fannie Mae serves the people who house America. We work at the heart of housing by providing reliable, affordable mortgage financing in all markets at all times, buying loans that banks and other lenders originate, so they can fund new loans. This gives more people the opportunity to buy, refinance, or rent homes and apartments. Creating these opportunities is what drives the people who work at Fannie Mae. 


For more information about Fannie Mae, visit  http\://www.fanniemae.com/progress 
JOB INFORMATION 
Fannie Mae is seeking a Senior Security Engineer that will be responsible for a large enterprise post implementation of  


ArcSight .This role requires a technical and self-motivated individual who is results-driven.This person must be detail-oriented, have excellent communication skills, and exhibit a high degree of corporate maturity, collaboration, and commitment to production uptime and data integrity.  

KEY JOB FUNCTIONS 





Maintenance, monitoring and restoration of the HPE ArcSight components (ArcSight Enterprise Security Manager (ESM), ArcSight Connector Appliances, ArcMC, ArcSight Logger, RepSM, and ArcSight UBA). 







Perform troubleshooting of ArcSight components and applications when security events are not getting collected or collection caching is experienced. 







Configuration of current and new ArcSight Smart and Flex Connectors for log ingestion. 







Develop custom parsers as needed for logs that are not supported out of the box. 







Maintain the latest ArcSight versions, patching and best practices to ensure system functionality and to address known exploits 







Develop automated reporting dashboards within the existing ESM and Logger to provide near real-time reporting of log collection and overall visibility for all connected assets. 







Modify the ArcSight operational parameters (filters, channels, rulesets, etc.) as needed and/or requested. 







Perform regular required reporting, monitor applicable security resources for updated requirements and compliance directions. 







Develop metrics resulting from logging, detection and alerting of SIEM events. 







Structure training for Jr. ArcSight Engineers and Operations. 







Able to discuss ArcSight requirements with a stakeholder(s), challenge and clarify when appropriate. 







From the requirements, be able to develop a high level design or plan, and then estimate the amount of effort required to deliver. 



Qualification: 




EDUCATION 




Bachelor's Degree in computer science or related discipline or equivalent experience  





MINIMUM EXPERIENCE 




5+ years of related experience  





SPECIALIZED KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS 


Experience with Windows, UNIX, network operating systems, databases, virtual systems and Cloud Computing markets and integrations. 

3-5 years' experience with scripting / programming languages. 

Certification associated to SIEM Vendor technologies is considered a plus. 

Certifications (A+, Network+, Security+, CISSP, GSEC, GCED, GIAC, SSCP, CEH) is considered a plus. 

Experience working with security tools and technologies to include SIEM, and/or data analytics systems. 

Must have demonstrated ability to tune the SIEM event correlation rules and logic to filter out security events associated with known and well established network behavior, known false positives and/or known errors. 

Previous experience working with SIEM technologies (i.e. ArcSight, Splunk). 


Previous experience working with event logging systems (Syslog) as well as event logging (Windows, UNIX, Linux event logs). 


Previous Information Assurance or Cyber Experience in the banking or financial industry. 


Good understanding of networking fundamentals. 


Must possess strong written and verbal communication skills and must be capable of the understanding, documenting, communicating and presenting technical issues in a non-technical manner to audiences with varying degrees of technical expertise.  







EMPLOYMENT  


As a condition of employment with Fannie Mae, any successful job applicant will be required to pass a pre-employment drug screen and to successfully complete a background investigation, which may also include a credit check for positions in some areas of our business.   






Fannie Mae is an Equal Opportunity Employer.    

Department:  Information Management

security engineer.jobDescription:
Seeking an enthusiastic and high-energy professional focused on engineering and supporting Security Event Management Platforms and Systems. As an Information Security Platform Engineer, you will directly support the Threat Intelligence and Analytics team by ensuring that all security platforms are built, configured and maintained to the specifications defined in all product guides and service level agreements. In this role, you will work in a high performance, team environment to design, build and maintain service provider grade solutions. You will also provide technical guidance and mentoring of the SOC staff who will perform analytic and technical reviews using the supported platforms to investigate security events, complete security device operational management activities and perform all SOC case management, escalation and notification services. 
·         Participate in technical design phases to architect solutions that meet the desired business objectives 
·        Architect and design secure solutions based on best-practice control frameworks such as NIST, ISO27000, CSA-CCM, and HITRUST 
·        Maintain enterprise security architecture documentation 
·        Establish measurements and thresholds for information security control effectiveness 
·         Develop functional and technical requirements for security initiatives encompassing our SIEM platform on which we deliver our core SEM MSSP services, TVM solutions, and any consulting services or new initiatives 
·        Define, lead, implement and testing of security solutions 
·        Collaborate with Senior Leadership to provide consulting on enterprise projects 
·        Lead and participate in security risk assessment and remediation planning 
·         As a team member, assist in designing and implementing new infrastructure, maintain existing infrastructure, and fix problems as they develop. 
·        Proactively monitor assigned systems for health, availability and capacity issues 
·        Use computer security knowledge to create automated processes for the security applications in the GBprotect infrastructure. 
·        Engage directly with customers to enable services, fix problems as they develop, and suggest improvements in configuration or service. 
·        Individually and as part of a team, create procedures and documentation for the GBprotect team to allow them to efficiently use the Applications and Appliances. 
·        Provide input to product feature enhancements and process improvements. 
·        Understand the client environments and work closely with the Analysts, Customer Relationship Manager, Sales and leadership to translate customer's needs into product enhancements and services. 
·        Provides knowledge support for other GBprotect teams. 
Job Duties 
·        Develop, implement and maintain complex security software solutions 
·         Strong focus required with Log Management and Security Information Event Management platforms a must – Strong preference for in-depth working knowledge of ArcSight ESM and ADP 
·        Demonstrated ability in the implementation and management of complex enterprise security software platforms – preference of at least 3-5 years in a customer delivery or service provider like environment 
·        Drive innovation, creativity, collaboration, and professional growth of the Security Operations Team 
·        Maintain strong standards, operating processes and procedures, and promote efficiency, accountability, and maintain a high morale 
·        Define training requirements and oversee all training activities and exercises to maintain and promote SOC team proficiency 
·        Support all service delivery teams to support all new client and services turn-ups 
·        Perform Event Stream Architecture methodologies to identify, organize, and develop use cases to normalize events and produce events of interest for operations to detect and respond to 
·        Evaluate existing technical capabilities and systems to identify opportunities for improvement 
·        Ensure that SOC team personnel are providing excellent customer service and support 
Knowledge, Skills and Qualifications 
·        Bachelor’s degree or equivalent knowledge and experience with 7 years of demonstrated experience in a senior security engineering role 
·        Well-developed, effective communication practices with customers, vendors and peers. 
·        Experience driving problem resolution to completion through aggressive and responsible management of the problem resolution process across vendor and internal organizations 
·        Customer service skills with an operational background, preferably with enterprise networks that are part of a 24X7X365 environment. 
·        Experience working in fast paced environments, and the ability to manage workloads during times of elevated stress or escalated activities 
·        Willingness to be active in the training, coaching, and development of the SOC team members 
·        Experience in developing, implementing, and maintaining operational quality metrics 
·        Ability to communicate enterprise IT and security concepts to personnel at all technical and business levels 
·         Ability to manage ambiguous and conflicting requirements and build technical consensus 
·        Proven track record of creative problem solving, and the desire to create and build new processes and procedures 
·        Strong time management and multi-tasking skills with demonstrated high attention to detail 
·        Strong understanding of security architectures and security device management at an operations level 
·        Strong understanding of the root cause analysis process and ability to document and present findings for failures and remediation plans that prevent recurrence 
·         Comfortable with impromptu tasking and loosely defined or changing requirements 
·        Strong analytical and investigation skills 
·        Excellent oral and written communication skills 
·        Strong understanding of customer service management and ticket and case management concepts and processes 
·        Ability to think strategically and apply tactical fixes to provide continuous SOC service delivery improvement 
·        Ability to turn high-level goals into actionable steps and develop roadmaps to achieve stated goals 
·        Ability to mentor and coach less experienced security operations personnel to learn new techniques and strategies to provide more through investigations and higher quality escalations and case management 
·        Information Security Certifications (CISSP, CISA, GIAC Advanced Certifications, and/or related vendor certifications) are a plus 
·         Solid understanding of information security threats and attack types 
·         Experience creating reports and dashboards in complex security tools 
·        Experience with several of the following technologies: Syslog, CEF, TCP/IP, WMI, Linux/Unix, Windows Server, SQL, Elastic Search, Storage architecture, Next Generation firewalls, IPS/IDS, Advanced Endpoint Security, NAC, DLP 
·        Sound understanding and knowledge of the principles of log management SIEM platforms (GBprotect will provide SIEM training for the right candidate) 
·        Experience planning, scaling, implementing, monitoring, and troubleshooting any of the following SIEM environments: splunk, QRadar, Nitro, LogRhythm, LogLogic, ArcSight, ELK, etc., Certifications on these platforms is a definite plus 
·         Experience managing a variety of security tools including endpoint security products, vulnerability, scanning tools, and advanced persistent threat platforms. 
Additional, Value Added Qualifications 
·        In-depth knowledge of various protocols running at different layers of the OSI model including TCP, UDP, spanning tree, IPSEC VPN, OSPF, FTP, FTPS, SFTP, various VoIP related protocols 
·        Should possess a strong information and data security background from both a logical and operational standpoint. 
·         In-Depth Experience with Kill-Chain analysis and Incident Response frameworks and procedures 
·        Experience supporting large-scale Layer 2/3 infrastructures 
·        Solid understanding of prevalent information security laws and regulations (i.e. HIPAA, SOX, PCI-DSS)

security engineer.jobDescription:
What you’ll be doing... 
  This is a Senior SOC Engineer position responsible for the management of Verizon's Security Services infrastructure and customer security devices. You will work closely with the Security Operations Center (SOC Tier II) as an escalation point for complex incident, problem or change analysis for external, managed security services federal customers. When working on changes, responsibilities include reviewing requirements, designing, documenting and implementing in accordance with Verizon and customer change control standards.   
  Incident, Change and Problem Management related to security design, engineer, document and implement changes in security devices.   
  Escalation point for security and network incidents.   
  Developing Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) and overall operations documentation as needed.   
  Training of peers in an effort to share lessons learned.   
  Planning and overseeing Release management entities (ex. security patching, signatures, code upgrades).   
  Perform RMA of devices whenever necessary.   
  Work side by side with SOC (tiers II and I), IT Development, Security Engineering and Product Lifecycle Engineering as needed.   


What we’re looking for... 
  You'll need to have:   
  Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience.   
  Three or more years of relevant work experience.   
  Experience implementing, configuring, and troubleshooting Fortinet, Palo Alto and/or Juniper SRX firewalls.   
  Experience implementing, configuring, and troubleshooting one or more of the following: encryptors (e.g. Thales, McAfee), FireEye, SourceFire, Gigamon, BlueCoat proxies, A10, or F5 Load balancers.   
  Currently have or eligibility to obtain a government issued security clearance at the Secret level.   

  Even better if you have:   
  Bachelor's degree in a technical field such as Computer Science, Engineering, Cybersecurity or 5 or more years of experience as a security device engineer.   
  Understanding of DNS, NTP, SNMP protocols.   
  Experience on UNIX/Linux operating system command line interface (CLI).   
  Experience with Thales Encryptors.   
  Strong communication skills and ability to engage with customers to understand their requirements.   
  Strong organizational, problem-solving, and analytical skills.   
  Ability to identify and communicate gaps in processes.   
  Ability to excel in high pressure environments.   
  Ability to work and participate within a team environment.   
  Hands-on experience configuring and troubleshooting security and networking devices in complex, enterprise level environments and/or experience as a SOC engineer.   
  Platform experience with SIEM.   
  Fundamental knowledge of a variety of firewall, IDS, and security devices.   
  Ability to understand how security and networking technologies might be utilized in customer environments or in a comprehensive security solution.   
  Experience working as a member of an integrated network and security team.   
  Ability to communicate effectively with customers via phone, email or ticket escalations.   
  Security Certifications.   

When you join Verizon... 


You’ll be doing work that matters alongside other talented people, transforming the way people, businesses and things connect with each other. Beyond powering America’s fastest and most reliable network, we’re leading the way in broadband, cloud and security solutions, Internet of Things and innovating in areas such as, video entertainment. Of course, we will offer you great pay and benefits, but we’re about more than that. Verizon is a place where you can craft your own path to greatness. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, find your future at Verizon.  

Equal Employment Opportunity 


We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer- and celebrate our employees' differences, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or Veteran status. Different makes us better.

security engineer.jobDescription:
What you’ll be doing... 
Security Analysts comprise the primary labor force within the Security Operations Center. Tier-2 Security Analysts come from an enterprise background with at least two years’ experience working in a security-related field, enabling them to undertake a wide variety of tasks across a number of different platforms. Analysts will handle day-to-day tasks, as well as short-notice ad-hoc work, and see them through to completion with minimal supervision. Security Analysts provide critical value to the RSA Security Analytics management service, leveraging their extensive knowledge to provide context to events; recommendations for remediation actions; and suggestions for implementing best practices and improving standard processes and procedures. 
Duties of the Tier-2 Security Analyst include: 
Providing “eyes on glass” real-time security monitoring in a 24x7 environment; 
Active real-time security monitoring of alerts and escalating critical alerts to in compliance with the appropriate service levels;

Hunting techniques

What we’re looking for... 
Security Analysts comprise the primary labor force within the Security Operations Center. Tier-2 Security Analysts come from an enterprise background with at least two years’ experience working in a security-related field, enabling them to undertake a wide variety of tasks across a number of different platforms. Analysts will handle day-to-day tasks, as well as short-notice ad-hoc work, and see them through to completion with minimal supervision. Security Analysts provide critical value to the RSA Security Analytics management service, leveraging their extensive knowledge to provide context to events; recommendations for remediation actions; and suggestions for implementing best practices and improving standard processes and procedures. 
Duties of the Tier-2 Security Analyst include: 
Providing “eyes on glass” real-time security monitoring in a 24x7 environment; 
Active real-time security monitoring of alerts and escalating critical alerts to in compliance with the appropriate service levels; 
Advanced security event detection and threat analysis for complex and/or escalated security events;

Maintaining the SOC Knowledge Base;

You’ll be doing work that matters alongside other talented people, transforming the way people, businesses and things connect with each other. security engineer.skills: security/voice/video/network infrastructure, including LAN, WLAN, MAN, and WAN,
security engineer.jobDescription:
Primarily responsible for the design, installation, and ongoing maintenance of all enterprise information security infrastructure systems at Baylor College of Medicine, including but not limited to internal and external firewalls, web proxies, intrusion detection/prevention systems, virtual private networks, and application delivery controllers. Also collaborates with other IT team members in the design, configuration, and support of Baylor's voice and data network infrastructure, ensuring its optimal performance, while integrating robust and non-intrusive security, and providing ongoing support for all communications systems (data, telephony, video, mobility, and multimedia back-end systems).


• Works at the direction of the Manager of Network Engineering and Security (NES) and the Director of Communications Technology; may also receive direction from more senior team members of the NES team.
• Works from a ticketing system queue toward the resolution of data security, voice, video, and networking-related issues.
• Works closely with the IT Security and Compliance team toward the implementation and maintenance of all data security-related infrastructure and policy.
• Possesses a working knowledge of appliances and applications used to monitor and manage Baylor’s security/voice/video/data network infrastructure.
• Performs installation, repair, ongoing maintenance, and troubleshooting of Baylor's data security/voice/video/network infrastructure, including LAN, WLAN, MAN, and WAN, located at the main campus, as well as throughout the Texas Medical Center and remote locations in the Houston metropolitan area.
• Administers the security-related modules of the application delivery controller environment.
• Assists in the investigation and documentation of incidents involving, either directly or indirectly, the security and/or data infrastructure.
• Assists in identifying security risks by participating in security reviews, evaluations, and risk assessments.
• Assists in developing information protection procedures and guidelines to support various aspects of the BCM information security program.
• Provides ongoing consulting assistance in addressing security issues and in implementing security policies and procedures
• Provides cross-training to other Communication Technologies team members and mentoring to junior members of Network Engineering and Security.
• Manages data security and networking projects of all sizes.
• Participates in IP addressing scheme design decisions on an as- needed basis.
• Provides escalation support for the junior NES team members, as well as for the Help Desk, Field Services, and Communications Services and Operations team.
• Develops and maintains a detailed understanding of the physical locations that make up Baylor's security/voice/video/data network infrastructure, that include, but are not limited to data centers, MDFs, IDFs, fiber infrastructure, and customer computer rooms
• Develops budgetary information for security, voice, video, and data projects.
• Contributes content to departmental web pages on an as-needed basis, including and in particular, 'how-to' customer documentation
• Provides supporting information for, and occasionally writes and updates departmental documentation, including standards, processes, and procedures and topology drawings/maps.
• Works in a project matrix environment on ad-hoc project teams under the direction of the PMO
• Frequently engages with technical counterparts at other TMC affiliate institutions in support of Baylor's computing customers located across the Texas Medical Center.
• Participates in an on-call rotation, including holidays (sick time and vacation time do not apply).

Required:
• Associate's Degree in technology-related field.
• Four years of general IT experience.

Preferred:
• Bachelor's Degree in a related field.
• Six years of security and/or data networking experience.
• CISSP, CEH, and/or Cisco associate level certifications (CCNA/CCDA) a plus.
