security engineer.skills: Information Security
security engineer.jobDescription:
Position Summary:


The Senior Security position will interact daily with business stakeholders and technical/operational teams to determine and develop security architecture approaches and solutions. The position provides support, configuration and administration of security tool sets and infrastructure, as well as investigation of information security events. The position provides support for the development and maintenance of policies and procedures within area of responsibility. The position also researches, evaluates and recommends security solutions to solve business needs.

 

This position requires comprehensive knowledge within a functional area. Performs work under general direction and work is reviewed upon completion for adequacy in meeting objectives and ensuring compliance with processes, standards and policies of the organization. Provides technical solutions to a wide range of difficult and complex problems. Solutions are imaginative, thorough, practical and consistent with the objectives of the organization. This position may train and mentor less experienced professionals.

 

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:

Plan or support all phases of moderately complex projects.
Provide comprehensive guidance on leading security design practices.
Evaluate, design, implement, monitor and support security infrastructure including IAM, IPS, SIEM, FW’s, VM, Endpoint, WAF’s, DLP, VPN and other tools or systems.
Develop and maintain incident response procedures; train stakeholders on appropriate action plans.
Determine and develop security architecture approaches and solutions, conduct business reviews and develop detailed specifications.
Lead security implementation projects; manage project timelines and metrics.
Collaborate with operational teams to identify, resolve and mitigate risk and vulnerabilities.
Educate the business and other teams about security awareness.
Create policy and procedures when needed and applicable.
Design and maintain identity and access management for enterprise networks and infrastructure.
Assist with compliance, audits, assessments and evidence collections.
Monitor daily threat intelligence research and interact with external security organizations.
Monitor and evaluate remote access security and external facing architecture.

 

Minimum Education & Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in a related discipline (e.g. Computer Information Systems, Information System Technologies, Management Information Systems). In lieu of a degree, six (6) years’ directly related experience will be considered.
Five (5) years’ directly related experience in Information Security.
CISSP, CEH or other accredited security certifications preferred.

 

Knowledge, Skills, Abilities:

Comprehensive knowledge of security & risk frameworks, standards, and best practices (i.e. SOX, ISO, COBIT).
Knowledge of and implementation experience with security technologies and architecture, including encryption, network security, firewall configuration, intrusion detection, data loss prevention and application security.
Knowledge of vulnerability management, including testing, scanning, and patching.
Strong analytical skills and experience; ability to recognize, analyze and solve complex problems.
Strong data management skills; ability to audit, format, model and analyze large data sets.
Ability to distill data and analysis into high-level reports and summaries.
Ability to discern data inaccuracies through technical experience and knowledge.
Ability to develop system solutions for operational problems.
Ability to write technical instructions in the use of programs and/or program modifications.
Ability to plan, implement, test, and troubleshoot system software.
Strong collaboration skills in order to partner effectively across various levels of the organization.
Strong oral and written communication skills with the ability to communicate at all levels of the organization.
Ability to communicate technical guidance and instruction to users on the use of systems and/or applications.
Strong organization and process improvement skills.
Ability to effectively handle pressures and demands of deadlines and competing priorities.
Ability to handle confidential information and material with the highest degree of professional responsibility.
Ability to interact with internal business partners at a senior and management level to clarify requirements and business needs for changes and enhancements.
Ability to prioritize tasks to meet business needs, including prioritizing the work of others on the team, when needed.
Ability to learn and utilize a working knowledge of broad business environment, energy industry and corporate operations. 
Ability to interact in a team environment.
Proficient use of Microsoft Office Suite.

security engineer.jobDescription:
Northrop Grumman Mission Systems (NGMS) is a leading global provider of secure software-defined, hardware-enabled mission systems. Our company is pioneering capabilities in a wide variety of sectors that keep our nation safe from Undersea to Space and Cyberspace.  


 Northrop Grumman is seeking several Information Assurance/Cyber Security Professionals to join a multi-discipline engineering team that encompasses hardware and software security concerns. Northrop Grumman's System Security Engineering department is on the forefront of developing next generation solutions to support our nation's warfighter.  


 The Systems Security Engineering team is responsible for Security Engineering comprised of Mission Requirements development and analysis, and Architecture Design of  Enterprise  level systems to  Embedded  subsystems. Support through development, integrations, Verification Testing, Assessment & Authorization, and sustainment.  


 The Ideal Candidate will have exposure utilizing multiple Assessment & Authorization Processes to include; DITSCAP, DIACAP, DCID, ICD, and RMF. Including familiarity with NIST 800 family including 800-53, ICD 503 and DoDI 8510.01 is a Plus!  


 The Qualified Candidate Designs and Implements Information Assurance and Security Engineering Systems ensuring the following requirements are achieved:  

 Develops and supports new systems, applications, and solutions for external customer's enterprise-wide cyber systems, networks, and embedded subsystems  
 Experience with all steps of the Systems Engineering "V"  
 Solid experience in cybersecurity requirements evaluation and validation  
 SME level knowledge of cybersecurity systems engineering principles  
 Ensures system security needs are established and maintained for operations development, security requirements analysis and definition, security risk assessment, systems design, systems hardening, vulnerability assessment, mitigation, and testing  
 Provide analytical support for security policy development and analysis  
 Experience with network protocols (e.g., Transmission Control Protocol and Internet Protocol [TCP/IP], Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol [DHCP]) and directory services (e.g., Domain Name System [DNS])  
 Support Implementation, Assessment, and Authorization of the security systems  
 Author and review of Security Authorization Documentation and Security certification procedures, as well as presenting information to management and internal/external customers, to include design reviews and other acquisition milestones  
 Strong Cybersecurity background to include knowledge of the following: Identity and Access Management methodologies, encryption algorithms, cryptology, database and enterprise information security architecture  


 The ideal Candidate will be self-motivated, able to work as part of a team and present the program/company in a positive way to the customer and during other government interaction. Candidate must have ability to work on multiple simultaneous tasks. 

Qualifications 
Basic Qualifications:  


 BS Degree in a Technical Field and 9 years related work experience OR MS Degree in a Technical Field and 7 years related work experience  
 3-5 years of systems engineering experience  
 Experience making technical presentations to internal and external customers  
 Demonstrably good writing skills; ability to write final-version deliverable technical documents and reports  
 Interim Secret clearance is required to start but not to apply - US Citizenship is a prerequisite  
 Ability to travel occasionally CONUS and OCONUS  

 Preferred Qualifications:  


 CISSP or Security+ Certification  
 Advanced degrees in engineering, science, software, or business  
 Specific Information Assurance experience  
 Active DOD Secret or Top Secret security clearance  
 Familiar with multiple operating systems to include Solaris, Linux, and Windows  

 

 Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement , please visit www.northropgrumman.com/EEO . U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

SUMMARY: Provide administration, installation, monitoring, upgrades, support and troubleshooting of the security and monitoring infrastructure. Track and facilitate remediation of security issues reported by our systems, other personnel or 3rd party security scanning vendors. 


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: 

Security Administration
* Helps maintains documentation including security policy, standards, security monitoring system configuration, standard operating procedures (SOP) and other related information.
* Monitors security systems and other data feeds to ensure security of our systems and data, looking for signs of anomaly or breech.
* Drives resolution of security concerns (example: PC*s missing anti-virus, machines needing patches, PCI compliance issues needing resolved)
* Tracks and monitors compliance with security policy and best practices recommendations.
* Assist in development of new security policies and procedures.
* Assist with administration of security platforms (example: firewalls, proxies, active directory, intrusion system, anti-virus console)
* Maintain current documentation of security equipment. 
* Assists in coordinating special projects including network and desktop related efforts.

Security Support
* Oversees the day-to-day operation of security specific tools and monitoring systems.
* Analyzes and troubleshoots security related issues. 
* Assists in providing network security hardware/software support. 
* Researches, evaluates and recommends network hardware/software purchases.
* Researches and evaluates new technologies related to computer security.
* Keeps current and continuous learning via vendor and trade opportunities.

Cable ONE Home Page
: http://www.cableone.net

 

Cable ONE Investor Relations Page
: http://ir.cableone.net/

 


Cable ONE (NYSE: CABO) is the seventh-largest cable company in the United States. Serving more than 800,000 customers in 21 states with high-speed internet, cable television and telephone service, Cable ONE provides consumers with a wide range of the latest products and services, including wireless internet service, high-definition programming, and phone service, with free, unlimited long-distance calling in the continental U.S.

 

We are headquartered in Phoenix AZ, and also have opportunities in many communities in the West, Southeast, and Central parts of the country. We operate with the philosophy that happy associates make happy customers! Therefore, associates enjoy good benefits and an open culture where their ideas are not only asked for, but crucial to the success of our business. 

Cable ONE provides a great place to work for talented and passionate associates who are committed to the Company’s goals!

 

BENEFITS:


Cable ONE appreciates the role our employees play to help the company grow, and in return Flex Medical and Dental Plan benefits, retirement savings and other work/life programs are offered to recognize the importance of our employee's contributions, such as:

 

Flex Benefits Medical and Dental Plan (self, spouse, children) – Starts on 1st Day of HIRE!


2016 Community Service Award from CableFax Magazine!


Newly Remodeled Building with a Fun, yet Professional Vibe!


Collaborative Work Environment! 


Tuition Reimbursement + Personal Development!


Up to $75 monthly Cable & Internet Stipend!


Paid Vacation, Holidays, and Personal/Sick Days!


Free Costco Membership!


Employee Entertainment Center/Game Room with PlayStation 4 and Xbox 360 with Video Chairs, Foosball Tables, Old School Arcade Machines, numerous Card Games and Puzzles!


401k + Company Matching Program!


Business Casual Dress Attire!


Life Insurance (self, spouse, children)/ Business Travel Life Insurance!


Onsite Gym and Showers with Weights and Elliptical Machines!


Annual Community Support to Various Organizations across the U.S, such as: Arbor Day Foundation, Digital Literacy - Title 1 Schools Donation of Chromebooks, Susan G. Komen Breast Cancer Walk, and St. Vince de Paul Holiday Food Drive!


Food Truck Tuesday (every Tuesday a different Food Truck visits Cable ONE)!


Plenty of Mountain Dew in the Soda Machines and Coffee in the Breakrooms!


JOB SUMMARY:


The Cable ONE Network Security Engineer I
 position will perform equipment implementation, maintenance, training, as well as Project tasks related to the Firewall and Network Security components. Additionally, this position will maintain updated troubleshooting and equipment-related documentation and support escalations from the Security Specialist Team. 

 

RESPONSIBILITIES:
 
Analysis, design, development and testing is 70% of the expected responsibility.
Serve as technical point of contact for the Security Specialist Team.
Perform implementation of new hardware and/or software as it relates to active Cable One projects.
Maintain & Upgrade the Data Center environments and Local Office equipment as it relates to the Firewall and Network Security components.
Document processes, procedures, and troubleshooting steps related to the Internet product, Internal/External networking, and Data Center environments as it relates to the Firewall and Network Security components.
Perform on-call duties as assigned.
Perform training of troubleshooting support and procedures.
Analyze project requests to estimate time and cost required to accomplish project.
Work as part of a project team to coordinate network environments and determine project scope and limitations.
Manage and troubleshoot all support tickets escalated by the Security Specialist Team.
Other duties and/or responsibilities not specifically set forth above may, however, be assigned as needed. 

 

BACKGROUND:

Bachelor's degree (B. A) from four-year college or university; or seven years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Bachelor’s degree from a four-year college or university preferred.
Professional level routing and security certification required.
Engineering level routing or security certification preferred.
Proficient computer skills including Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Access.
Excellent analytical skills.
An self-starter with sound problem solving and troubleshooting skills.
A team player.

Designs and develops new systems, applications, and solutions for external customer's enterprise-wide cyber systems and networks. Ensures system security needs established and maintained for operations development, security requirements definition, security risk assessment, systems analysis, systems design, security test and evaluation, certification and accreditation, systems hardening, vulnerability testing and scanning, incident response, disaster recovery, and business continuity planning and provides analytical support for security policy development and analysis. Integrates new architectural features into existing infrastructures, designs cyber security architectural artifacts, provides architectural analysis of cyber security features and relates existing system to future needs and trends, embeds advanced forensic tools and techniques for attack reconstruction, provides engineering recommendations, and resolves integration and testing issues. May interface with external entities including law enforcement, intelligence and other government organizations and agencies.

security engineer.skills: Perimeter security devices such as Firewalls, Intrusion Detection Systems and Web Proxys,  Linux and Microsoft Server OS, IP, TCP/UDP, DHCP, LDAP, Microsoft Active Directory, DNS, SSH, SSL/TLS, NTP
security engineer.jobDescription:
Primary Function:
 Support and administer all Information Technology security systems. Responsible for system implementation, administration, incident handling, problem resolution, and vulnerability assessment.

Duties and Responsibilities:


• Administer security systems that include but are not limited to firewalls, intrusion detection systems/intrusion prevention systems, web content filtering systems, proxy servers, mail gateways, multifactor authentication systems, and Syslog servers.

• Assist in remediation of findings discovered by regular vulnerability scanning.

• Implement and maintain identity management solutions including SAML, OAuth, and other federation services.

• Provide security expertise in the areas of vulnerability assessment, incident handling, system hardening and system implementation of network resources and documentation.

• Provide recommendations for physical network infrastructure upgrades as well implementations of layered security while ensuring traffic flow efficiency.

• Create and maintain documentation of hardware and software implementations.

• Perform after hours support duties to sustain networking systems and services levels on an as-needed basis.

• Must comply with law, company policies and procedures, and the highest ethical standards.

• Perform other duties as required.

Qualifications: 


• Associate or Bachelor’s Degree in a Technical Discipline or equivalent work related field is required.

*A minimum of 5 years’ experience in the following is required:


• Perimeter security devices such as Firewalls, Intrusion Detection Systems and Web Proxy’s

• Linux and Microsoft Server OS

• The following networking protocols: IP, TCP/UDP, DHCP, LDAP, Microsoft Active Directory, DNS, SSH, SSL/TLS, RADIUS, NTP, FTP, SMTP, SMB, SNMP

• Ethernet, IPSec, 802.1x Network Access Control, Port-Security, VLANs

• Strong technical documentation skills

*The following is preferred:


• Cisco Certifications (CCENT, CCNA), Network +, Security+

• CISSP or other Security certifications

• Experience with Firewalls, IPS/IDS, Network Access Control, Static and dynamic analysis, vulnerability scanning and remediation

• Enterprise Wireless implementation

• Understanding of Certificate Authorities and PKI

• Familiarity with PCI-DSS, ISO and SAS70/SOC certifications

Essential Job Functions:


• Maintain appropriate confidentiality regarding client information; ensure proper destruction of confidential documents, and compliance with Personally Identifiable Information (PII) rules and regulations.

• Ability to type at a computer terminal and view input is required.

• Ability to sit for extended periods of time is required.

• Ability to communicate on a telephone, in person, and in writing with customers, vendors and other network users is required.

• Maintain and install equipment may require bending and lifting.

"General Information Services, Inc., is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law".

security engineer.jobDescription:
Smartronix, Inc., is an information technology and engineering solutions provider specializing in Cloud Computing, Cyber Security, Health IT, Network Operations, and Mission-Focused Engineering. Smartronix has unparalleled expertise providing advanced technology solutions worldwide to Fortune 1000 Financial, Healthcare, Entertainment and Engineering clients, as well as to Federal, State and Local Governments and the DoD. Smartronix is an Amazon Web Services (AWS) Premier Partner and a Gold Microsoft Hosting partner.

 Smartronix is seeking a Network Security Engineer. The primary role will be to support the Special Access Program (SAPs) and other classified networks supporting SMC Directorates and/or AFSPC Operational Units. The position will provide "day-to-day" support for Collateral, Sensitive Compartmented Information (SCI) and Special Access Program (SAP) activities.

Performance shall include:

 + Install, maintain, audit and support a secure MS Windows network environment and limited web/data application service
 + Maintain internet applications and protocols IP,TCP ,HTTP, HTIPS, FTP, & SSL Maintain file servers, Firewalls, network access, Security Monitoring Systems and system documentation as required
 + Interface with local customers and provide IT related support to quickly resolve problems
 + Analyze and troubleshoot system anomalies to ensure optimum equipment performance
 + Perform periodic maintenance, hardware upgrades and replacement, firmware updates and system configuration changes
 + Perform scheduled tape backups on systems as required
 + Manage data backup library to include storage of tapes, disks and other magnetic media at the customer's location and off-site storage facilities as required
 + Attend planning and requirements meetings with IT staff, Program Managers and customers as required
 + Prepare system for operational use and support operational tests Provide technical guidance

 #cjpost

 Required Skills

 + Thorough knowledge of Microsoft Windows 2000/2003/2007 Server, Microsoft Exchange Server 2003, Microsoft Windows XP/Vista operating systems (OS) administration and associated hardware.
 + Working knowledge of Local Area Network (LAN) and Wide Area Network (WAN) technologies and data backup technologies to include communication security (COMSEC) integration
 + Working knowledge ofJAF AN 6/0, DCIDIJ AF AN 6/3, DCIDI] AF AN 6/9, and Joint DODIIS/Cryptologic SCI Information Systems Security Standards, Common Criteria, and System Security Policy as they relate to C&A for Legacy systems
 + Working knowledge and current relevant experience with PLl & PL2 systems; experience with PL3 & PL4 cross domain solutions is a plus
 + Must be familiar with security policy/manuals and the appropriate ICDs/JAFANsIDOD Manuals and other guiding policy documents
 + Ability to work in a dynamic environment and effectively interact with numerous DOD, military/civilian personnel and industry partners
 + Working knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, and Excel)
 + Possess a high degree of originality, creativity, initiative requiring minimal supervision
 + Requires travel within the organizational Area of Responsibility (AOR) (note - could be extensive, and will include both air and ground transportation)
 + Must be able to lift up to 50 Ibs.

 Required Experience
 Qualifications:

 + 3-5 years related experience
 + Bachelor's degree in a related area or equivalent experience (4 years)
 + DoD 8570 IAT Level 2 certification needed within 6 months of the date of hire
 + Current Top Secret Clearance with SCI Eligibility

 Job Location
 El Segundo, California, United States

 Position Type
 Full-Time/Regular

 US Citizenship Required
 Yes
 Degree Required
 N/A
 Clearance Level Required
 07. SSBI, 06. SCI, 05. Top Secret

security engineer.skills: FireMon; firewalls; IDS; IPS; firewall auditing tools; maintenance; scripting; technical writing; SOPs; TCP/IP; cyber; access protocols; integration; maintenance; security; network; tools
security engineer.jobDescription:
Secunetics provides network infrastructure intelligence services to government agencies and commercial clients. We work with our clients to fully profile network structures, behaviors, and security. We are a focused team of enthusiastic colleagues working together on a diverse and challenging set of projects.

 

We are looking to grow our security team to support the prevention and detection of cyber attacks for federal and commercial enterprise clients as well as meet your individual career goals. You will integrate threat intelligence capabilities into new and existing client enterprises and design IT security solutions based on client requirements. We value creative, strategic thinkers with demonstrated interest and skills in cyber security.

 

Who you are :
You are a US Citizen and are able to be clearable to the TS level
You are passionate and curious about technology
You keep on top of changes in security products and breaches
You are committed to work with a like-minded team to learn and grow in your field of expertise
You have an eye for details and consistency
You have strong communication skills
You have a strong interest in cyber security and IT infrastructure performance
You enjoy interacting with clients to satisfy their goals and objectives
You are a hobbyist and have a really cool lab environment set up in your basement

 

We are looking for team members with the following skills :
Min 2 years of experience in network and network security
Experience in enterprise level networking tools, processes, and systems 
Experience managing network tools in an enterprise environment that include: firewalls, IDS/IPS, assessment and scanning tools
Experience in operating and maintaining a FireMon Platform
Experience with administering FireMon Platform and user access / lateral monitoring protocols
Experience integrating FireMon with Enterprise Services Network Infrastructure Systems and Tools
Experience managing endpoint solutions, routing, Border Gateway Protocol, MPLS Architecture, and logging from various platforms
Experience in working with or understanding of Firewall auditing tools
Strong understanding of networking technologies (routers, switches, TCP/IP)
Experience with different platform technologies (Windows, Linux, VMware, MacOS)
Expertise with security technologies (IDS, IPS, FW, AV, Proxies, DLP, PKI, SSL/TLS, SSL visibility, VPN)
Extensive experience integrating and managing security products (e.g. Fireeye, ArcSight, PaloAlto, Blue Coat SWG, Vontu DLP, Snort, ELK, Splunk, and Netwitness)
Solid experience with scripting (to automate analysis tasks)
Experience with technical writing and creation of formal documentation such as Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs); reports, training materials, slide decks, and architecture diagrams.

 

If you have any of the following, it would be a bonus :
Undergraduate or graduate degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a related field
Active US Secret or Top Secret clearance
Strong programming skills in C/C++, .NET, or Python
Familiarity with enterprise management and performance engineering concepts
Ability to use Ethernet traffic analysis tools (TAPs, traffic brokers, etc.)
Awareness and experience with Continuous Monitoring and Diagnostics (CDM) and CAESARS Framework
CISSP Certification

 

Secunetics is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, creed, physical or mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, veteran status, age, gender identity, or any other applicable basis that is protected by foreign, federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation.

security engineer.jobDescription:
What you’ll be doing... 
 Verizon is a Fortune 500 company and prides in servicing 99% of Fortune 500 companies as well as Government agencies around the world. This role is part of the MSS Service delivery team responsible for onboarding new customers through service turn up, working on large customer projects and resolving complex Tier 2/3 customer technical issues related to our MSS offerings with minimal outside involvement. This position provides expert level research and analysis for planning, organizing, and managing corporate-wide security functions.  
  Functional Responsibilities 
  
 Work directly with the customer and various teams in Verizon to manage multiple customer turn ups and projects simultaneously and resolve issues using direct access to systems, company information resources, laboratory simulations and engineering problem solving techniques.  
 Produce documented frameworks or architectures which describe and are used to manage the implementation of technical security environments.   
 Provide input into the security technology plan for the customer and ensures that plans for their assigned technology discipline integrate effectively with other aspects of the technical infrastructure.   
 Understand and effectively articulate the implications and impact that proposed architectural changes will have on the business (to technical and non-technical audiences).   
 Installing, troubleshooting and configuring all vendor provided tools   

What we’re looking for... 
  Minimum Qualifications   
 Bachelor’s degree in related field and 5 to 10 years of related experience in an Enterprise IT or Managed Security Services environment. Extensive experience with both physical and network/host level security.   
 Proven ability to troubleshoot, correctly diagnose, and correct identified security deficiencies.   
 Work independently with minimal management supervision. Must be able to take an operational and project leadership role.   
 Must have extensive understanding of firewalls, switches, and IP routing hardware.   
 Extensive Linux/Unix skills and knowledge are a must.  
 Candidates must hold Baseline clearance or have the ability to obtain one  
 

  Why Verizon?  
 As well as an attractive package, you can look forward to excellent prospects for career progression in our expanding business. We are a business that invests in its people. Verizon spends more than $275 million on employee training, development and tuition.   

  At Verizon we believe in embracing the diversity of our global workforce - our employees have different interests, experiences and skills that combine to foster an innovative and enriching culture. We recognise the need to offer flexible and varied working solutions to enable our people to reach their potential and strike the right balance between personal and work life. We leverage our innovative technology and communication solutions to connect us on a global scale, enabling collaborative working.    

  If you are interested in discussing flexible hours, mobility and alternative working solutions, talk to us; we’ll do our best to accommodate you.   
When you join Verizon... 


You’ll be doing work that matters alongside other talented people, transforming the way people, businesses and things connect with each other. Beyond powering America’s fastest and most reliable network, we’re leading the way in broadband, cloud and security solutions, Internet of Things and innovating in areas such as, video entertainment. Of course, we will offer you great pay and benefits, but we’re about more than that. Verizon is a place where you can craft your own path to greatness. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, find your future at Verizon.

security engineer.jobDescription:
Job Description

 Senior information assurance expert that reports to the ATO and continuous assessment team responsible for a robust FIMSA based Federal agency Governance, Risk and Compliance support organization.
 * Performs Computer Security Incident Response activities for a large organization, coordinates with other government agencies to record and report incidents.
 * Monitor and analyze Intrusion Detection Systems (IDS) to identify security issues for remediation.
 * Recognizes potential, successful, and unsuccessful intrusion attempts and compromises thorough reviews and analyses of relevant event detail and summary information.
 * Evaluate firewall change requests and assess organizational risk.
 * Communicates alerts to agencies regarding intrusions and compromises to their network infrastructure, applications and operating systems.
 * Assists with implementation of counter-measures or mitigating controls.
 * Ensures the integrity and protection of networks, systems, and applications by technical enforcement of organizational security policies, through monitoring of vulnerability scanning devices.
 * Performs periodic and on-demand system audits and vulnerability assessments, including user accounts, application access, file system and external Web integrity scans to determine compliance.
 * Prepares incident reports of analysis methodology and results.
 * Serves as a technical team or task leader.

 Maintains current knowledge of relevant technology as assigned

Education

 Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or a related technical discipline, or the equivalent combination of education, professional training or work experience.

Qualifications

 5-8 years of related experience in data security administration.

 #DICE

 As a trusted systems integrator for more than 50 years, General Dynamics Information Technology provides information technology (IT), systems engineering, professional services and simulation and training to customers in the defense, federal civilian government, health, homeland security, intelligence, state and local government and commercial sectors.With approximately 32,000 professionals worldwide, the company delivers IT enterprise solutions, manages large-scale, mission-critical IT programs and provides mission support services.GDIT is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status, or any other protected class.

security engineer.jobDescription:
What you’ll be doing... 
  You will be working directly with our clients to ensure that security services are delivered in accordance with Service Level Agreements (SLA) and Service Level Objectives (SLO’s). Liaising between multiple internal and external business units to provide seamless service to our clients is a primary focus of your role. Ensuring client service requests and escalations are handled professionally and judiciously will make us better. And here, better matters.   
 Participating in client meetings and projects to ensure clients needs and expectations are met.  
 Tracking and monitoring feature releases, product changes and enhancements.  
 Utilizing reports and other tools and processes, performing security and device trending.  
 Training clients so they can utilize all service features.  
 Creating executive summaries and security and risk reporting.  

  Identifying areas for improvement of client’s overall risk & security posture.   
What we’re looking for... 
  You’re meticulous, organized and detail-oriented, and you enjoy digging in the details to identify root causes and creating solutions. You are customer focused and take the time to listen to their needs so you can effectively translate client’s expectations to stakeholders. Communicating with others and working in teams is easy for you. You value collaboration to achieve great outcomes.   
  You’ll need to have:   
 Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience.  
 Four or more years of relevant work experience.

 A degree.  
 Experience operating firewalls and networking in a gateway environment.  
 Industry certification in Cisco, Juniper, or F5.

  Experience in designing, implementing and documenting end to end network solutions.

Job Title:              Information Security Engineer


Reports to:           CTO


Location:              Atlanta, GA


Travel:                   As required in the Continental U.S. and EMEA up to 25%
 

Position Overview


The Kudelski Security Research & Development group is in search of an Information Security Engineer to drive the security program for our key technology products. Embedded within our development teams, this position will work on a daily basis to improve the security posture of our core products, influence our backlog to include security-related items, and ensure the compliance of our systems with key standards such as ISO 27001. 

This is a global role with influence over products in the US and Switzerland. Our core products include both a large Managed Services offering and portfolio of SaaS products.   Our ideal candidate will have previous experience developing and certifying systems under a variety of standards and scrutiny. 

If you like working with the latest development technologies, securing systems, and integrating new security solutions and the DevOps way, this job is for you. This position is designed as a mix of product development work with compliance. Candidates must live and breathe security (and not mind doing the related documentation). 

Job Responsibilities:

Design, develop and test, document and deliver the security “program” for the Kudelski Security products portfolio.
Champion new security concepts; proactively looking at how they can be applied to our products.
Influence our backlog to include improvements related to the security.
Ensure our systems’ compliance with ISO 27001 and other requirements defined by our clients.
Help our Product Managers and Owners translate security features into technical user stories and tasks.
Represent Kudelski Security as part of the overall Kudelski Group corporate security function to ensure alignment with governance and centralized funding opportunities. 

Job Requirements:

Bachelors in Science, Technology, Engineering, or Math. Masters preferred.
ISO/IEC 27001:2013 Certified ISMS Lead Implementer or Auditor.
Previous experience working with global teams.
Previous experience successfully certifying a system under the ISO 27000 series.
Previous experience working with an Agile development team.
Previous experience with Managed Services.
Fluent English Speaking. 

Preferred:

Previous experience certifying systems under NIST 800-53.
Certified Information Security Systems Professional
Certified Information Security Auditor 

Qualifications:

Superior oral, written and interpersonal communication skills.
Autonomy, self-taught, flexibility, rigor, efficiency and ability to manage pressure are key skills
Ability to multi-task.
Ability to work independently and in a team environment.
Able to comfortably interact and negotiate with senior executives.
Must pass criminal background and drug testing requirements

Job Description:


TRA offers real work and life balance by offering a flexible work schedule, telecommuting up to three days a week and the opportunity to work with leading edge technologies. TRA invests in our employees by offering continuing education options, paid training, paid certifications and yearly conferences.

 

Closing Date: 02/07/2018

Salary Range: $30.91 - $52.86/hourly; $64,540 - $110,371/annually

 

Job Summary


 

The senior network security engineer role ensures the stability and integrity of data, video, VoIP, and wireless networks services for the Minnesota Teachers Retirement Association. The engineer plans, designs and develops local area networks (LAN), software-defined networks (SND), and wide area networks (WAN) across the organization. The person we select will participate in the design, installation, monitoring, maintenance, support and optimization of all security network hardware, software, and communication links. The engineer analyzes and resolves network & security hardware and software problems in a timely and accurate manner.

 

Minimum Qualifications:




Five (5) years of recent experience as a senior network engineer.



A Master's degree in Information Technology or a related field may substitute for three years of experience, a related Bachelor's degree may substitute for two years of experience, or a related Associate's substitutes for one year.


Experience must demonstrate:


 

Designing and implementing networking products including routers, switches and VPNs.

Advanced Knowledge of Cisco LAN/WAN architectures and how to deploy them.

Experience deploying and managing Cisco ASAs and IDS/IPS systems.

Research new security trends, best practices and network & security technologies.

Experience in analyzing complex client/server and network performance problems to identify cause and perform corrective action.

Strong analytical and problem resolution skills. Project experience and teamwork skills.

Ability to be self-monitored and self-motivated.


Preferred Technical Qualifications:


 

Cisco CCNP Certification or able to obtain within one year.

Experience deploying and managing Cisco networking products including routers, switches and VPNs.

Experience deploying and managing VMware's NSX software defined networking solution.

Extensive knowledge of web security technologies and practices.

Deploying and managing Cisco wireless infrastructures.


Physical Requirements


 


Requires occasionally lifting and/or carrying such articles as file folders, ledgers, and small tools. Although a sedentary job is defined as one which involves sitting a certain amount of walking and standing is often necessary in carrying out job duties.

 

Additional Requirements


 


This position requires successful completion of the following:

 

Candidate will be required to pass a background check which includes work history and criminal background.

 

Why Work For Us


 

GREAT BENEFITS PACKAGE! The State of Minnesota offers a comprehensive benefits package including low cost medical and dental insurance, employer paid life insurance, short and long term disability, pre-tax flexible spending accounts, retirement plan, tax-deferred compensation, generous vacation and sick leave, and 11 paid holidays each year.

 apply to the MN Careers website http://www.mn.gov/careers

 be accepted.

WHO YOU’LL BE WORKING FOR…
 Launch your career with ViaSat!  ViaSat is a global broadband services technology company who securely connects consumers, businesses, and governments to the internet, anywhere in the world via satellite.  If you’ve used in-flight Wi-Fi on Virgin America, JetBlue or American – you have ViaSat to thank. ViaSat is not just an industry leader; we are a market disrupter - pushing the boundaries of what’s possible by creating what doesn’t exist.  We thrive on accomplishing what others have proclaimed the impossible.  Our competitive advantage is our people and technology.  We attract & retain some of the world’s top talent.  At ViaSat, you will have the opportunity to work on the toughest technical problems alongside leaders of the industry in an informal, campus-like atmosphere.   The work is demanding, but the results are meaningful and rewarding.  Come be a part of this exciting company where you will drive your own career without lanes, where the possibilities are limitless!  See what it is like to work at ViaSat:  https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCScm2m51dUiXte0s9mljl3g

 

WHO YOU’LL BE WORKING WITH….
 Our IT Network Team is dedicated to keeping ViaSat’s data highly available, employees working and productive, and seamlessly evolving our infrastructure to meet the demands of the business and our customers. As ViaSat continues our rapid growth in existing and new business areas, there is a steady diet of projects, continuous integration, emerging threats, and infrastructure scaling that will challenge you to find new and creative solutions to meet the demand. Our team is a seasoned group of professionals that share a diverse, energetic, and passionate focus for the lower layers of the stack. We promote continual personal growth through team collaboration, education, conferences, and certifications. We want to find like-minded professionals that share our passion and aren’t afraid to get their hands dirty from time to time. If these things energize you by coming up with creative network solutions in a collaborative, spirited environment, then keep reading.  

 

WHO YOU ARE….
 ViaSat is looking for a dynamic and resourceful Senior Network Security Engineer who is not afraid to continually stretch and grow, to join our growing Network Engineering Team. You have extensive and broad experience with supporting Cisco-based access networks and underlying infrastructure technologies (LAN, MAN, WAN, wireless, VPN, Unified Communications and Telcom). You will be a critical member of the IT Network team where you will have the opportunity to directly contribute to enhancing existing network services, including, but not limited to: making recommendations, defining the ROI, and implementing these improvements using an accepted change control methodology. As a self-motivated team player with excellent communication skills you will enjoy the quick pace while keeping in sync with colleagues across multiple geographic areas.  Your analytical and critical thinking skills, along with your training and extensive experience, will provide you the ability to define and follow standards and best practices for network design, testing, and implementation methodology.  

 

WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING….
 In this role and as a member of the Network team, you will work with various functional areas on gathering requirements, evaluating, designing, implementing and supporting a Cisco-based access network and the underlying infrastructure technologies that will enable the organization to work effectively and productively. Here’s a short list:
You’ll use your extensive and broad functional experience with switching, routing, firewalls, VPN, wireless, content networking, and network management systems across a wide range of complex architectures, platforms and mediums.
Define, document and implement strategy, direction and architectures for the global security network environment.
Plan and implement new network technologies into the current operating environment.
Research, design, plan, and implement new network technologies into our current operating environment. While also, testing and evaluating future-looking technologies by performing beta testing and pilots.
Configure, deploy, fine-tune, monitor, maintain, upgrade, troubleshoot, support and repair our network security as required

REQUIRED:

4+ years of direct engineering and operations experience in the networking industry
Hands on experience with Fortigate, Fortigate Manager
Hands on experience with VPN, MPLS, BGP, Virtual Domains, SSL, CA, SAML, OAuth
Hands on experience Threat modeling creation, PenTest, and Vulnerability testing
Expert working knowledge, including the ability to setup, configure, upgrade, manage, and troubleshoot Cisco routers, switches, VPN concentrators, firewalls, 802.11 wireless controllers and access points, and related management tools
Extensive experience with Cisco ISE and Prime network management systems implementing policy-based network access and 802.1x
Experience with Fortinet and Cisco ASA firewalls
Ability to configure, design, maintain and troubleshooting IPSec or SSL VPNs using Cisco ASAs and Cisco AnyConnect
Familiarity with DevOps, ability to consume APIs using scripting languages like Python or Ruby, and network automation using tools like Ansible or Git
U.S Government position. U.S Citizenship required

security engineer.jobDescription:
Title:
 Senior Information Security Engineer

Location:
 Charlotte, NC

Position Summary:


A Senior InfoSec Engineer at EPRI offers solutions to the EPRI community concerning the computing security environment. This can range from solving simple configuration problems to recommendations of complex secure computing requirements. The Senior InfoSec Engineer should have current up-to-date knowledge of computer, network and security technologies and needs to maintain and enhance such knowledge through education on an ongoing basis. This position involves customer contact and interaction thus requiring excellent people skills along with the technical requirements.

Job Functions:

Assist the Manager of Information Security in the development, implementation, verification and enforcement of security policies and guidelines.
Assist in the development and maintenance of documentation that details our security environment, including but not limited to device build documents, topology diagrams, and troubleshooting how to's.
Identify and mitigate vulnerabilities and attacks within the EPRI computing environment.
Research new methods and technologies that may be applicable to securing EPRI.
Research new threats, attacks and vulnerabilities that may affect the EPRI computing environment to learn how to identify and react to them.
Install and configure new computer security packages.
Install, update and configure security devices and other hardware used in the protection of EPRI computing environment.
Assist the Manager of Information Security in technical support issues, investigations and risk assessment.
Troubleshoot and resolve security related computer or network problems.
Respond to end users request involving security related computing or networking problems.
Consult with end users regarding their secure computing needs, making recommendations for new products and solutions.
Assist other Technical Support Analysts as needed. This includes working with other groups within ITS.
Continue to be educated on new and emerging security risks and technologies that effect EPRI's computing environment.
Assist in the development of new security architectures.
Co-ordinate EPRI’s Sophos End Point Manager system and Enterprise virus response.
Mobile device security support.
Perform penetration assessments against web applications produced, managed, or related to EPRI.
Review applications in accordance with ASVS L2B.

Education:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience desired.
6-12 year’s technical experience in related fields (information security, computers, telecom, networking, etc.).

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Strong knowledge of the Windows operating systems (95-2008r2).
Strong knowledge of other OSs (Apple, UNIX, Linux).
Working knowledge of Solera, Sophos, Nessus, Rapid 7, and other security tools.
Working knowledge of Qradar SIEM
Working knowledge of forensic toolkits and virus/malware response.
 Working knowledge of at least 1 for the following scripting languages: a) Python, b) SH, c) BASH, d) Java.
Strong knowledge of TCP/IP and related Internet and network protocols.
Strong knowledge of firewalls, IPS, IDS, HIPS, VPN, TLS/SSL, terminal servers, RAS and DNS.
Strong knowledge of PCAP analyzation for troubleshooting and traffic identification.
Knowledge of various network switches, routers, hubs, etc.
Expert knowledge of browsers and exploit methods.
Working knowledge of Juniper and Fortinet devices.

 

EPRI participates in E-Verify, an online system operated jointly by the Department of Homeland Security and the Social Security Administration (SSA). EPRI uses the system to check the work status of new hires by comparing information from the employee's I-9 form against SSA and Department of Homeland Security databases.

Note: To ensure compliance with U.S. export controls, please indicate your U.S. citizenship or (for foreign citizens) your U.S. visa/immigration status in your resume or cover letter.

EPRI is an equal opportunity employer.

EEO/AA/M/F/VETS/Disabled

Together . . . Shaping the Future of Electricity.
www.epri.com

This position will provide information network and application security operational expertise while collaborating with other information technology teams. This role is responsible for administering information security applications and network systems in a large distributed enterprise.

 

Responsibilities:

Team member responsible for the analyzing, designing, installing, configuring, maintaining and repairing of security infrastructure and application components. Ensuring overall technical capabilities, stability and performance. Provide direction, recommendations, design and implementation for security enhancements.

Ensure information network security design, plans, controls, processes, standards, policies and procedures are aligned with generally accepted IT security practice and standards and the overall IT security approach of our primary technology partners.

Provide operations and engineering support for critical network and application security systems and services including Intrusion detection/prevention, Data leakage prevention, content filtering, Firewall compliance, Vulnerability and security event management.

Proactively maintain, monitor and improve our network and application security with timely incident detection and response.

Partner with security and technical teams to design, deliver and maintain highly available, performance and cost effective network and application security system and services.

Write and contribute to project plans, author network and application security engineering level documentation, and develop detailed test plans.

Participate in IT Security assessments, risk analysis and reporting.

Provide on-call and after-hours coverage as necessary.

Travel as required to any of the other USI locations.


 

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Cisco or SANS network security certifications preferred or equivalent work experience

BA/BS degree in technical discipline

A minimum of 5 years of experience providing network and application security administration services in a business critical environment

In-depth knowledge of intrusion detection/prevention, NextGen firewalls, VPN, data loss prevention, data encryption, SIEM appliances, and multi-factor authentication systems

Understanding of advanced security protocols and standards, including a demonstrated ability to perform complex analysis including producing metrics

An ability to learn new technologies and adopt new information security tools

Experience with ISE, MSE and IPS (wired and wireless) is desired

Strong organizational skills, excellent communication and people skills

Must be able to work independently and as part of a team

*LI-PM1

PRIMARY DUTY


Perform technical implementation and oversite of cyber security projects and personnel.  Responsible for helping define, deliver, and maintain cyber security initiatives encompassing all facets of the business.  Evaluate and research emerging security solutions, threats and vulnerabilities to aid in the identification and prevention of security incidents.  Manage and maintain all hardware, software, and systems used to protect the corporate infrastructure.  Ensure all technical, cross-departmental, and team tasks are communicated effectively, executed efficiently and in accordance with Keno Kozie policy and security leading practices.

security engineer.jobDescription:
Ace Info Solutions, Inc. (AceInfo) is a leading Federal contractor with a focused vision: empower our clients, challenge our employees, and grow our business. Founded in December 2000, we are deeply committed to ensuring quality and customer satisfaction. We have a mature corporate infrastructure, strong management, and quality practices. AceInfo is a trusted IT partner to the Federal Government, and we help various agencies transform and strengthen their processes, operations, infrastructures, and security practices to help them further their critical missions.

For over 15 years, we have successfully managed large and significant Federal programs. We have proven experience prioritizing client satisfaction, project quality, and providing innovative, cost-effective solutions to Federal clients.

AceInfo is prime on 95% of our contracts, is headquartered in Reston VA, and has geographically dispersed office locations throughout the country, to include: Kearneysville, WV; Chesapeake, VA; Fort Collins, CO; Boulder, CO; Quantico, VA; Kansas City, MO; Bowie, MD; multiple Washington, DC Metropolitan locations, and project presence in 23 states in all time zones. We offer excellent benefits and salary packages including free medical/dental/life insurance premiums for staff members. We offer relocation assistance for internal employees and external candidates, within 50 miles (minimum) of work location. We do not offer assistance for relocation and housing for internship positions.

 

AceInfo is currently seeking a Sr. Network Security Engineer to support our federal project, in Rosslyn, VA.

 

Responsibilities:

Demonstrates subject matter expertise in Network Security, Secure Remote access, Firewall Management, Security Information, Event management, and Next Generation Firewalls
Coordinates efforts onsite with and reports results to the Director of IT.
Provides Operations and Maintenance for all Trusted Internet Connection (TIC) components, all external connections (VPNs), all routing and switching environment, the Next Generation Firewall, the Remote access solution, and Security Information Event Management.
Provides Network and Security engineering support for internal systems integration projects such as the cloud based services, VOIP, virtualized infrastructure, server and storage environment
Documents security operations, network diagrams, security best practices.
Experience with ITIL service management is desirable, but not mandatory.

 

Benefits

We offer free medical/dental/life insurance premiums for staff members from day 1. Vision insurance is available for a small fee.
We match 100% of 401K contributions up to 4% of your earnings (immediate vesting).
Each full-time employee has a tuition/training reimbursement allowance of $3,500 per year that can be used with manager approval.
15 days of PTO and 10 paid holidays per year
We participate in the WageWorks Commuter Benefit program. This allows you to set aside part of your earnings pre-tax each pay period, helping to offset public transit commuting costs.
 Qualifications:
This candidate must be able to work in a multi-functional, fast paced, high intensity team environment, work closely with other contractors/vendors as well as our customer directly, provide ad hoc advice/presentation support/attend meetings as needed with little or no notice, wear many hats
Minimum 5+ years performing a senior network engineering role, preferably at least 3 of which is in some leadership capacity.
Must possess an active Secret or Top Secret DoD clearance. Those with current Secret clearance must have the ability to upgrade to Top Secret within one year.
Must be able to document the architecture; VISIO is acceptable. Must be able to work with the team to design the network in collaboration with our customer
Must be available to work weekends and after hours when needed or be on call at certain times as needed
Must be able to communicate well, frequently and clearly with the customer and with other involved vendors and stakeholders in every step of the design, configuration, etc.
Must have leadership experience and ability to be the primary network POC for this effort and able to report progress weekly
Prior Federal contract experience is desired, and prior experience with this Agency would be a major plus
Certifications and/or past training, particularly within the Palo Alto product suite are desired, but not mandatory


 

Additional Requirement:


U.S. Citizen is required for the position. Active Secret clearance is required. 

 

Ace Info Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer with a commitment to diversity. All individuals, regardless of personal characteristics, are encouraged to apply. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

Greetings!!!

Hope you are doing well. 

We have an Immediate Network Security Engineer Opening One of Our Client located in Dallas, TX. Please take a look at the below requirement. Kindly let me know your comfort level along with your updated resume in word document enable me to proceed.  Please reply at bhairav@noralogic.com

Position: Network Security Engineer
Location : Dallas, TX
Type Of Hire : Fulltime Opportunity

Job Description
Network Security Engineer:
 We seek to hire an Information Security Engineer that will be responsible for supporting computer network defense, to include auditing the network for vulnerabilities, identifying relevant threats, recommending corrective actions, developing solutions for security issues, and investigating security incidents and breaches.
 Also manage and maintain the network security systems.
  
Responsibilities :
 Researches emerging threats and vulnerabilities to aid in the identification of network incidents
 Analyzes data from threat and vulnerability feeds and analyzes data for applicability to the client's organization
 Supports the creation of business continuity/disaster recovery plans, to include conducting disaster recovery tests, publishing test results, and making changes necessary to address deficiencies
 Ensures compliance with all applicable configuration standards
 Recommends security controls and/or corrective actions for mitigating technical and business risk
 Produces vulnerability, configuration, and coverage metrics and reporting to demonstrate assessment coverage and remediation effectiveness
 Firewall management (e.g. DMZ, Internet, Third Party connections) 
 Provision and management of multi-factor authentication (e.g., token, certificate) 
 Malicious code detection and prevention, and Internet monitoring (e.g. IDS/IPS) 
 Security policy verification 
 Tiered web filtering (e.g., URL filtering, malicious sites, spyware, advertisements, instant messaging, free software downloads) 
 Internet usage reporting 
 Provision, installation, configuration, management, and maintenance of network intrusion detection and prevention sensors at specified network entry points 
 Intrusion Incident reporting 
 Ongoing vulnerability assessment and remediation activities 
 Support of Third Party security assessment, scanning and penetration testing 
 Design, implementation, management and maintenance of encryption solutions 
 Management of Client-owned security certificates, SSLs and domain names; where applicable 
 Security Incident and Problem Resolution 
 Password Reset Services per established security standards
 Logging, tracking and management of security risks and issues to Resolution and closure 
 Network security Services reporting per Client requirements 
 Physical and logical access control (e.g., End User, administrative, card access) at Vendor facilities and logical access control at Client facilities 
 Remediation of discovered security risks from any security audit findings 
  
Qualifications
 BS in Computer Science, Information Security, or a related field is highly desirable
 7+ years of work experience in information security, especially in a network security Engineer role
 Preferred Certification - CSA+, CCNA Security, CCNP Security, CCIE Security and CCNA Cyber Ops 
 Competencies Required 
 Technical expertise in analyzing threat event data, evaluating malicious activity, documenting unusual files and data, and identifying tactics, techniques and procedures used by attackers 
 Technical expertise in system security vulnerabilities and remediation techniques, network and web-related protocols (e.g., TCP/IP, UDP, IPSEC, HTTP, etc.) 
 Technical expertise in security engineering, system and network security, authentication and security protocols and application security 
 Strong decision-making capabilities, with a proven ability to weigh the relative costs and benefits of potential actions and identify the most appropriate one 
 An ability to effectively influence others to modify their opinions, plans, or behaviors 
 An understanding of business needs and commitment to delivering high-quality, prompt, and efficient service to the business 
 An understanding of organizational mission, values, and goals and consistent application of this knowledge 
 ISO 2700 Awareness

security engineer.skills: Application Security Engineer
security engineer.jobDescription:
Application Security Engineer 

The Application Security Engineer will be responsible for integrating security into the development of Company’s applications. The Application Security Engineer will work closely with the product and software development team to threat model, vulnerability scan, and pen test the early software, system, and network architecture and identify required control points in the application stack. The Application Security Engineer will also work closely with developers to diagnose, document, and remediate application security vulnerabilities. The Application Security Engineer will also be responsible for evaluating, recommending, and implementing application security related software in an automated continuous integration/deployment environment.

 

Work closely with application development and QA teams to help formulate and implement a strategy for software security that is tailored to the specific risks facing the organization, including threat modeling and applications security advisement services.
Develop and maintain a balanced application security program based on a well-defined application security framework
Conduct application security assessments / penetration tests and implement tools for dynamic/automated code reviews
Ensure application design and implementation best-practice with role-based and appropriate access standards, as well as integration with Identity and Access Management environments.
Ensure compliance with society, regulatory, and industry standards for application security.
Continuously evaluate the organization’s existing application security practices, define and measure security-related activities, and demonstrating concrete improvements to the application assurance program within the organization.
Provide secure application development training to developers and provide guidance on the development of web-based training for ongoing awareness.
Conduct code reviews and penetration testing
Develop and maintain unit and integration tests designed to ensure security controls are tested on every build

 

Job Qualifications
3-5 years progressive experience in Application Development OR Information Security OR Software Quality Assurance
Experience with one or more languages like Java/JavaScript, C++/C#, Ruby/Python/Perl
Strong understanding of application security concepts for internet technology, architecture and protocols
Knowledge of OWASP Top 10, CWE Top 25 concepts
We are looking for someone who has passion for IT Security.

Position Description


 The Security Engineer is a member of Security Team and performs technical activities for delivering effective host, network, data, and application security services. This position will have primary responsibility for security platforms in the production environment, as well as development, quality-assurance and staging environments. The Security Engineer's responsibilities include security system deployments, configuration, monitoring and reporting. security engineer.skills: Senior Security Engineer Network, Web Application Protocols, Scripting, Software Development Frameworks, Linux, Windows
security engineer.jobDescription:
Senior Network Security Engineer

 

The Senior Security Engineer (Security6) will work seamlessly with the Chief Security Engineer to conduct security engineering activities.

 

Responsibilities:

 

-Work with the Infrastructure and Engineering Staff to incorporate tools and best practices that ensure control requirements are addressed to promote a robust security posture for the communications aspects of applications in both a private on premises data centers and public cloud offerings.

-Work closely with project teams to assist in the migration of systems from their current environment into the hybrid TI infrastructure while ensuring the security and integrity of the system.

-Follow documented technical approaches to assess threats and residual risks, along with specifying the implementations required.

-Utilize the organization tasking tracking database, framework and application to manage security operations and make the necessary reports based on due dates, assignments, coordination requirements, percent of completion, completion and archival. Devise solutions to operational problems within the capacity and operational limitations of installed equipment.

-Monitor and track security-related defects and resolutions; assigns tasks to the appropriate working group or individual. Coordinate and facilitate working groups and integrated process teams to achieve solution.

-Assist in establishing and implementing a Continuous Diagnostics and Mitigation (CDM) capability with integrated security controls.

-Focus on communications and networking needs between Cloud and on premises Data Centers, and Cloud and Internet (VPN) users.

-Enable continuous monitoring to proactively survey, monitor, and track security-related defects and the status of their resolution.

-Work within a Sprint to ensure engineering features and enhancements include security requirements and meet Federal directives. Acts as a bridge between project teams or developers and security personnel, by being able to understand and interface in all areas. Identify specific areas of concern related to securing sensitive data in a both a cloud and data center environment.

-Provide thought leadership to provide guidance and best practices

-Provide expertise with Federal Requirements related to special classifications of data especially Title 13 and 26, FISMA, FedRAMP, NIST, etc.

 

Required Experience:

 

-Acquisition, installation, maintenance, and usage of the Government Enterprise networks.

-Engineering solutions within multiple Cloud Service Providers, in particular AWS.

-Operations for Cisco ASA firewalls, routers and switches and the ability to formulate access control lists (ACLs) via the Command Line Interface (CLI).

-Enterprise level security hardening for Windows, Linux, Android and/or iOS operating systems and SQL, Oracle, and RDS database solutions in accordance with Center for Internet Security (CIS) and Security Technical Implementation Technical Guides (STIGs).

-Continuity of operations (COOP) concepts and implementation for network related hardware failures including isolated and major outages. Monitors and controls the performance and status of the network resources.

-Development and implementation of vulnerability remediation strategies. Configuration and execution of vulnerability and web application scans. Customization compliance scans to meet agency established baselines.

-Implementation PKI within an enterprise.

-Experience working in AWS via the CLI and management console. Knowledge and experience configuring Virtual Private Clouds (VPCs) and understanding the service offerings and how to configure them. Ability to automate the development of security controls including firewall rules and policy and IPS policy.

-Experience with automating server configuration for security including logging, key changes, and system hardening.

security engineer.skills: Senior Security Engineer - PKI or CyberArk
security engineer.jobDescription:
CLIENT IS REQUIRING EITHER PKI EXPERIENCE AND/OR PRIVILEGED ACCOUNT MANAGEMENT (CYBERARK OR SIMILAR)

Please send resume in Word format if you are interested in this Security Engineer / Senior Security Engineer opening in Cleveland, OH 44114. Salary for this role is going to be in the $120K-$140K range (some wiggle room) plus EXCELLENT BENEFITS (4 weeks vacation, 2 retirement plans provided to all employees, etc.) This is an onsite role. If you are not interested please pass onto colleagues/associates as we do offer $1000 referral bonuses should your referral be hired.

The Information Security Engineer is expected to perform all job duties with a commitment to providing superior service to internal customers and  clients, producing quality work products, maintaining professional standards and qualifications, exhibiting an advanced level of subject matter knowledge, and contributing to an atmosphere of teamwork and continuous improvement. 

Advise the Associate Director of Information Security, the Director of Technology, and managers on technical controls, procedural controls, observed or potential risks and threats, and the development of secure communications, computing, and information storage architectures within the client’s IT environment. Assume a technical leadership role; proactively and regularly collaborate with colleagues in order to conceive, design, configure, implement, and maintain solutions necessary to secure information and system assets in accordance with client priorities, regulations, client expectations, acknowledged standards, and industry best practices. Research, evaluate and recommend information-security-related solutions, including developing business cases for security investments.  Establish evaluation criteria, prepare ROI studies, and conduct trade-off studies among possible solutions. Interface with vendors and act as primary point of contact as needed for security solutions; communicate and document functional and technical security requirements; manage, install and configure purchased solutions or advise others handling such tasks; collaborate with other employees on integration tasks required for implementation; communicate, advise on, and recommend action to mitigate risks; maintain advanced knowledge of installed solutions. Take a leading role during incident response activities; guides root cause analysis; collaborate with support, vendors, and other teams on security- and data loss-related problems; propose and communicate interim workarounds. Provide thought leadership on emerging technologies; work with client and management to help establish security product portfolios, multi-year product roadmaps and program strategies; assist with preparation of realistic budgets, timelines, and deliverables. Work effectively on cross-functional teams; provide accurate time and cost estimates on assigned work; provide technical leadership on security solutions, processes, and projects of varying sizes. Manage multiple and competing priorities and assignments as required in a dynamic environment.

Ability to recognize opportunities for change and challenge assumptions regarding current environments and practices, ensuring that department and leaders are aware of and have considered alternatives and understand associated benefits and risks. Advanced level experience in security and data protection solutions implementation, monitoring, engineering & design, and administration, including  but not limited to configuration, assessing risk and recommending mitigation strategies, and evaluating emerging threats and recommending methods and available controls to minimize risk from such threats.  Advanced skills in security-related technologies, toolsets, and methodologies, including but not limited to:

SIEM & Log Analysis

Windows Desktop & Server

Database Security

Cloud-based Security

PKI

Active Directory

Identify & Access Management

DMZ Architecture & Design

Penetration Testing Methods

Unix-based Knowledge

Secure SDLC Processes

Web Applications

Data Loss Prevention

IDS/IPS and Firewall Rule Analysis

Network Access Control

Industry-accepted Security Frameworks (ISO 27001, NIST, COBIT, etc)

Network Monitoring Analysis, including Full Packet Capture

Comprehensive knowledge of the varying nature of security projects and controls selection, design, and implementation, capable of working effectively on small, medium, and client-wide projects. Solid experience across the systems development lifecycle, network & systems architecture, and recognized as the Subject Matter Expert (SME) across multiple security domains; develops security baselines for hardening standards. Highly developed analytical, research, interpersonal, and communication skills, both written and oral with superb listening and comprehension, as well as strong facilitation and leadership skills and mentoring capabilities; ability to effectively convey the need and benefits of one solution and/or process over another. Performs proactive analysis of data from disparate systems  to arrive at conclusions that assist in sound decision-making. Expertise in performing risk, business impact, control and vulnerability assessments. Excellent troubleshooting skills with a creative and collaborative approach to problem resolution; innovative with ability to find ways to enable required business functionality. Detail oriented self-starter, capable of independently identifying, prioritizing, and executing tasks. Forward looking, innovative mind-set, with a desire to continuously improve solutions and processes, and adopt emerging technologies; regularly engaged in Information Security community. Calm presence and ability to lead and direct technical response during incident management and remediation actions required. Ability to perform mathematical functions - add, subtract, multiply, divide, percentages.

Four year college degree preferred; additional experience and/or professional qualifications may be substituted for degree at discretion of hiring manager. Minimum of 8 years’ work experience in multiple security domains, or at discretion of hiring manager. Advanced certification such as Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), SANS GIAC (GCIH, GCFE,GPEN, etc), Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH), or similar preferred.
