security engineer.jobDescription:
Position Summary Collab9 is seeking a senior Systems and Network Security Engineer for support of its cloud datacenter environment. The primary responsibility includes managing and maintaining the security and compliance for a FedRAMP authorized cloud operation. Ideal candidate will have experience with Federal Information Security Act (FISMA) and/or FedRAMP, National Institute of Standards and Technologies (NIST) security controls and their implementation for a secure environment. 
 Geography Open to national search as a remote position based out of any state (but prefer Southern California). If out state, must be able to work a base schedule that coincides with California working hours of 8:00 AM to 5:00 Pacific Time, Monday through Friday. 
 Pay Range Base salary of $130,000 to $150,000 per year (prefer to recruit at low to mid-range if an otherwise qualified candidate is in state with lower cost of living than California). 
 Key Job Duties • Identifies, responds to, and mitigates sophisticated threats to computer networks, IT infrastructure, and information systems • Extensive knowledge of firewalls with configuration experience with Cisco ASA in various setups such as single and multi-context. Must be able to build complex NAT and access control rules, document configurations for compliance review and maintain configuration baseline in accordance with security benchmarks • Build, maintain and support multiple IPSEC site-to-site and/or DMVPNs across Cisco IOS routers and ASA firewalls. Troubleshoot VPN connectivity issues • Basic understanding of routing and switching technologies (Cisco based will be advantageous) • Experience with designing, implementing and operating Cisco ISE platform for access control using TACACS, RADIUS and MAB. Implement and support 802.1x capable network infrastructure using Cisco ISE • Maintain and support multifactor authentication deploying using RSA SecurID with Active Directory, ASA, and Cisco ISE integration • Implement and maintain IDS/IPS systems using Cisco Firepower appliance, Snort and Suricata. Understanding of Intrusion Detection Systems (IDS), Intrusion Protection Systems (IPS), Proxies (Web and Email), and Data Loss Prevention tools • Experience with vulnerability scanners like Nessus and Acunetix. Conduct information assurance compliance testing using automated tools and manual tests. Use Nessus for configuration baseline testing such as CIS benchmarks, database and web application scanning. • Compile and correlate compliance testing results for weekly and monthly reporting, working with engineering staff to ensure that identified vulnerabilities are addressed. Support CISO maintaining POA&M 
Page 2 of 2 
• Understanding of PKI using internal Root Certificate Authority. Deploy and maintain certificate lifecycle across infrastructure • Serve as a deeply skilled and knowledgeable resource within the SIEM technology area. Experience with implementation, management and operation of Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) tools • Participate on interconnecting the SIEM tool with sources of security incidents – e.g. logs from servers, network and security devices, Vulnerability Management system, Antivirus system, etc • Conducts security monitoring and incident response activities, including advanced investigation (forensic, malware analyses, root cause analysis etc.) to examine potential intrusions, security incidents, incident prioritization and false positives • Secure systems and perform hardening based on security benchmarks, vendor provided guidance and custom developed baseline • Deploy and operating Symantec Antivirus, application whitelisting, and application level firewalls • Generation of technology documentation and diagramming with tools such as MS Word, Excel and Visio • Supports security review and documentation processes • Familiar with various Risk and Compliance management frameworks such as NIST800-53, PCI etc. 
 Minimum Qualifications (regard as necessary requirements unless specified as “preferred” or “highly desirable”): • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Information security or a related field • Minimum 4 years of experience in a similar role, network security • 3+ years of strong experience with SIEM tools • 3+ years of experience with scanning tools such as Nessus • 3+ years of strong experience with Cisco Firewall management. • 2+ years of experience with TACACS,RADIUS (Cisco ISE, RSA SecurID preferred) • 2+ years of experience with intrusion detection and intrusion prevention systems • 2+ years of experience with Multifactor authentication • 2+ years of experience with enterprise level anti-virus such as Symantec endpoint protection • Knowledge of PKI operations • Knowledge of Windows and Linux Operating systems • Strong troubleshooting skills • Process both technical and non-technical problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to conceptualize, plan, develop and deliver a variety of creative solutions. • Ability to identify, develop and document business requirements, technical requirements and functional design. • Ability to document and explain complex technical concepts. • Ability to write, edit, and prepare graphic presentations of technical information for both technical and business personnel. • Experience in organizing information in a way that is appropriate for technical explanations without losing sight of the needs and aptitude of the audience • Technologies: TACACS / Radius, AAA, Firewalls, VPN, Intrusion Prevention Systems, MAC Authentication Bypass, PKI, Dynamic routing, L2 / L3 Switching Equipment: Cisco ISE, ASA Firewall, IPS Module,, RSA SecurID, Syslog servers, Orion monitoring tools, AlienVault SIEM • Certifications - CISSP 
 Preferred Qualifications • Prior experience in government agencies subject to FISMA • Experience with Cloud environments is highly desirable

security engineer.skills: Senior Security Engineer
security engineer.jobDescription:
Senior Security Engineer This individual devises solutions to complex security and business needs while aligning with company strategies, policies standards, guidelines and procedures. This individual highlights and leads the remediation of significant gaps in the security of a large enterprise.

Creates solutions for cross-enterprise complex problems in the areas of:

* Application Security

* Infrastructure / Endpoint Security

* Cloud Security

* Database Security

Gives guidance to and mentors SOC Analyst and Engineers. Provides guidance and security consulting services to IT leadership.

Provide Level III Support for escalated tickets from SOC and other engineering teams

• Collaborate with other teams as necessary to ensure customer service levels are met

• Design and development of Security Solutions to protect IT assets (Americas)

• Work closely with Infrastructure OR Software Delivery engineering teams to ensure security requirements are understood and built into the design of other enterprise services

• Forecast and Establish technical requirements in concert with Architecture and Risk Management for Connectivity (intra and intercompany), Internet facing solutions, Infrastructure, Application, eCommerce, Mobility, Cloud, etc.

• Provide subject matter expertise for Architecture, Planning and Roadmap sessions

• Research, evaluate, design, test, recommend and plan the implementation of new or updated information security technologies

• Document solutions engineered to be handed off to SOC, and other Engineering support organizations

• Own Security aspects of Software OR Infrastructure Delivery lifecycle

• Perform product and solution life cycle management ensuring capacity, integrity and availability of all systems.

• Lead the execution of more complex multi-platform changes

• Participate in projects as required; analyze, design, develop and implement security solutions which protect the information assets while enabling business functionality

• Lead/direct IT infrastructure OR application penetration testing using standard tools and procedures

• Perform Root Cause analysis for security or availability failure and direct the remediation of Security related causes

 
Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems or related degree, or equivalent job experience. 

• 2 years of experience in Security solution design, implementation and troubleshooting across all computer platforms.

• 5 years of experience in Security technology implementation and troubleshooting across all computer platforms

• 5 or more years required of combined IT and security work experience with a broad exposure to infrastructure/network and multi-platform environments.

• Experience and hands-on working knowledge with a variety of security technologies and processes including but not limited to Firewall, VPN, SEIM, IDS/IPS, HIDS, malware analysis and protection, content filtering, logical access controls, data loss prevention, content filtering technologies, application firewalls, vulnerability scanners, forensics software, and security incident response.

• Understanding of Cloud solution best practices and integration techniques

• GIAC and ISC2 certifications such as CISSP are highly preferred.

• Good understanding of Risk and Compliance framework, regulatory compliance (Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) and PCI-DSS)

• Highly self-motivated

• Strong attention to detail

• Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a complex environment

• Solid understanding of standard business processes including Change Management, Problem Management, Work Prioritization, Quality Assurance, and Continuous Improvement best practices, etc.

security engineer.skills: Senior Network Security Engineer
security engineer.jobDescription:
Our client, an international law firm in midtown Manhattan, is looking to hire a senior network security engineer to join their team on a full time basis.

This person will be part of a team of engineers responsible for the network infrastructure and security of the firm with 1100 end users. This role will focus on network/security engineering, design, implementation, configurations, and support.  This person will be primarily responsible for network security including Palo Alto and Cisco ASA layer 7 next generation firewalls.  They will be heavily involved in the implementation of Cisco Identity Services Engineer (ISE) for network access control.  They will also be working with Cisco networking technology including Nexus switches.  The main routing protocols being utilized are BGP and EIGRP.  This person will also provide backup support for technologies such as Cisco Wireless Controllers and the firm's Cisco VOIP/unified communications infrastructure. 

Candidates must have at least 5-10 years of network security experience. Candidates must have senior level experience with layer 7 next generation firewalls such as Cisco ASA and Palo Alto.  Candidates must have a strong background in Cisco networking and have experience with Nexus switches.  Experience implementing Cisco ISE would be ideal.  Any experience with Cisco wireless or Cisco VOIP would be a huge plus.  Any security or networking certifications are a plus.

This position will sit in midtown Manhattan and is easily commutable by public transportation.  Our client is offering a competitive base salary, discretionary bonus, and a comprehensive benefits package and retirement plan.



 


 


 

About TEKsystems:

Join TEKsystems®, a leading IT staffing, IT talent management and IT services firm, and get your career on the fast track. security engineer.jobDescription:
TEKsystems is seeking a cyber security SME to support client in a full time opportunity in Orlando.  Below are details on the position:

Top Three Skills:

Windows OS Experience - This candidate needs to understand how processes talk and work, how systems and file sharing works. Microsoft logs and registry and the inner workings of the operating system itself. Deep knowledge of security specifics around different signatures , different modes and methods for people to hack a system or create havoc on an environment.

Log Data - Need to understand events that are written to the logs and understanding how those events are correlated with each other.

Log Analysis Software experience - Splunk is the most common. This is the type of product that they're making.

Malware - Being familiar with malware and experience analyzing it effects in a PC environment.




 ○ This candidate needs to be a Cyber Security SME where they will be simulating malware attacks on PCs in a confined lab. They will do log captures on everything that happens associated with the particular malware injected. Must have experience with triage, remediation, malware, detection, mitigation and forensics. They will need to be able to launch it, remove it, redo it, remediate it, rework it - they will need to go through the whole cycle. They also have to be able to map it behaviors and give them behaviors of the application, based off the bug/log file data. 
 ○ They will be creating different attack scenarios and be able to Triangulate the signatures and behaviors, so that they are able to create behaviors so they can do there own detections. They will launch these behaviors into their test logs. Developers/Data Scientists are launching this data into the test logs.

security engineer.jobDescription:
What you’ll be doing... 
   MSS Client Security Engineer (CSE)   
  In an effort to customize and drive greater value out of the Managed Security Services and Vulnerability Management Services, Verizon clients have the ability to purchase additional Support via a Client Security Engineer (CSE) (formally Security Life Cycle Engineer (SLCE) or Client Engineer (CE).    
  Client Security Engineer (CSE) is another integral part of the managed security solution. Our CSE partner with the customer’s network and security architects to create security designs based on best practices and customized to meet the customer security policies. They will ensure that new designs support appropriate capacity levels and then provide ongoing capacity management though-out the design life cycle. The CSE is tasked with lifecycle ownership of the environment and works closely with Security Operations Center and back office MSS teams to provide 3 rd  and/or 4th level operational support, problem resolution, and identify production pain points. As part of the solution, CSE can be engaged to provide proactive project proposals based on capacity monitoring and operational pain points. All security designs are created to support SLA and are therefore optimized to support business continuity. Where possible, we will also look for opportunities to consolidate infrastructure to reduced cost and/or dedicated lanes built for high priority applications. Our CSE have extensive experience with complex designs including those associated with the wide variety of vendor platforms supported by MSS today.    
   Potential CSE Roles & Responsibilities   
  Client Security Engineer/Security LifeCyle Engineers are involved in a number of tasks typically specified and bundled in an agreed upon and approved SOW and contact that enhance our world-class device and policy management offering. Some of these tasks may include:   
  Security Architecture    
  CSE maintains standards for custom MSS engagements   
  Customer Premise Equipment (CPE) lists   
  Version control   

  CSE ensures that all MSS designs are   
  Technically sound   
  Compliant with the customer’s security policy   
  Manageable & Supportable from the 24x7 SOC   
  Within Scope of the contract and SOW   


  Projects    
  CSE provides functional expertise for customer projects that contain in-scope security requirements and SOW.   
  Responsibilities may include: requirements mapping, consulting, project response, level of effort determination, equipment specification, and implementation recommendations and guidance.   
  CSE also proactively generates proposals for recommended, corrective, courses of action based on problem management or RCA reports.   

  Ops Support    
  CSE provides 3 rd  or 4th level Operations Support as defined in SOW   
  CSE are stakeholder in effective designs throughout their life-cycle   
  Because of their tight integration with Operations, engineering and service management, CSE is able to assist in developing pain-point resolutions.   

  Understands how to upload vulnerability details into Online Guardian, analyze Level 0 through Level 4 incidents, and provide guidance & recommendations or perform device level and SEAM policy tuning.    

  Defines action plans that are easy to implement, effective at reducing risk, and as much as possible will take advantage of existing people, processes, and technologies.   
  Assist Ops in prioritizing remediation efforts based on business need, compliance need, and/or risk reduction need.   
  With the Security Services Adviser (SSA or SSA+), participates in status calls to discuss risk intelligence, incidents, vulnerability details, change request, implementation state, compliance state, and/or risk state.   
  Other duties per the specific client SOW which may include:   
  Designated engineer(s) assigned to the contract who:    
  Become increasingly familiar with the full & current state of the topology, CPE, routing, applications and traffic flows.

What you’ll be doing... 
   MSS Client Security Engineer (CSE)   
  In an effort to customize and drive greater value out of the Managed Security Services and Vulnerability Management Services, Verizon clients have the ability to purchase additional Support via a Client Security Engineer (CSE) (formally Security Life Cycle Engineer (SLCE) or Client Engineer (CE).    
  Client Security Engineer (CSE) is another integral part of the managed security solution. Our CSE partner with the customer’s network and security architects to create security designs based on best practices and customized to meet the customer security policies. They will ensure that new designs support appropriate capacity levels and then provide ongoing capacity management though-out the design life cycle. The CSE is tasked with lifecycle ownership of the environment and works closely with Security Operations Center and back office MSS teams to provide 3 rd  and/or 4th level operational support, problem resolution, and identify production pain points. As part of the solution, CSE can be engaged to provide proactive project proposals based on capacity monitoring and operational pain points. All security designs are created to support SLA and are therefore optimized to support business continuity. Where possible, we will also look for opportunities to consolidate infrastructure to reduced cost and/or dedicated lanes built for high priority applications. Our CSE have extensive experience with complex designs including those associated with the wide variety of vendor platforms supported by MSS today.    
   Potential CSE Roles & Responsibilities   
  Client Security Engineer/Security LifeCyle Engineers are involved in a number of tasks typically specified and bundled in an agreed upon and approved SOW and contact that enhance our world-class device and policy management offering. Some of these tasks may include:   
  Security Architecture

security engineer.jobDescription:
IT Security Engineer Phase



The Security Engineer will report to the Manager of Security and work within the cybersecurity sub-team to support security technology within corporate and industrial control system environments. The Engineer will support existing security toolset (Syslog, IDS / IPS, SIEM, ELK, vulnerability scanning, etc), and tool systems (OS, network, and custom code), including maintenance of NERC CIPS compliance. Parse, archive, and analyze incoming data from across the enterprise for the creation of alarms and digests to the security analyst sub-team.  Develop in-house solutions using OSS and custom code. Provide technical assistance as needed to IT, generation and other departments to enable them to meet security goals and requirements. Activities include, but are not limited to:

 
Perform duties as assigned by the Manager of Security.
Support and maintain the Security Information Event Management (SIEM), Vulnerability Scanner, ELK research stack, syslog collectors, and other Information Security assets as needed. Includes meeting CIP requirements for Information Security-owned CIPS assets.
Support and maintain corporate Proxy, intrusion detection (IDS), intrusion prevention systems (IPS).
Perform system administrator functions in the Linux environment supporting the security toolsets.
Create documentation to support management of security environment and toolsets – job aids, policies and processes.
Create and tune automated log analysis and alerting to meet internal system/network changes and ongoing developments in the overall security landscape.
Acquire/develop, and deploy new Information Security systems, either as standalone systems or as part of larger corporate projects.
Provide timely and accurate cross-platform support in response to security threats that may arise that poses a risk systems across the company’s computing enterprise.
Support compliance requirements including CIPS, including the documentation of monitoring and review activities related to CIPS assets.

 

Requirements:



Reply to each of the following requirements for each candidate. Confirm if the requirement can be met with a narrative description as appropriate. Provide a resume for each candidate.


 


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field; or equivalent work experience. (Typically four years of additional related, progressive work experience would be needed for candidates applying for this position who do not possess a Bachelor’s degree.)


Two years of experience in SIEM, proxy, IDS and IPS systems with associated incident response experience.


Excellent system administration skills on Linux systems.


Exposure to programming and scripting languages such as PERL, Python, and Powershell, as well as open source security tools such as SNARE, SNORT, etc.


Ability to construct and execute complex database queries using SQL.


Technical knowledge of complex operating systems, database, network software, and disaster recovery practices.


Knowledge of information technology terms, equipment, systems, functions, and major vendors.


Excellent oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills.


Effective interpersonal skills and customer relationship skills.


Effective analytical, problem-solving and decision-making skills.


Project management skills; ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks and projects concurrently.

security engineer.employmentType: Contract Corp-To-Corp, Contract Independent, Contract W2, C2H Corp-To-Corp, C2H Independent, C2H W2
security engineer.jobDescription:
We are seeking a consultant with deep industry knowledge and executive experience to manage and extend the existing strategy/roadmap for IT security. The roadmap should be developed after analysis and discussion with relevant stakeholders, including IT managers and business leads.

Required Experience:

Deep knowledge and experience of IT and Information Security with a public sector.
Strategic planning experience, directing organization’s Information Security posture for regulations including HIPAA, Data Practices Act, and PCI.

The work should occur in three parts:

An Assessment Phase of learning and analysis, including on-site consultation and interviews.
A Plan Phase, in the form of a deliverable that includes an assessment and roadmap of recommendations, which the organization can use as a guide over the next three years.
A Mentorship Phase, in the form of guidance and knowledge transfer for a subset of security personnel to carry the plan forward post engagement.

Description of Work to Be Performed and the Specific Skill Sets Needed:

Onsite consultation and interviews with the CIO, business information officers, operations manager, IT division managers and others to understand the current organizational structure, capacity, skillsets, demands and, at a high level, the security capabilities of the county.
Development and delivery of the assessment and roadmap deliverable, which outlines the findings of the current state and proposes targets/goals for evolving security over the next three years. This report must include but is not limited to, recommendations in the following areas:Resourcing
Workforce planning
Vendor utilization
Cloud utilization


The deliverable should include any pertinent analysis but at a minimum address the following areas of concern:
In light of a rapidly changing industry, what do we need to consider in order to become more agile, adaptable and innovative in the security space?
What are core competencies consistently identified by our staff?
What areas should we consider culling in order to focus on our strengths?
What strategies can we employ in order to reduce costs or slow cost growth over the long term?
Where are opportunities to leverage a Managed Security Systems Provider (MSSP) or other external partners/vendors?
What additional challenges will we face as we move from on-premises infrastructure to hybrid or full cloud architectures?
What changes do you recommend to roles and responsibilities in order to accomplish the above, especially in the areas of:
enterprise architecture
operations
development
vendor management

The Denzel Group has been chosen to work with a leading organization near Hunt Valley, MD on their open Network Security Engineer position. You will be responsible for identifying security threats and risks and also creating plans for mitigating them.  You will analyze server, firewall and other related security infrastructure logs to determine threats to the business.  The preferred candidate will also possess excellent communication and can hit the ground running as a Security Engineer!

Responsibilities:

Troubleshoot and Maintain VPN Capabilities
Keeping up to date with the latest vulnerabilities and risks to meet the ever-changing threat landscape.
Firewall and network device hardening and design.
Developing and maintaining desktop, network and server security policies.

Requirements:

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent of 7 years of related security experience
CISSP certification preferred
Solid knowledge of both security and networking protocols

security engineer.skills: Analytical, Analytical Skills, CTO, Engineer, Engineering, Engineers, IT, Linux, Network, Security, System, Systems, Testing, Windows
security engineer.jobDescription:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Kforce has a client seeking a Cyber Security Engineer in Hanahan, South Carolina (SC) who will provide Security Engineering Support for Navy and other DoD programs. One will also be responsible for conducting security lockdowns and security engineering changes on a major Navy Enterprise Program. 

 
Responsibilities Include:
* Conduct Security lockdowns and make engineering changes to a system based on DISA Security Technical Implementation Guides (STIGs), Navy CTO requirements, Navy Intelligence Guidance, and security best business practices
* Work with other engineers and developers to ensure the system meets the accreditation requirements for Navy Certification and Accreditation (C&A)
* Update Risk Assessment Reports and provide risk mitigation statements when necessary
* Assist with Security Policy and Procedure documentation for the system
* Assist with conducting Security Testing & Evaluation (ST&E) for the system as needed
* Provide Security engineering guidance based on DoD and industry Security Best Business Practices

REQUIREMENTS:
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent with 8+ years of IT experience and 5+ years of Cyber Security experience
* Security+ certification required
* Windows or Linux OS certification preferred 
* Minimum of 6 years of Security Engineering experience to include system administration and/or systems engineering 
* Experience running all DoD Security Tools and DISA STIGs
* Host Based Security System (HBSS) and ACAS experience a plus
* Excellent working knowledge of Windows Operating Systems; Linux experience a plus
* Good working knowledge of network devices, and related infrastructure devices 
* Solid analytical skills to troubleshoot and resolve high-level, complex, technical problems
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills to include briefing executive leadership
* Knowledge of Navy Certification and Accreditation (C&A) Requirements preferred 
* Some travel required (<10%)
* TS/SCI clearance preferred or Secret clearance with ability to obtain TS/SCI

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

security engineer.skills: Architecture, BIND, Configuration Management, Cryptography, Development, Hardware, HTML, Management, Modeling, Networking, Security, Software Engineer, VPN, Wireless
security engineer.jobDescription:
Kabbage is blazing a trail in big data & fintech and we are looking for a  Principal Security Engineer 
 to join us as we continue our amazing growth trajectory.   


Kabbage is more than a lender for small businesses; our data and technology platform is now being used as a fully branded product by other lenders, and our products are expanding. We've received numerous awards & recognition, including Glassdoor's 2017 Best Places to Work, "36th fastest growing company in the US" on the INC 500 List, Fast Company's "Top 10 most innovative companies in finance" and Forbes' "America's Top 100 Most Promising Companies" among others.  Your mission: 


Be the hands-on security expert for Kabbage. Design hardened solutions for Kabbage and its partners. Perform threat modeling and vulnerability/risk assessments. Work side-by-side with the development and systems engineering teams to ensure systems are secure.  What you'll be doing: Make security decisions for Kabbage's application architecture to identify flaws and vulnerabilities. 
Conduct security reviews—from high-level web application architecture to OS level configuration—to meet security goals. 
Identify security flaws and vulnerabilities before they're an issue. 
Lead incident response activities. 
Influence Product, DevOps, and Engineering teams with risk-based judgment to mitigate vulnerabilities. Promote secure development practices to engineering and product teams. 
Work with Kabbage's external partners to ensure their security requests are feasible. 
What you should have: 
You've been a software engineer who's worked on web apps. You read code and understand vulnerabilities in code. 
You've worked with Engineering teams to understand the existing technical ecosystem and how to secure it. 
You've worked with DevOps to detect vulnerabilities, monitor for malicious activity, and evolve how services are run. 
You like IDS/IPS, authentication tools, scanning tools, and craft beer. 
You understand networking, including wired and wireless security, firewalls, VPN, and network access control. 
Patching, device management, and configuration management—been there, done that. 
IAM, MFA, PKI, cryptography—you didn't need to google any of that. 
You've created DLP strategies. 
What we're looking for in you: 
Assertiveness 
: You can challenge the assumptions of others, then pivot to collaborating with them to make solutions truly secure. 
Structured thinking 
: Ability to hone in on the key issues of a problem and cleanly structure a path to a solution. 
Proactivity 
: Resourceful, has grit, and a positive "can do" attitude; acts without being told what to do. 
Flexibility/adaptability 
: Cool with rapidly changing priorities and projects. 
Follow-through 
: Follows-through on items without being managed. 
Calm under pressure 
: Ability to navigate and lead the team through high-priority last minute requests and other high stress situations. 
Communication 
: You speak clearly and with intent across multiple channels of communication (in person, emails, presentations). 
Why Kabbage? 
Our people! We are very proud of our people, our products, and our fun, friendly, and passionate culture. 
Equity—everyone's an owner! 
Full coverage of individual health benefits 
Fully stocked kitchen & catered lunches daily 
Casual work environment—just cover all of the requisite parts! 
Top of the line hardware 



Kabbage is an equal opportunity employer. At Kabbage we make all employment decisions, which include hiring, promoting, transferring, demoting, evaluating, compensating and separating, without regard to sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, race, color, religion, age, national origin, pregnancy, citizenship, disability, service in the uniform services, or any other classification protected by federal, state or local law.

security engineer.jobDescription:
StaffSource is working with a client in the Knoxville, TN area seeking a Cyber Security Engineer for a permanent position. 

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Providing Tier 2 and 3 support in a Security Operations Center environment 
Analysis of information security related events and incidents
Incident Response (IR) support when analysis confirms actionable incident
Provide threat and vulnerability analysis as well as security advisory services
Analyze and respond to previously undisclosed software and hardware vulnerabilities
Investigate, document and report on information security issues and emerging trends
On-call after hours support of roughly one week per month

 QUALIFICATIONS / EXPERIENCE:

Bachelor's degree in a related field or equivalent demonstrated experience and knowledge
At least 2-5 years' experience as a Security/Network Administrator or equivalent knowledge
Desired Certifications in CISSP, GCIH, GCFA, GCIA, GSEC, other GIAC, CEF, CISM, CISA
Knowledge of various security methodologies and processes, and technical security solutions (firewall and intrusion detection systems)
Knowledge of various security infrastructure components (e.g. firewalls, SIEM, NAC, end point protection etc.)
Knowledge of TCP/IP Protocols, network analysis, and network/security applications
Knowledge of common Internet protocols and applications
Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively
Strong attention to detail
Excellent interpersonal skills and professional demeanor
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Excellent customer service skills
Experience with Incident, Problem and Change management processes in enterprise environments.
Ability to work in a fast paced environment, interact with staff, peers and customers on a technical & professional level.
Demonstrated ability to work under pressure and deliver to meet Service Level Agreements.
Proactive and independent mindset as well as a willingness to share knowledge.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Applications

Those interested in this role can apply by submitting resumes and any other documents (Cover Letters, Transcripts, References, etc.) to kwalker@staffsource.com. 


StaffSource/StaffSource Technology provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, StaffSource/StaffSource Technology complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

security engineer.jobDescription:
The Company
Headquartered in Beverly Hills, our client is a quick and innovative leading digital technology company in the security space.  They have provided managed info security and consulting services to small and large organizations across the globe for nearly two decades.  Their security solutions have been built with a fine-tuned combination of real world experts, streamlined processes, and industry leading technology. Job Description 
As a Senior Security Engineer, you will be working directly with clients, helping them make important decisions about solution configurations and the security of their company.  The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 3-4 years experience in the security space as well as experience with Homebrew.  This role will work through the entire cycle of security vulnerabilities with clients including managing the cause, impact, and remediation of a breach. You will help prevent threats within the company and deal with the high paced issues of an information security company. 
Required Skills
3-4 years of experience in the Security space
BA/BS (Security preferred), or equivalent experience
Collaborate closely with other team members
Experience with Homebrew  
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Customer facing
Additional Skills
Strong problem solving and analytical
The Offer
Competitive salary up to $150k, based on experience
Full benefits package including health, and dental coverage
401K
Flexible PTO
Fully Stocked Kitchen
Gym membership
Local candidates only please.  Talener strives to meet their candidates and clients in person in order to ensure the right fit for everyone.  Only candidates who are authorized to work in the United States for any employer will be considered.  Our client cannot provide sponsorship at this time.https://www.talener.com/candidates/job-listings/?rpid=mo-26h-gQ38

security engineer.skills: Cisco, Arista, Juniper, Checkpoint, A10, MPLS, Load Balancing, Network Engineer, Network Security
security engineer.jobDescription:
*** PLEASE NO INQUIRES FROM RECRUITERS OR AGENCIES ***


 

WHO ARE THEY?


Our client is the leading global provider of multi-broker, multi-asset class, Software-as-a-Service electronic trading solutions. Their Clients include major banks, brokerage firms, dealers, asset managers, fund managers and electronic exchanges.

 

JOB DESCRIPTION:


We are looking for a Network Security Engineer who will design, plan, install, coordinate, and perform operational duties to meet business requirements of an infrastructure that consists of Cisco, Juniper, Arista, Checkpoint, and A10.  This position focuses on working with a team of engineers to engineer and evaluate not only firewall and network security services for use within the enterprise network but also support a Global Financial MPLS Network and management of the hardware and software as well as the day to day operations of the network.

 
 


WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING:


You will work on various network hardware/software towards Cisco and Artisa Routers and Switches, A10 Load balancers, and Juniper and Checkpoint firewalls, including both configuration design and implementation.  These will be business or internally driven projects that require focus for delivery on time and in the budget.  This includes high-level and low-level design as well high –level technical support for network systems creates and maintains network documentation, and etc.

 

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:


You must be well versed in the advanced engineering and administration of multiprotocol routers, multilayer switches, network security devices and network management systems.
Extensive Core Network Experience
Experience working on high availability/ volume networks
Hands on experience with high volume L3/L2 network design and development
Hands-on experience with a major network vendor: Cisco, Arista, or Juniper
Hands-on experience with policy-based firewalls: Checkpoint, Netscreen, Cisco, etc.
Knowledge of load balancing technologies, A10 or F5
Extensive knowledge of TCP/IP, LAN/WAN, routing protocols (OSPF, BGP, VRFs, Multicast) and Ethernet switching technologies
Knowledge of the OSI model, especially layers 2-4
Detailed knowledge and experience around networking, including dynamic routing, VLANs, HSRP, VRRP, QoS/CoS, MPLS, Spanning Tree, VLAN tagging (802.1Q), and etc.
Ability to perform hands-on work in the Data Center including racking/un-racking equipment
Excellent organizational, project management, and communications skills, with a detail-oriented approach
US Citizens, Green Card Holders, and those authorized to work in the US are encouraged to apply
We are unable to sponsor H1B candidates at this time

 

*** Please contact Neal@212.993.8010 ONLY and ONLY if you are a candidate that matches the skill sets required ***


 

*** ANY CALLS FROM ANY RECRUITER OR AGENCY WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED ***

security engineer.jobDescription:
Employer (NYSE: CTL) is a global communications and IT services company focused on connecting its customers to the power of the digital world. Employer offers network and data systems management, big data analytics, managed security services, hosting, cloud, and IT consulting services. The company provides broadband, voice, video, advanced data and managed network services over a robust 265,000-route-mile U.S. fiber network and a 360,000-route-mile international transport network. Visit Employer for more information. 






Job Summary 
We have an opening for an experienced Software Engineer to expand our team of engineers developing Employer's authentication and remote access security platform. This is a great opportunity for an experienced network software development engineer to move into the cyber security development field.  

Job Description 
We want to hire unbelievably bright developers, who are a joy to work with, love to work with others, solve problems, listen well, and lead as appropriate. Oh, yeah, they have to love to learn new things, too. The candidate should have a passion creating applications, services, and building system's integrations that streamline company operations, build system security, and keep our employees work focused on their core competency through enterprise-ready applications. 
Limiting yourself to just one area of the technology stack would be unthinkable for this kind of developer, so we hope that you are comfortable doing everything from creating beautiful, friendly UIs, to crafting logical and easy to use APIs, generating systems integration, all the way to writing distributed computing algorithms between applications. 
Beyond coding, the ideal candidate will have experience with networking and network element management, RADIUS, authentication platforms, and security best practice guidelines.  
You're the type that gets things done and solves problems. You love coding, enjoy the expanding field of security, and are passionate about learning new things to expand your skills. You want to contribute and create something that matters to you. You want freedom to code, without being interrupted by a crazy amount of meetings and interoffice bureaucracy. You're a direct but open-minded communicator that's also transparent and kind. If you're laid back and appreciate an open door policy that means you can ask anyone anything - this is the job for you. 

Qualifications 





You'll need to be well-versed in developing for the network and cyber security, using such technologies as  




Skilled at working with both Linux and Windows. 

Strong knowledge of web frameworks (ASP.NET, Java EE), Javascript, for both front end and back end development. 

Proficient in OO programming language, such as Java or C#. 

Familiar with working in with an IDE such as Visual Studio or Eclipse. 

Familiar with database environments (Sql Server, Oracle, MySQL) and writing SQL procedures and functions. 

Knowledgeable in maintaining a web service through IIS or Apache/Tomcat. 

Proficient in using Git. 

Knack for writing clean, readable, and easily maintainable code 




This is a full stack position, with a high degree of systems integration, so you must love coding both the back and front ends.  

COMPETENCIES 




5 years of professional development experience plus network or security relevant experience 

Bachelor's Degree: Telecommunications, Computer Science, Engineering, Cybersecurity, related field or equivalent experience 

Proficient in coding languages such as Java, C++, Expect, C##, PHP 

Familiar with security tools and concepts such as firewalls, multi-factor authentication, TACACS, virtual private networks (VPN), intrusion detection and prevention, endpoint security, mobility management, Host-Based intrusion detection and prevention, SIEM, privilege management, data loss prevention, Email Filtering a plus. 

Proficient with health monitoring tools and technologies 

Proficient with multiple operating systems; Linux, Windows, Solaris, Mac OSX 

Advanced knowledge of networks, applications, operating systems, databases, etc. 

Fluent in at multiple scripting languages 

Strong interpersonal and written/oral communication skills 

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with good knowledge of tools and techniques for anticipating, recognizing and resolving technical problems pertaining to security. 

Experienced in Test Planning and Test Execution 

Experience in large enterprise or carrier data centers and/or networks a bonus 

Certifications: 


CISSP, CEH, GCIH, GPEN, GWAPT, GSEC, CISM or CISA or equivalent level certifications 

Network or Operating System certifications current or expired strongly desire. 




Education 





Bachelors or Equivalent in Information Systems or Other Technology 



Alternate Location: 
 US-Arizona-Phoenix; US-Colorado-Broomfield; US-Colorado-Denver; US-Colorado-Littleton; US-Kansas-Gardner; US-Louisiana-Monroe  

Requisition # 
 : 
 174823  


This job may require successful completion of an online assessment. A brief description of the assessments can be viewed on our website at  Employer

security engineer.skills: Access, Analysis, Application, Business Requirements, Capacity Planning, Cisco, Computer, Consulting, Engineer, Firewall, HTTP, IT, Management, Network, Performance, Protocols, Security, SSL, System, Systems, Telecom, VPN, Wireless
security engineer.jobDescription:
This position requires technical expertise to ensure Client Security infrastructure complies with corporate policies, relevant regulation and industry best practices, and provides highest level of availability. The infrastructure must provide access that is responsive and flexible to business requirements. This position is recognized as a senior security specialist, possessing a broad understanding of firewall architectures, including other perimeter security components such as Proxy, VPN, IDS/IPS etc, and the inter-operability of technologies in the current and planned infrastructure. This position keeps apprised of the changing security landscape, and is integrally involved in implementing best practices in a dynamic environment. 

Major Opportunities and Decisions:   

 * Provides technical and security consultation to IT and Business Technology Solutions (BTS). 

 * Identifies opportunities for business application alignment with security best practices. 

 * Identifies opportunities for process improvement 

Principal Accountabilities:   

 * Execute daily security systems management functions 

 * Provide technical monitoring, incident response and remediation 

 * Assist with Security Governance projects 

 * Provide consultative services to IT/BTS teams 

 * Identify opportunity for security services level improvement. 

 * Performs performance monitoring and capacity planning. 

Qualifications:   

 * Must have 5+ years experience with network and security protocols 

 * Must have 3+ years experience with installation and configuration of Checkpoint firewalls/vpn 

 * Must have 2+ years experience with installation and configuration of Cisco firewalls/vpn 

 * 2+ years experience with installation and configuration of IDS/IPS a plus 

 * 2+ years experience in administering and supporting Bluecoat proxies a plus. 

 * 1+ years experience in Cisco SSL VPN a plus 

 * 1+ years experience in wireless technologies including rogue detection a plus 

 * Solid design and implementation experience on Checkpoint and Cisco Firewalls 

 * Ability to perform security system configuration and administration, system updates, policy compliance, and security assessments. 

 * IT forensic investigations and incident handling. 

 * Advanced knowledge of HTTP(S), network protocols such as IP, TCP, UDP, DNS along with packet analysis 

 * Knowledge of Bluecoat , Proxies, Cisco SSL VPN, Clean Access and Client 

 * Solid troubleshooting skills, good communications skills both written and oral, ability to multitask in a fast, dynamic environment built on multi-vendor security controls. 

 * Good team player, willing to work weekends occasionally and willing to be on call as needed. 

 * Ability to work independently and with limited guidance, ability to identify problems and resolve collaboratively with other functional teams and vendor partners 

 * Advanced understanding of common IT security controls and protocols. 

 * BA/BS Degree or equivalent experience, preferably in Computer Science. 


 Princeton Information is one of the nation's top five privately-held IT consulting firms, in business since 1985. Princeton Information services a clientele of primarily Fortune 500 companies nationwide. With annual revenues over $120 million, Princeton Information operates across the US from multiple regional offices. 


 Our Commitment to Our Consultants 


 As a privately held company, Princeton Information is solely committed to the success of clients and consultants - not to any shareholders. PI's success is grounded in the relationships we build with our consultants. We seek the best people; provide career path counseling; as well as the most challenging opportunities in business and in IT. As part of its culture of loyalty and commitment to its consultants, Princeton Information is committed to doing all we can to ensure our consultants have the best possible search, placement and work experience possible. 


 Our Services 


 Working with one Princeton Recruiter will gain you access to over 500 open requirements with the top clients in the US across all industries (finance, insurance, pharmaceutical, commercial, telecom, media, manufacturing) nationwide. Our local recruiters have in-depth knowledge of our clients and opportunities. They will work with you to find you the best possible opportunities for you and your career. 


 Our Relationships 


 Our relationships with our clients, as well as our consultants, are critical to our success! We have a robust sales organization that ensures that Princeton has the inside track on what attributes a person needs in order to be successfully placed and engaged at our clients. We know the technical and non-technical skills that our clients are looking for and we ensure that you are educated about the client prior to your interview with them. Princeton is committed to going above and beyond to ensure that each meeting you have with a client is a successful one!

security engineer.jobDescription:
Robert Half Technology is looking for a detail oriented Security Network Engineer who is deeply passionate about networking hardware and software. Are you are a problem solver who has a strong knowledge of interfacing, security, Internet protocols and server and network infrastructure? Then we have the position you'll love. 

Must have a willingness to learn and be willing to take vendor certification courses 

 Must be comfortable with the use of software packages  

 5+ years' experience with TCP/IP network equipment 

 5+ years' experience with advanced network security systems 

 Detailed Understanding of the functional aspects of key infrastructure protocols 

 Robust understanding of networking and Internet technologies and experience with complex systems troubleshooting 

 Ability to multi-task under stressful situations 

 High reading comprehension 

 Ability to rapidly pick up new technology and self-direct study 

 Product Deployment: deploy security driven products to customers and manage the full life cycle of deployment from planning to completion. 

 Provide value-added consulting services, such as automation processes, best practice advice, special projects and integration activities. 

 Participate in post-sales customer meetings, presentations, requirements gathering, solution design and competitive positioning. 

 Customer Training Work with the customers to ensure they are properly trained and leveraging the solution and achieving success. 

 Direct engineering or willing to attain expertise in Blue Coat ProxySG, SA, CA/MA or SSLV, Check Point, Palo Alto Networks, Cisco, Infoblox, Juniper, Aruba, RSA, Sourcefire, VMware, Cisco among others 

 Ability to travel to customer locations  


For immediate consideration email resume to serena.porter@rht.com 


Job Requirements 


Must have excellent customer service skills and a positive attitude. 

 Strong written and verbal communications skills are required as well as good telephone skills and etiquette 

 Network Automation Tools 

 OSCP, GIAC, PCNSE 7 Certification or later, PSE detail oriented, CISSP, CISM, CISA, CEH 

 Experience working with a VAR/Integrator is a plus 


For immediate consideration email resume to serena.porter@rht.com

security engineer.jobDescription:
The Senior Network Engineer will bring advanced knowledge and a new perspective to the design, implementation and maintenance of the overall network infrastructure of the company. We are actively seeking self-motivated candidates who are interested in joining our team. As the Senior Network Engineer, your responsibilities will include but are not limited to: 

Job Responsibilities 

 Design, Implement, Monitor and maintain the overall network infrastructure of the company 

 Provide Tier 3 and Tier 4 escalation support to the customers on day to day basis 

 Performance monitoring, alert monitoring, event correlation and suppression, ticket notification and escalation 

 Troubleshoot and resolves Data Center, Enterprise Wireless related issues 

 Troubleshoot and resolves Security ( Firewall and ISE) infrastructure related issues 

 Participates in certain aspects of user consulting and systems analysis 

 Make recommendations continually on changes in network configuration and hardware to improve delivery of service 

 Provide documentation to support recommendations 

 Suggest improvements to network performance, capacity and scalability 

 Participate in regular on-call rotation as an escalation resource 

 Respond and resolve complex network issues in a timely and systematic fashion 

 Interface frequently with cross discipline support teams (Systems, Database, and Storage) 


Job Requirements 


Desired Skills 

 Aruba Network Access Control 

 Experience with Cisco IOS,IOS-XE Cisco NX-OS 

 Experience with EIGRP and BGP routing 

 Experience with Cisco collaboration environment 

 Experience with SDN technologies like vmware NSX, Microsoft AZURE etc. 

 Ability to multitask in a high pressured situation 

 Knowledge of Meraki or Aruba Wireless Environment. 

 Cisco, Vmware, Mircrosoft,chekpoint and or Palo Alto Networking certifications 

Required Education/Experience  

 7 + Years of experience in complex Data Center and Enterprise LAN/WAN Environments 

 Experience with configuration, design and maintenance of firewall technologies such as Palo Alto, Cisco and Checkpoint 

 Extensive troubleshooting knowledge of Firewalls (ASA, Checkpoint and PAN) 

 Advanced knowledge and experience needed in the following: 

o Cisco Identity Services Engine 

o VPN technologies such as IPSEC, GRE, Anyconnect ssl vpns etc 

o Datacenter networking Devices, Cisco NX-OS, 7K, 9K, 5K, 2K 

o Cisco Wireless Environment 

o Microsoft Visio

security engineer.jobDescription:
Senior IT Security Engineer

DETAILS
Location
: Downtown Dallas, TX

Position Type
: Direct-Hire

Hourly / Salary
: BOE!

Background / Credit Check
: MUST be able to pass a background and credit check, to be considered.

Flex Working Hours
:  There are Flex Schedules available (i.e. 7am-4pm, etc.)

 

JOB SUMMARY


Vaco Technology is currently seeking a Senior IT Security Engineer for a Direct-Hire opportunity located in Downtown Dallas, TX.  The Senior IT Security Engineer will ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of critical information assets.  The Senior IT Security Engineer will primarily focus on the on-going integration, monitoring, maintenance, and configuration of new / existing security infrastructure.  The Senior IT Security Engineer will provide security oversight and engineering recommendations on projects, including development, network infrastructure, and providing QA.  The Senior IT Security Engineer will ensure that existing systems and network configurations are in accordance with established security practices.  The Senior IT Security Engineer will work closely with Internal / External Teams to identify security incidents and issues, etc.

Maintain Security Systems - Web Application Firewalls / Database Firewalls / Network and Host IPS (Intrusion Prevention Systems) / Malware Detection / Analysis Platforms / Data Loss Prevention / Log Aggregators, etc.

Monitor / Maintain Security Systems for Operational / Performance-Relate Issues - Patches / Security Vulnerabilities / Upgrade Availability, etc.

Interface with Internal / External Groups - Build / Maintain Ongoing Relationships for Improving the Security Infrastructure

Identify / Recommend Solutions for Improving Existing Security Infrastructure / Perform Testing and PoCs (Proof-of-Concepts) / Implementation, etc.

IT Security Standards / Methodology (Knowledge) - Understanding Security Processes, etc.

Core IT Management Processes (Understanding) - Change Management / Systems Development Lifecycle / IT Security / IT Operations, etc.

Translate Control Requirements / Recommendations into Actionable Improvements

Prior Experience with IPS (Intrusion Prevention Systems) / IDS (Intrusion Detection Systems) / Endpoint Security / Patching / AV Security Suite / DLP (Data Loss Prevention) / Firewalls / Encryption / Vulnerability Scanners, etc.


JOB REQUIREMENTS

Senior IT Security Engineer

IPS (Intrusion Prevention Systems) / IDS (Intrusion Detection Systems)

Endpoint Security - Symantec (strongly preferred) / McAfee / MS Systems Center, etc.

Symantec AV Security Suite - Endpoint / Mail Server / Messaging Gateway Security

DLP (Data Loss Prevention) - Symantec / Intel / WebSense / EMC / CheckPoint, etc.

Firewalls - CheckPoint / Cisco / Palo Alto / Juniper, etc.

Encryption - VeraCrypt / AxCrypt / Folder Lock / CryptoExpert 8, etc.

Vulnerability Scanners (required) - Symantec / Core Security / Qualys, etc.

security engineer.skills: Network and Application Security, security strategy, CISSP
security engineer.jobDescription:
Premier Insurance firm is seeking a Senior Security Engineer resposible for researching, designing and integrating information security service solutions and controls globally. 

Responsibilities:
 
The Senior Security Engineer is principally responsible for researching, designing, and integrating information security solutions and controls across the global enterprise in a way that is transparent to end users, supports executive strategies, and fundamentally ensures the security of the information the firm is entrusted to protect.  The Senior Security Engineer is responsible for conducting industry research on new and emerging security technologies in support of enhancing and maintaining evolving corporate strategies to ensure that security solutions will exhibit high levels of performance, security, scalability, maintainability, appropriate reusability and reliability upon deployment over $13 billion in revenue generation.

 
The Senior Security Engineer will design network security perimeter architecture, review internal and external IT projects and applications for risk and adherence to security policies, standards, and industry best practices.  This position will lead and participate on multiple internal security project teams to evaluate and deploy security technologies globally and to make design recommendations for hardware/software products for the firm.  Must define, document and design secure infrastructure and application architectures within the primary tenants of Availability, Integrity and Confidentiality. 

 
The Senior Security Engineer is responsible for maintaining and updating multiple product road maps supporting the secure infrastructure framework.  This position will provide thought leadership regarding solutions, designs, architecture, integration, support, strategies across the entire organization to include decision making through successful implementation while employing the highest levels of integrity.  Every decision must consider both direct and indirect impacts on the global IT infrastructure.

 
Design, document, and deploy secure infrastructure solutions globally to enhance and evolve the security posture of the firm ensuring data integrity, availability and confidentiality of all data entrusted to the firm to protect.  This includes millions invested in Next Generation Firewall architecture, anti-virus & anti-malware controls, proxy solutions, Data Loss Prevention software, whole disk and removable media device encryption, 2FA and MFA authentication, and PKI technologies.

 
Drive and implement key security strategies within the firm's operating companies designed to protect thousands of applications and servers world-wide from threats.   Responsible to design and implement network security architecture controls in support of hundreds of internal and external business IT projects and applications contributing to revenue growth globally.  Review, assess and signoff on business projects with respect to risk and adherence to security policies, standards, and industry best practices for data protection of company and client data.  Lead project teams to include design, connectivity, and software solutions aligning security, cost, performance, and customer requirements to reach viable secure solutions.

 
Drive technical and strategic direction of the Information Security function across all of the firm's companies globally.  Responsible for maintaining and updating information security technology road maps through industry research, knowledge transfer, continued learning.  Document and maintain comprehensive information security roadmaps and strategies with respect to process mapping, technical diagrams and schematics, standard operating procedures, and technical infrastructure documentation which results in the protection of sensitive information across thousands of applications and thousands of servers world-wide.

 
Partner with and provide information security expertise to the operating companies to provide guidance and direction on secure application hosting for hundreds of internal and client facing application systems.  Assess applications and the associated data flow for risk to sensitive data, systems, or infrastructure.  Collaboratively document security controls and application access requirements associated with hosted applications and systems.

 
End-to-End enterprise-wide tier III troubleshooting of network, desktop, server (hardware & software) and application performance & connectivity across the global MMC wide area network as it relates to Information Security.  Participate in or lead Computer Incident Response Teams (CIRT) as necessary by providing tier III support to mitigate active security incidents possible threatening the Global MMC computing environment

 

Experience:

Minimum 10+ years of advanced network and application security architecture experience with large scale implementations spanning multiple business lines distributed globally.
Strong background as a senior engineer/architect in application security infrastructure and various network technologies to include devices such as firewalls, VPN, intrusion/extrusion detection, vulnerability & risk assessment tools, encryption technologies, virus/worm/malware prevention, E-business and web application technologies, Data Loss Prevention, whole disk & device encryption solutions, two-factor authentication, common Windows (desktop & server) platforms, various UNIX platforms, TCP/IP, SNMP, CGI, HTML and miscellaneous security related toolsets are all required.
Must be familiar with common security controls on both Windows and Unix-based operating systems.
Strong knowledge and experience with Next-Generation Firewalls.  Experience with Cisco and Palo Alto is strongly preferred
Must have strong experience with Internet Application Hosting architectures, best practices and related technologies to effectively protect externally facing applications at the network and host levels.
Strong knowledge of WAF technologies.  Experience with F5 ASM is preferred. 
Strong familiarity with routing, switching, and bridging in both LAN & WAN environments.
Familiarity with common web application technologies such as .NET, Java, TAM, SSL/TLS, load-balancing, etc.
Familiar with common security controls on both Windows and Unix-based operating systems.
Good understanding of Microsoft AD and integration in to secure application hosting environments.
Must be able to quickly and succinctly architect and create technical solution documentation.
Must be a self-starter, work with limited supervision & be able to work well with others in a globally diverse IT environment.
Knowledge specifically on Cisco security platforms (i.e ASA, FirePOWER), Palo Alto, FireEye, McAfee Security Suite, and BlueCoat has a strong advantage.
Knowledge of cryptography as it relates to application and network security is a must.
Experience coding/scripting with common languages such as Java Script, Python & Perl is preferred.
CISSP certification required.  Other Information Security oriented certifications a plus

MINDBANK JOB OPENING


Mindbank Consulting Group currently has an IMMEDIATE need for a Senior Systems Security Engineer


Job ID:                                      21499967JAC


Job Title:                                  Senior Systems Security Engineer 


Location:                                  Quantico, VA 


Clearance:                                M
ust possess an active Top Secret Clearance with ability to secure a favorable                                                CI Polygraph
                           
 


Rate:                                        Salaried W2 position with benefits options/PTO/Holiday Pay/401k and more


Contract Period                       2 year contract


Parking:                                   Free at the Building


For immediate consideration, please send your resume to 
juliann.cruikshank@mindbank.com

POSITION SUMMARY: 


Provide Information Assurance and Security Engineering Support to our government customer.  

PRINCIPLE DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Operate as the Information Systems Security Officer (ISSO) for this specific government agency's division.
Provides security engineering designs and implementation in all aspects of Information Assurance and Information Security (InfoSec) Engineering.  
Assesses and mitigates system security threats/risks throughout the program life cycle
Validates system security requirements definition and analysis; establishes system security designs
Implements security designs in hardware, software, data, and procedures
Verifies security requirements
Function as the systems security subject matter expert (SME) in configuration control board (CCB) meetings
Performs system certification and accreditation planning and testing and liaison activities, and supports secure systems operations and maintenance.

SPECIFIC ROLE:

The Senior Systems Security Engineer shall have a minimum of five years of technical experience performing security requirements analysis for, and system design, of computer systems. 
The Senior Systems Security Engineer shall have a sound, technical aptitude for Audit Log Management, Vulnerability Analysis, and Intrusion Detection.
The Senior Systems Security Engineer shall have a sound, technical aptitude for FISMA Compliance Auditing to include the creation of Configuration Management Plans (CMP), Contingency Plans (CP), Incident Response Plans (IRP), System Security Plans (SSP), and Plan of Action and Milestones (POA&M).
Have a strong understanding of NIST 800-53 Rev 4 Security Controls Assessment.
Experience with all steps in the RMF process to include FIPS199 categorization.
The Engineer shall have prior experience performing vulnerability scanning and remediation planning.
The Engineer shall have competence in Active Directory, VB Scripting, Cyber security, structured analysis and architectural design concepts/methodologies. 
The Engineer shall also possess knowledge of state-of-the-art concepts in open system standards (e.g. OSI, ISO, OSE, TAFIM), design methodologies and tools such as entity relationship/dataflow diagrams and IDEF1x, object oriented principles, and systems engineering practices. 
Some current technologies supported include ePolicy Orchestrator, SPLUNK, Remedy, and Nessus. 
The Senior Systems Security Engineer shall provide system acquisition and program management, team leadership and tutelage to junior members/staff, contract and business management administration, financial management and technical support for this specific government division. 
This support will enable this specific government division to monitor the installation, integration and implementation of automated systems at designated field office locations while monitoring the prime/developmental contractors’ technical, schedule and cost performance.

QUALIFICATIONS/SKILLS & KNOWLEDGE REQUIREMENTS: 

Must possess an active Top Secret Clearance with ability to secure a favorable CI Polygraph

5 or more years technical experience in Information Assurance
CISSP Certification (desired)
CompTIA Security +ce
Must have senior
 experience with FISMA and FIPS 199/200

Must have 8570 compliant certification

Must have a Bachelor’s Degree 
from an accredited college in a related discipline
Must have experience relevant to this job description.


GENERAL INFORMATION:


The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by individuals assigned to this position. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, and skills required of personnel so classified.

The incumbent must be able to work in a fast-paced environment with demonstrated ability to juggle and prioritize multiple, competing tasks and demands and to seek supervisory assistance as appropriate.

 

Please send your resume to: juliann.cruikshank@mindbank.com for immediate consideration.

 

Why work for Mindbank?


 


Mindbank Consulting Group has been providing staffing and consulting solutions to Fortune 1000 companies and government agencies for over two decades strong!  Mindbank works with clients nationwide to offer consultants a broad range of career opportunities and dynamic assignments.

Our team of Sr. Technical Recruiters has over 25 years combined experience in presenting you with ideal opportunities and career guidance as you pursue your next level of advancement.  Our relationship with you and your success is most important!  We listen, respect, advise and follow through to provide you with the best recruitment experience that leads to a successful career assignment.  Let us work on your behalf to bring you to the next level (in your career) (of achievement).

Mindbank Consulting is an equal opportunity employer.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, age, sexual orientation, status as a protected veteran, among other things, or status as a qualified individual with a disability.

Network Security Engineer II

 

Description:

General Responsibilities:


The Security Engineer II will be responsible for analyzing external and internal threats in order to protect sensitive data within network. The Security Engineer II is responsible for insuring all networks have adequate security to prevent unauthorized access. Key Responsibilities are:
Investigate and resolve security incidents
Analyze the effectiveness of the security measures in place
Recommend changes that will improve overall company security

Specific Responsibilities:

Duties include incident handling, incident response and escalation management. Security Engineer II will support network security infrastructure and controls, including, but not limited to Security Incident and Event Management (SIEM), firewalls, VPN, intrusion detection/prevention, Network Behavior Anomaly Detection, Network Level Advanced Malware Protection, TACACS, netflow based tools, URL filtering, NAC etc.
Assist in evaluating and developing solutions for complex network security and protection technologies for enterprise and service provider environment including but not limited to Advanced Breach Detection/Mitigation, DDoS attack detection/mitigation etc.
Perform ticket handling of the security events, ongoing tuning of security solutions, review security infrastructure.
Assist in developing and implementing security incident response and operations process.
Create incident reports, documentation for security events as necessary. Assist with gathering and reporting metrics regarding security events, vulnerabilities, and alerts.
Maintain and enhance the threat/vulnerability management and remediation process. Work with business and technical teams to review vulnerabilities, plan remediation strategy and track items to complete resolution.
Support periodic network and application security penetration testing activities, including scheduling, resources, tool execution, and reporting.
Participate in incident triage, analysis, response, and remediation for network intrusions and attacks.
Assist in conducting periodic audits to assess security/risk in network.
Assist in developing network-specific, system-specific, and application-specific information security policies, guidelines, standards, procedures.
Perform other duties as requested by supervisor

Preferred Experience / Skills:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Telecommunications or Information Technology is required. Master degree is a plus
5+ years technical hands-on security experience
Experience with firewall technologies, IPS/IDS, VPN, SIEM, netflow, NAC, vulnerability scanning tools, URL filtering, DLP and other security tools
Familiarity with Cybersecurity and Risk Management frameworks such as COBIT, NIST and ISO 27001 is a plus
Strong analytical and problem solving skills, with an  ability to assimilate, analyze and correlate large amounts of forensic data from various network, operating system, application, and security devices, logs, and alerts  
Experience in security incident handling, operations and forensics preferred
Experience in handling security for a large enterprise network or service provider network preferred
Strong interpersonal and communication skills
Ability to work well under pressure, meeting multiple deadlines
Ability to present and communicate clearly with technical and non-technical staff as well as senior management
Ability and willingness to take on additional tasks as assigned
Security certifications such as CISSP, CISA, CISM, CRISC, OSCP and SANS GIAC is a plus
